loans.name: Silvia Rafaela

texts.en:
Silvia began selling accessories for babies 6 years ago, because sometimes her husband's business didn't do so well, and he couldn't bring home enough money to cover all the family's expenses. She has 2 daughters who are in University and she would like to see them finish their studies. The income Silvia earns goes to her daughters' University expenses. Now, she needs a $250 loan, which she'll use to buy more merchandise, offer her clients more variety, and to generate more income.

You can help this family assisting the growth of Silvia's business. Be an important part of her and her family's achievements. They need your support and love and are sincerely thankful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Silvia inició con la venta de accesorios para bebé desde hace seis años, porque a su esposo en ocasiones no le iba bien con su negocio, y no conseguía los recursos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Ella tiene dos hijas que actualmente estudian en la universidad, Silvia desea que ellas puedan terminar sus estudios y el ingreso que ella obtiene de sus ventas lo utilizan con este fin. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares con los que incrementará sus productos, para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad y obtener mayores ingresos.

Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, puedes colaborar al crecimiento de este negocio, sé parte importante en los logros de Silvia y su familia, ellos necesitan de tu apoyo y cariño y agradecen sinceramente tu generosidad

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti is a 23 year old mother and is married with one girl who attends elementary school. Her husband Andi is a fisherman, earning about $2.50 in a day. To supplement her husband's income, Siti makes and sells fisherman's nets. She can make one fisherman's net in a day.  Siti needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more materials, thus her working capital will get bigger and will enable her to double her income eventually. She really wants to have more income so that she can have a better life. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola is married and has two daughters, ages 2 and 17. Her husband is a laborer and the salary he receives is too little to cover the basic necessities of the family and the education expenses of the older daughter. This is the reason why Fabiola started her own business selling groceries one year ago. The good service she offers and the good quality of the products she sells have helped increase the number of her customers and made her business grow.

With the increased demand, now Fabiola needs a loan for $925, which she will will use to remodel her store to have a bigger space and to offer better service to her customers. She promises to repay this amount in 6 months. Be an important part of the growth of this business by deciding to support Fabiola.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Fabiola es casada y tiene dos hijas, de 2 y 17 años de edad. Su esposo es obrero y el salario que recibe es muy poco para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y los gastos de la educación de su hija mayor, esta es la razón por la que Fabiola inició su propio negocio con al venta de abarrotes hace un año, el buen servicio que ofrece y la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa le han ayudado a incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Con el incremento en la demanda que ha tenido, ahora Fabiola necesita de un préstamo de $925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su tienda para tener un lugar más amplio y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudar a Fabiola.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti J. is 35 years old and is married. She sells rice, cooking oil, eggs and noodles, usually earning $33 per day. Her husband Oman is a motorbike taxi driver, so his income is not fixed. She needs a $100 loan to improve her shop and hopes that this will earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gladys Clara

texts.es:
Gladys is much admired as a good mother, an example of a hardworker with a lot of courage. She suffered a great deal when her husband left her, though he did come back to her and she decided to give him another chance. They grow bananas, coffee and pineapple, which they sell in the city of Huancayo after they harvest. THey are now looking to expand their sales in the capital as well. This expansion of their business motivates them, and they are dedicating more time to the cultivation and care of their products, while stil taking care of their home and their two sons. One of their sons has decided to attend the university of Huancayo, which makes his parents very proud.

Gladys wants to grow and improve the production of their crops, but they need fertilizers which cost a lot of money during the planting season. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $300 to be able to buy the necessary materials to make her harvest abundant and of the highest quality, better positioning them to sell in the capital. They count on your kind support so they may realize their goals and grow the business.

Doña Gladys es una admirable madre de familia que siempre dio ejemplo de trabajo y coraje a pesar de las adversidades y desengaños que sufrió a consecuencia del abandono de su esposo, quién regreso muy arrepentido y ella ha decidió darle una oportunidad más.Se dedican al cultivo de plátanos, café y piña en su gran extensión de terrenos que después de cosecharlos los llevan a comercializar a la ciudad de Huancayo y ahora con miras de repartirlos también en la ciudad capital.Este nuevo proyecto la anima a seguir esforzándose y ha dedicarle más tiempo a la siembra y al cuidado de sus productos, sin descuidar el cuidado de su casa y de sus pequeños dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos la llena de mucho orgullo porque a pesar de las carencias decidió forjarse un mejor futuro en la universidad de Huancayo.De manera que, doña Gladys, desea incrementar y mejorar la producción de sus frutas pero requiere de abonos y fertilizantes los cuales en esta época de masiva siembra son muy costosos y es por ello su solicitud de 300 dólares, para la compra abonos con el fin de que su cosecha sea abundante y de calidad y que puedan ser apetecibles y agradables para su comercialización y pueda ser un buen comienzo para la transportación de sus productos para la capital. Contamos con su tal gentil contribución para hacer realidad los anhelos de comercialización de doña Gladys.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS SUCH AS FERTILIZER TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF THEIR CROPS, HELPING THEM GROW THEIR BUSINESS AND EXPAND THEIR SALES.

loans.name: Magnolia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magnolia belongs to the Mujeres Virtuosas communal bank, and lives in the district of Callería, department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a salesman, but his income was not enough so Magnolia, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, put up a small store to sell shoes and sandals at the entrance to Market No. 2 in her city.

Currently her business is growing, and now she sells stockings, shoes and sandals. In the mornings she takes care of her housework and after taking care of her children, leaves to go to her business.

With another loan from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 50 pairs of shoes, 10 dozen sandals of all kinds and 10 dozen stockings, since now that the Christmas holidays are coming she has many requests from her customers.

Magnolia is very pleased because her business is going well, and this is an important achievement for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Magnolia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano 11 de Julio 147, del distrito Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no les alcanza, es así que Magnolia, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos decide poner una pequeña tienda de venta de zapatos y sandalias en la puerta del mercado Nº 2 de nuestra ciudad.

En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido, ahora vende medias, zapatos y sandalias. Por las mañanas se dedica a las labores de su casa, después de atender a sus hijos, sale con destino hacia su negocio. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 50 pares de zapatos, 10 docenas de sandalias en todos los modelos y 10 docenas de medias, ya que se acercan las fiestas navideñas y tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes. Magnolia está muy contenta porque le va bien en su negocio, y es un logro muy importante para ella y para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of footwear in bulk.

loans.name: Anak Agung Kadek

texts.id:
In order to have the necessities of day to day life, A. and her family run a small store. A.'s husband is a farmer whose work is never steady. If he is not called off on a new work assignment, he spends his time tending to the garden that he inherited from his parents. In her store, A. sells items necessary in the day-to-day lives of the people in her area. These items include small snacks, various types of sweet drinks and other traditional foods. Starting with only 500,000 Rupiah of her own savings, A. was brave enough to start her own business. She had the courage to start it because her family did not have a steady flow of work. Due to her perseverance, her business continues to grow. Each week she must purchase more goods to replenish her inventory. Her business currently brings in 20,000 to 30,000 Rupiah per day. A. would now like to borrow capitol to improve the condition of her shop and offer more items to her customers so she can increase her profits.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Untuk mencukupi kebutuhan sehari –hari A. bersama keluarganya hanya mengandalkan usaha warungnya. Suaminya adalah seorang petani yang pekerjannya tidak tetap. Kalau ada yang menyuruh barulah ia bekerja sedang waktu tidak ada pekerjaan hanyalah menggarap kebun warisan dari orang tuanya. Barang-barang yang dijualnya A. seperti barang keperluan sehari-hari yang diperlukan oleh masyarakat sekitar seperti makanan ringan, aneka macam minuman ringan dan makanan tradisional lainnya. Dengan modal awal hanya Rp. 500.000.- yang diambil dari tabungannya, A. memberanikan diri untuk memulai usaha ini karena dulunya didalam keluarganya tidak memiliki usaha yang tetap. Dengan ketekunannya sehingga kini usahanya semakin berkembang. Dalam satu minggu A. harus berbelanja untuk melengkapi barang daganganya yang sudah berkurang. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat sekitar Rp. 20.000,- sampai Rp. 30.000,- setiap hari. Dan saat ini A. membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha untuk memperbaiki kondisi warungnya dan menambah kelengkapannya agar keuntungan yang didapat pun bertambah.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her shop and increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora F. is a very hard-working women, who for the past twenty years has dedicated herself to the sale of fruits in the town of Villanueva in the beautiful municipality of Chinandega in Nicaragua. She is a woman of happy and humble character. She established her building with capital obtained from her long-term savings.

She is now the mother of a young son for whom she has the duty to provide education. Her dearest wish is that her son can be educated to be a professional and won’t suffer as she considers she suffered from a very young age with heavy work.

It’s necessary to state that Maria Auxiliadora F. currently doesn’t have a permanent business site, so sells her products in Villanueva park. For this reason she approached CEPRODEL in order to become a beneficiary of credits which she will be able to invest in the purchase of stock and also in the improvement of her business area.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Auxiliadora F. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de frutas en la ciudad de Villanueva de la bella ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es madre de un hijo el cual tiene el deber de brindarle educación ya que es menor de edad. Su mayor anhelo es que su hijo se prepare para poder ser profesional y no sufrir como ella considera que sufrió desde muy joven con trabajos muy pesados.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Maria Auxiliadora F. actualmente no posee un local propio por lo que vende sus productos en el parque de Villanueva. Por esta razón es que acuda a CEPRODEL para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan invertir en la compra de los productos y además en el mejoramiento de su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase fruits

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.en: Maksuda M. lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. She is not married but has 2 children. She trades different sorts of materials and angora wool.  She works directly with the suppliers and her prices are lower than the that of the bazaar. She has a wide assortment and repeat customers.  She is now requesting a KIVA business development loan of 1600 STJ for 7 months for business expansion.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mrs. Farida H. lives in Dhalko. Dhalko is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores, ready-made clothes shops and so on.

Mrs. H. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Amit H. and he is a taxi driver. Her son is studying in primary school.

Four years ago Mrs. H. opened her beauty-parlor to help her husband to upgrade the standard of living of her family. She took 6 months' training for the beauty parlor work from her friend. Her service is for ladies only. Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy various types of make-up tools for her work. She wishes to spend her income to provide better education for her son.

loans.use: To buy make-up tools for her work

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy O. is 42 years old and  married with six children.  She sells timber (logs) and plant. She has been in business since 2004 , which is when she learned this type of work from her friend Mrs. Ehigiator. She needs a loan $1200 to buy more timber so that she can sell it in order to make money to provide her family.

loans.use: To buy more timber(logs) for sale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel never imagined that with the beautiful art of weaving she would be able to get ahead. She learned to do this from her brother Erasmo, who promptly passed his knowledge on to her. Isabel and her husband invested their savings in buying weaving machines. Currently they employ four young staff who enjoy what they do and hope to have their own shop one day. Isabel and her staff don't have sufficient raw materials to work with and hope to get a loan from generous people like you to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Nunca imaginó Doña Isabel que con este bello arte del tejido podría salir adelante, aprendió este oficio de su hermano Erasmo quien con presteza fue inculcándole sus conocimientos; los ahorros con los que contaba Doña Isabel y su esposo lo invirtieron en adquirir máquinas de tejer; actualmente tienen a su cargo a cuatro jóvenes trabajadores quienes se sienten muy contentos con la actividad que realizan y esperan algún día contar con su propio taller.En estos momentos Doña Isabel y sus jóvenes trabajadores no tienen suficiente materia prima para desenvolverse en su actividad y esperan recibir el financiamiento de personas generosas como vosotros para alcanzar sus objetivos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for weaving shop

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.es:
Jessenia has been making foam rubber toys for children for the past four years. She learned how to do this work from her parents who have been making toys for many years. Together with her brother, Jessenia makes the toys in their home and then delivers them to the markets where their products are in demand. However, when the circus is in town, she sells the toys directly to the public. The funds she received was used to buy the material that she needs for the toys. Jessenia would love to have more customers to whom she can sell the toys.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Jessenia se dedica a fabricar juguetes para niños en base a espuma desde hace 4 años. Ella aprendió esta labor por medio de sus padres, quienes trabajan haciendo juguetes desde hace muchos años. Junto con su hermano, ella fabrica los juguetes en su casa y luego los reparte a los mercados, donde le solicitan esta mercadería. Sin embargo, en temporada de circos, Jessenia sale a vender sus juguetes al público. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprar el material que necesita para elaborar los juguetes. A Jessenia le gustaría tener más clientes a quienes ofrecer sus juguetes.

loans.use: To purchase the material she needs to make toys

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años. Se dedica a la agricultura, labor que aprendió desde muy niña y que es hasta hoy la única actividad que realiza, a la cual se dedica todas las mañanas, a limpiar y abonar sus terrenos. Aurora nos cuenta que esta actividad le ayudó mucho para solventar los gastos de su hogar, por ello que se esfuerza al máximo y disfruta de su trabajo, porque desde muy pequeña aprendió a querer sus terrenos de cultivos y a pesar de las dificultades que se presentan, como los altos costos de los abonos y semillas, trata de no dejar de trabajar. Aurora trabaja arduamente con el fin de ofrecer a su menor hijo todo lo necesario para su crecimiento y desarrollo. Ahora, desea ampliar sus terrenos e iniciarse en el cultivo de café, ya que es lo más rentable por esta temporada, más adelante tener una bodega de compra y venta de fruta y café.

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Aurora is 37 years old and lives with her husband and her 4 year old son. She is a farmer, something she learned as a child and up to today it is the only activity that she engages in; every morning she cleans and fertilizes her lands. Aurora tells us that this activity has helped cover the costs of her home, which is why she is trying to get the most out of it and she also enjoys herself. As a little girl she learned to love her farmland regardless of the difficulties that often arise such as the high cost of fertilizer and seeds and tries not to stop working. Aurora works hard in order to offer her youngest child everything necessary for their growth and development. Now, she would like to expand her land and start cultivating coffee, which is more profitable in this season. In the future she would also like to have a store for the buying and selling of fruit and coffee.

loans.use: Expand her land for the cultivation of coffee.

loans.name: Mwatima

texts.en:
Mwatima is 29 years old and married. She has been a firewood and spice seller since 2002. Everyday she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Mwatima has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania (Kiva's Field Partner) to expand her business. Mwatima now requests a loan to expand her business further by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Tojikul

texts.en: Tojikul F. is a responsible father of four children who has always watched over his family’s financial security. He accomplishes this by means of caring for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small patch of land. When he got married, he only owned a few number of cattle. Now, thanks to his efforts and dedication, he owns four cows to fatten and sell at the local market. He holds high hopes for the present season. He wants to provide a secure environment for his family and save the money needed for the marriage of his adult sons. For this purpose, Tojikul requests a loan of 2000 Somoni (S600 USD) for the term of 12 months in order to purchase more cattle. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Bushra Parveen Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is the wife of Abdullah K. and lives in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. Bushra baji completed her education till 5th standard. She couldn't continue her education due to her father's low income. Bushra baji is a mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has an engine oil selling business. The next to him has a fruit selling business. The younger to him is in 7th standard. Her youngest son is in kindergarten. Her elder daughter is in 5th standard and her younger daughter is in 3rd standard. Bushra baji's husband is a milk seller and has been selling milk for the past 10 years. Bushra baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family.

Bushra baji has a dream of giving her children a good education. The reason behind this dream is that she wanted to get higher education herself but due to her father's low income, she couldn't fulfill her wish. Now she has the opportunity to fulfill her dream through her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her son so that he is able to expand his business and earns good profits.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy marbles for her marble selling business. Kaneez baji and Sharifan baji each want a loan to buy more shoes for their shoe selling businesses. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Mrs. Juleta S. B. is 70 years old and lives in Brgy. Paz, Libertad, Antique. She was married to Mr. Iluminado B. who died 5 years ago. They were blessed with 3 children. They started with nothing because they both came from poor families. Despite their economic status, the couple wanted to raise their children for a better future.  She is very thankful that her children are kind and responsible in their studies. With God's blessing and their industry and determination, two of her children have already finished their studies. 

At the age of 70, without a partner in life, she runs a small sari-sari store to earn income to provide for her needs. She does not want to depend on her children because they have their own family needs. As long as she is strong she won’t give up because of her dreams for her grandchildren. 

She felt a little doubt about joining ASHI because of her age. But the institution trusted her and she became a member. She dreams of helping not only herself but also her entire family, especially her grandchildren. She hopes that someday her small sari-sari store will be a grocery store. She wants to borrow PHP 5,000.00 (USD $125) to sustain her business.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 67 años de edad, es soltera y tiene a su cargo a sus sobrinas y a una tía. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 aumentó su capital y compró verduras para venderlas en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que se dedica desde hace 55 años a la comercialización verduras.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará verduras para vender en las fiestas de navidad, además de pagar compromisos adquiridos.

La señora Francisca desea continuar trabajando para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 67 years old, single, and she takes care of two nieces and an aunt. With the first loan for S/.300 she increased her capital and bought vegetables to sell in her stand. She has been working with the communal bank for almost 4 years and she tells us that she has been selling vegetables for 55 years. With this loan for S/.2,000, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy vegetables to sell in the Christmas holidays and in addition pay some debts she has. Francisca wishes to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is 42 years old, married and a mother with six children; one is at senior high school, while the rest are in primary and junior high school. She has been selling cocoa drink and sachet mineral water for the past three years now. Cocoa drink is prepared with powdered cocoa; water is added to it with sugar and then it is left in a fridge for a while. It is served while chilled and is taken with bread. This is mostly purchased by school children because it's a tasty drink.

Felicia A. wants the loan to make headway so that she can buy more cocoa powder, sugar, loaves of bread and rubber bags. With the loan, she believes she can produce in larger quantity. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy more cocoa powder, and sachet mineral water.

loans.name: Johnbosco's Group

texts.en:
E. Lubega is married with 6 kids. He cares for his other 3 kids and pays school fees for all his children except one who is not in school. His eldest child is in secondary school. E. has a retail shop, which he has been running for 2 years, as well as a farming business that produces coffee, which has been running for considerably longer. All his businesses are in a local trading center. He also has had a solar power business for 8 months for charging mobile phones since his neighborhood has no electricity. In a week he makes a profit of 5000 ugsh. 

He says he has been successful in his business because he has no competition and he treats his customers well. Getting a loan has helped him because it has enabled him to pay for the capital requirements of his business. His business dream is to open another retail shop in a much bigger town.

He has requested a loan amount of 1,000,000 ugsh. His plan is to restock his retail shop. He also plans to buy a refrigerator so he can start selling cold drinks. This is his 6th loan from PEARL. (In the photo are 23 people of which 3 are staff from Pearl Microfinance).

loans.use: Restock his retail shop, farm labor

loans.name: Abdurozik

texts.ru: Носиров Абдурозик  1957 года рождения женат имеет 4 детей. Сотрудничает  с Микроинвест  с 2008 года.  Бизнес торговля печками.По настоящее время  был сезон торговли печек, его жена также помогает  в бизнесе, она предложила ему новый вид бизнеса так как спрос на печки только в зимний период , а весной можно начать торговлю женской одежды. Дети  помогают в бизнесе  родителям. Также он работает в TOYOTA –CENTRE имеет заработную плату, что помогает поддерживать стабильность дохода в семье.
texts.en:
Abdurozik N. was born in 1957, is married, and has four children. He has been working with MicroInvest since 2008. He sells heaters. It is currently the season to sell heaters. His wife also helps with the business. She has suggested to him that they should expand into another type of business since there is only demand for heaters in winter. They can start selling women’s clothing in the spring. The children help their parents with the business. He also works at TOYOTA–CENTRE, and his wages help maintain a stable income for the family.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil H. is 62-year-old man who lives with his wife and three sons in Nablus City, Palestine. Khalil has been working as a plumber for 20 years. He also has a shop for plumbing items.

Khalil is requesting a loan of $1,000 US in order to do some maintenance work on his machines and to purchase more goods for his shop. Khalil would like to thank you in advance for your support!

loans.use: Purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Jacklyn

texts.en:
Jacklyn owns a small beauty salon and she is a salon items seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Mtaji wa masiki loan group (Group code 2067). She currently earns a very small monthly profit. Daily she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more salon items like shampoo, hair oil, and weave-ons for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Jacklyn is single, and has two children: ages 3 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more salon items like shampoo, weave-ons, and hair oil for re-sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. manages a small cornfield in her village. She rents the land for Php 1,000 and all her produce is sold to corn traders in the nearby town. Corn is popular in Agusan del Sur. People love corn a lot, especially when boiled. Teresita is 51 years old, married and has three children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy herbicide and fertilizer for her farm. Insects are very harmful to her crops. She wants to protect her corn from any form of infliction by spraying regularly with herbicides. 

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It provides not only loans but also training and insurance coverage services to support small businesses.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizer

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Азамов Алишер проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 22 года. Холост. Живет с родителями в большой и дружной семье. Занимается животноводством. Отец работает в дехканеском хозяйстве. Уход за животными производит сам Алишер. Кроме того он учиться в университете. В его отсутствие за животными присматривает его мать и сноха. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличитьо поголовье скота. Он сможет купить одного породистого бычка.
texts.en:
Alisher A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents and large, friendly family. He practices animal husbandry. His father works on a small farm. Alisher makes a profit from his work with the animals, in addition to studying at the university. When he is gone his mother and daughter in law look after the animals. He decided to request a loan in order to expand his herd. He will be able to buy one pure-bred calf.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock herd

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth B. is a 27-year-old entrepreneur and mother of one child. She has a sari-sari ('various kinds') store business. She started a small store using her savings of 5,000 PHP. Every day she earned an average of 300 to 600 PHP from the store. This income enabled her to pay all her household expenses. Lilybeth is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. The loan will help increase the capital size of her business.

About CEVI
CEVI helps small business to grow. It provides its clients not just with loans but with training and insurance cover as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mavdjigul

texts.en: N. Mavdjigul is 40 years old and is married with four children. She has a tailoring business sewing national women’s dresses. Her workmanship is very good and, being young, she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business. Mavdjigul has had this business for twenty-one years and has gained a lot of experience. With her loan, she will buy more material for sewing dresses. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses, and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden S. is from the village of Purok 9B Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Eden is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eden works in someone else's business venture in the retail sector operating as a dealer. The main source of income for the business comes from daily peddling of beauty products by Avon and Fullerlife in the local community. Eden is just starting this business. She has also a DVD rental business.

In 2009, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Alice Muthoni

texts.en:
Alice Muthoni N. is a 39-year-old seamstress; she is married and they have three children.  She is a seamstress specialized in making bed covers and curtains. She has been in the market for about 20 years making a monthly profit of about kshs 30,000.

Alice was introduced to KADET by a friend. She was a client of another MFI but moved to KADET after relocating to Nairobi.  With her loan, Alice intends to add more materials in order to meet her  increasing client needs. She hopes to scale up the making of bedding and upholstery, targeting urban clients.



About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: Buying more materials for sewing

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 2 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la educación secundaria incompleta (1er grado), vive en el Barrio Lacaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar papa para la elaboración de tunta (chuño blanco) y chuño.  Ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace algún tiempo.

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando y darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las facilidades en los préstamos y la puntualidad

loans.use: Para la compra de papa.

loans.name: Bertha Martha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, ella estudio secundaria incompleta (3ro grado), y  vive   en la parcialidad de Jamachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra de ovejas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2300.00 nuevos soles, este monto ella lo va a utilizar en la compra de ovejas y algunos chanchos, para luego venderlos en las ferias de ganado que son los domingos en Ilave.

Su deseo es darles una profesión a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovejas y chanchos.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Las Pioneras” se formo en el año 2006, integrada por  10 socios quienes se encuentra ubicados en la zona alta D. Huaycan, distrito D. Ate, departamento Lima y realizan diversas actividades como: venta D. chupetes, venta D. ropa, venta D. cereales, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. bolsas comerciales, venta D. productos D. belleza, prestan servicio D. costura y locutorio, etc.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 3 años, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal  la señora Albina Q., quien se integro a la alcancía desD. hace 1 año y 4 meses, ella es natural D. Lima, tiene 48 años conviviente  y con 2 hijos. Albina se dedica  a la venta D. productos D. belleza y en la temporada D. verano se dedica a la venta D. chupetes y gelatinas en los colegios, viene trabajando en este negocio, gracias a una amiga que la ánimo a participar y poder ganarse así un ingreso adicional sin descuidar D. sus hijos.
Con su reciente préstamo comprara productos D. belleza en oferta para poder venderlos a sus clientes y así poder generar  más  ingresos para su hogar.
 En el futuro le gustaría mucho poder construir su casa, mejorar en nivel D. educación D. sus hijos y también llegar a establecer un negocio D. venta D. comida.
texts.en:
The communal piggy bank, "Las Pioneras", formed in the year 2006 and is maD. up of ten members who are located in the high zone of Huaycan, Ate district, Lima department and work in different areas such as selling lollipops, clothing, cereal, groceries, shopping bags, beauty products, sewing services or phone services, etc. They have worked with EDAPROSPO -- Prosperidad for three years. Currently, Albina Q., who joined a year and four months ago, assumes the role of president of the communal piggy bank. She is a native of Lima, is 48 years old and lives with her partner and has two children. Albina is dedicated to selling beauty products and, in summer, she sells lollipops and gelatins at schools. She came to work in this business thanks to a friend who encouraged her to participate and in this way she was able to earn an additional income without neglecting her children. With her recent loan, she will purchase beauty products on sale in order to be able to sell them to her customers and be able to generate M. income for her home. In the future, she would like to be able to build a house, improve the level of education of her children and also establish a business selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase beauty products on sale in order to be able to sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Nuria

texts.en:
Nuria is a Nairobi-based businesswoman who operates a boutique as well as rental units in Embakasi. She has been running this business for the last seven years after leaving employment where she worked as a teacher. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add to her inventory of clothes. A 45-year-old mother of two, Nuria hopes to start importing clothes directly and on a personal level to establish a stable family. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Flavia's Group

texts.en:
N. Flavia, the leader of this lending group, makes chicken feed. At the moment, all Flavia’s children are out of school but she helps to take care of some orphans. She is a hardworking lady.

Flavia makes chicken feed from fresh animal blood, shells and bones. She employs people to go to Lufula slaughterhouses to collect the fresh blood in cans. She boils this with ingredients from Ugachick Poultry Breeders Limited in Gayaza, as an independent producer. Once done, she sells to Ugachick itself, although the payments take two weeks to come through. This is one reason she also sells to other firms that pay instant cash for her to remain in business.

Her previous loan helped her renovate her recently built house and now she needs a loan to help buy more raw materials for her business. She also wants to put a concrete floor in her house to get rid of the dust. She is very grateful for her previous loans and those to come.

loans.use: To buy materials for her chicken feed business and cement for making a concrete floor

loans.name: Nghiêm's Group

texts.en:
"Quý Nghiêm Thị (20201070014) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Quý is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 02 (2).


Quý is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Quý owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling animal feed & farm-related products in the local community.  Quý has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5.600.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Quý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Quý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Quý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn V. M. (20201070015) is a 27 year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business in the services sector providing recycling services.


2.  Nguyễn K. N. (20201070016) is a 39 year-old male who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support his business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  Trương Thị D. (20201070017) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070018) is a 60 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  Nguyễn Thị L. (2020010719) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Quý Nghiêm Thị (20201070014) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Quý là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm thức ăn gia súc & có liên quan đến nông trại trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Quý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quý kiếm được khoảng 5.600.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Quý đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quý đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn V. M. (20201070015) là 27 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


2.  Nguyễn K. N. (20201070016) là 39 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  Trương Thị D. (20201070017) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20201070018) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  Nguyễn Thị L. (2020010719) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials in bulk

loans.name: Sérieux Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Sérieux sont majoritairement des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne  48 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Bougoula Hameau un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. Le premier   prêt a été bien remboursé. 
Elles font entre autre la transformation, la restauration et la vente  de tissus,  de sounbala, du haricot cuisiné, des produits de beauté etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,1quinzaine de tissus pour hommes et femmes, 2 sacs de 100kg de graines de néré pour faire du  sounbala, 150kg de graines de haricot ,  20 litres d’huile, 5 colis de produits de beauté, 100kg de riz, 200kg de pommes de terre et 3 paquets  de condiments pour faire la restauration.  
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au marché de Bougoula Hameau et à domicile, au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles espèrent bien entretenir leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et son partenaire Kiva afin d’améliorer leur cadre de vie.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sérieux group are mainly married women with an average age of 48, an average of three children, and generally live in polygamous families in Bougoula Hameau, a village in the Sikasso municipality- the third largest administrative region in Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation in order to meet their customers' demands, and are on their second loan. The first was successfully repaid. They are involved in food processing, catering, and in the sale of fabrics, sounbala, cooked beans, and beauty products, among other things. With their new loan, they aim to buy about fifteen sheets of fabric for men and women, two 100kg bags of néré seeds for making sounbala, 150kg of bean seeds, 20 litres of oil, five parcels of beauty products, 100kg of rice, 200kg of potatoes and three packs of condiments for catering. They source their goods from the Sikasso town market and from neighbouring villages. They sell their retail ware at the Bougoula Heamu market and through home sales; they take cash or credit payments from a customer base of men and women. The women envisage making an average monthly profit of 32.500 FCFA each, a part of which would be used for savings and their families' needs, and the rest would be reinvested in business activities. They hope to maintain their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and its partner Kiva in order to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various items.

loans.name: Korb

texts.en: Mrs. Korb N. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nak Sophal, is a duck breeder. Since his poultry business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Korb N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food for breeding. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 41 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Mostafa has been working as a taxi driver since 2001. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him purchase his car for his work, since he used to rent a car for his transportation.

Mostafa is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his students, friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Mostafa decided on this business because he didn’t want to work for someone anymore, he wanted to have an independent work life.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina P. is from the village of Guinsiliban on the island province of Camiguin. She is 40 years old and married with 7 school-aged children. Rosalina is going to start providing motorcycle services, transporting passengers in the local community, for a business managed by her husband. Rosalina also has a mini sari-sari store as a source of income.

Rosalina joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a 5000 PHP loan, and is now requesting her second HSPFI loan, for 6000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Аюбов Манучехр проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 23 года. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, зам. директор в одной организации. Сам Манучехр более 4 лет занимается торговлей. Он закупает и продает мясо крупно- рогатого скота. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Manuchehr A. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 23 years old, married and has one child. His wife is an assistant director at one organization. Manuchehr has been involved in retail sales for over 4 years. He buys and sells beef. He is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Margarita Rosa

texts.es:
Margarita Rosa Y. R. es una empresaria cartagenera de grandes metas que sueña con que su negocio de venta de comidas crezca tanto, que sus productos sean reconocidos en toda la ciudad y que algún día, ella sea identificada como una gran empresaria colombiana. Inició su actividad de vender almuerzos hace tres años; inicialmente elaboraba la comida en su casa vendiéndola a sus vecinos, hasta que uno de ellos le comentara que donde él trabajaba no había quien vendiera almuerzos; fue así como Margarita se instaló en la Zona Industrial de Mamonal, lugar cercano a Cartagena que concentra  muchas empresas importantes del país. En ese momento  prestó un dinero para comprar la materia prima y preparar los almuerzos, que requería ser devuelto al día siguiente. 
Poco a poco fue creciendo su clientela y como el negocio ameritaba una inyección de capital, se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que le agradece haberle dado la oportunidad de sacarlo adelante, aumentar un poco su ingreso y reemplazar el préstamo que debía devolver al día siguiente. Este crédito con un monto de $2.000.000 es su segundo financiamiento y con él va a comprar materia prima para la preparación de sus comidas y sillas y mesas que adecuarán su negocio. Como la Fundación la ha  apoyado personal y financieramente,  hoy siente que debe serle fiel; su crédito anterior la ayudó a aumentar sus ganancias y a crecer en cobertura en el sector en que trabaja con servicios de mejor calidad; tiene dos empleadas y se siente contenta porque está generando ingresos familiares en otros hogares que están como el suyo.
La señora Margarita considera que su mayor dificultad fue enfrentar la vida sola con sus tres hijos; pero gracias a Dios pudo salir adelante y hoy se siente feliz  sabiendo que está esforzándose, para que sus hijos avancen; a ellos les ha enseñado que la vida no es fácil y que con esfuerzo, dedicación y mucho amor se logran propósitos. Esta su lección,  la ayuda a entender las dificultades como parte de la vida y del negocio; por ejemplo: en tiempos de ventas bajas, cuando  no genera  los ingresos suficientes para responder a requerimientos  superiores a las necesidades básicas de su familia y  de su negocio, ella logra salir adelante aunque retrase el cumplimiento de sus sueños, porque ella sabe que es prioridad reinvertir en su negocio, para asegurar su sosteniendo y el de su familia.
texts.en:
. Margarita Rosa Y. R. is a businesswoman from Cartagena who has ambitious goals for her food business; she hopes it will grow to such an extent that her products will be known city-wide and that, some day, she will be recognized as one of Colombia’s greatest businesswomen. She started her business selling breakfasts three years ago. Initially, she made the meals at home and sold them to her neighbors until one of them mentioned to her that where he worked there was no one selling meals. This was how Margarita set herself up in the Mamonal Industrial Zone, a site near Cartagena that concentrates many of the country’s important companies. She borrowed money that had to be repaid the next day to buy raw materials and prepare the lunches. Gradually, her customer base grew. Since the business needed an injection of capital, she called upon Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization to which she is grateful for giving her the opportunity to launch her business, to increase her income a bit, and to replace the money for that loan she needed to repay the next day. This $2.000.000 loan is her second one and she will use it to buy ingredients for her meals as well as tables and chairs for her business. Because the Fundación has supported her both financially and personally, she feels very loyal to it. Her previous loans helped her increase her profits and to expand her service area in her type of work with better quality service; she has two employees and she is happy because she is generating income in other homes like hers. Margarita considers her greatest challenge to be having to face life alone with her three children. However, thanks to God she was able to overcome and today she is happy knowing that she is making the effort for her children to advance. She has taught them that life isn’t easy but that with effort, dedication and lots of love, one can reach one’s goals. This is her lesson. It helps her to face difficulties as part of life and business. For example, when sales are down and they barely produce sufficient income to meet basic needs of her family and her business, she forges ahead even if she has to delay reaching her dreams because she knows that the first priority must be to reinvest in her business so that she can be sure to provide for her family’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals and tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Tabither Moraa

texts.en:
Tabither is married to Godfrey and has two children: Brighty and Bravin.

Tabither joined KADET through existing clients. Tabither has been running a retail shop business for two years and with the loan she has applied for, she intends to add more stock of things like tea leaves, sugar, margarine, soap and others. Tabither's clients live along the railway line and therefore she has many customers. With the extra profits, she plans to open up a wholesale shop as she hopes to become a serious saleswoman in the supermarket with all the commodities.

Tabither describes herself as polite and objective.

loans.use: Expand her retail business by adding items like tea leaves, sugar and others

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en:
Nathalie is 40 years old and married. She has six children between 3 and 20 years old.

Nathalie sells new clothes, mainly children's clothes. She has been in this business for about 5 years. Her business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Nathalie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business bu adding a variety of styles such as jeans for old people and women's clothes. She expects to start selling children's shoes, because many of her clients have children.

loans.use: Adding a variety of styles to her clothing store

loans.name: Koumba

texts.fr:
Madame   Koumba C. est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari  dans quartier Pelengana sud de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Aide soignante de formation, en plus de ce métier elle fait le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat vente, de temps à autres, de téléviseurs, de radios, de magnétoscopes, de riz et du lait en poudre (en sachets et en sacs)  depuis maintenant 15 ans  
Elle bénéfice d’une fidèle  clientèle qui est constituée du corps médical et d’autres fonctionnaires de la place.
 Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 5 ans, après 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts  individuels tous  remboursés correctement. 
Elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 10 sacs de lait en poudre et quelques cartons de sachets de lait en poudre  à Tombouctou.  
Madame  Koumba C. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 60.000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépense familiales et de terminer sa maison en construction.
texts.en:
Mrs. Koumba C. is 46 years old, married and the mother of three chilrden. She lives with husband and children in the South Pelengana district of Ségou, in the fourth administrative region of Mali. She is a nursing aide by profession, but in addition she occasionally trades in various items, such TV sets, radios, videotape players, rice and powdered milk (in packets and in bags). She has been doing this for 15 years now. She has a loyal customer base, composed from healthcare workers and other local employees. In order to increase her business capital and better meet customer demand, she has turned for help to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been dealing with Soro Yiriwaso for five years, and had three joint loans and three individual loans, all properly reimbursed. This would be her fourth individual loan, and she plans to use it for purchasing ten bags of powdered milk and several cartons of packets of powdered milk in Tombouctou. Mrs. Koumba C. sells for cash and in credit to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 60,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to manage the family budget and to finish the construction of her home.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of powdered milk (for resale)

loans.name: Savarn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Savarn S. is 43 years old and the leader of a group loan. She was selected by five members who are located in Kaoh Kaev Leu village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Savarn S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She also owns a small store to sell her goods. For her grocery business, Mrs. Savarn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business and hire people to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Sokhom Seng, is a policeman who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children who all are students in the local school and also supports their mothe ???

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl ,de 42 años, convive con su pareja y tienen tres hijos pequeños.Juntos residen en una comunidad ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa que es  propia.Raúl es una persona totalmente exigente. Recuerda que vivía con poco dinero ; y convenció a su esposa, para ampliar  más su terreno agrícola, ya que solo trabajaban en pequeñas parcelas. El dinero que ganaban ,con la venta de sus productos , no les alcanzaba. Es por eso que en la actualidad produce mayor cantidad de cacao, y sus ganancias han mejorado bastante . Siente que todavía hay muchas cosas por realizar en esta vida , es por esta razón que en el futuro tiene pensado comprar más terrenos de cultivo, de otros productores, con la finalidad de sembrar otros productos como café y frutas cítricas. Pero sabe muy bien que debe ir a paso lento , pero seguro , y se esfuerza todos los días en su trabajo, cuida con esmero sus plantaciones para que no sean dañadas por plagas . Trabaja junto a su esposa, durante 10 horas diarias, pero en temporada de sembrío y cosecha contrata a  peones para que le puedan facilitar la extracción de su producto final.Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además está eternamente agradecido con su grupo comunal, por la organización y solidaridad que muestran en el trabajo conjunto.Raúl tiene pensado  invertir el dinero solicitado en brindarle  mantenimiento adecuado a su terreno de cultivo , y para esto comprará abono y fertilizantes, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Raul, 42 years old, lives with his partner and they have three small children. They live together in a community located at the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own home. Raul is a very demanding person. Considering that he lived with little money and convinced his wife to increase the size of their farm land, since they worked in small parcels and the money they were making from the sale of their products was not enough. Currently they produce a larger quantity of cacao and their profits have increased considerably. He still feel that there are many things to be accomplished in this life, and for this reason he is planning to buy more farmland in the future from other producers, with the goal of planting other products such as coffee and citrus fruit. He knows very well that he needs to move at a slow and secure pace, and works hard every day, takes good care of his crops so that they are not damaged by pests. He works together with his wife for 10 hours of every day. At planting and harvest times, he hires laborers to help him get his final product. This is a second loan with MFP and he commits to pay his installments on time. Also, he is eternally grateful to his community group for the organization and fellowship that they show in their team work. Raul is planning to use the loan money to provide adequate maintenance to his fields by buying manure and fertilizer with the purpose of improving the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and supplies for the care of his crops.

loans.name: God Is In Control Group

texts.en:
Esther N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "God Is In Control". She is 43 years-old, unmarried and has three children who range from 16 to 28 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade. She also cares for two siblings and all of her children are attending school. 

For nine years, she has been selling used clothes at the Ma-Juah Market in Monrovia, Liberia.  She says customers are attracted to her business because she talks to them in a friendly manner.

She plans to use her 20,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 44,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. She describes herself as a determined woman.
 
Her goal is to expand her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, pepper and oil

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 51 years old and single. She has been selling second-hand clothes since 2008 and also farms for extra income.

Agnes’s business has really grown since she joined Wanjaka group in Faulu Kenya. This is because she uses her savings with the group to improve her business. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to add to her stock. She hopes to open other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José  tiene 48 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, está acompañado, y se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles.
Hace 20 años aprendió a trabajar la tierra, lo padres le inculcaron el trabajo y actualmente esta cultivando maíz y frijoles, solicita un préstamo para compra de fertilizante y espera obtener un cultivo que le permita vender una parte y  otra para consumo de la familia, generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas del familia.
Los sueños son mejorar la vivienda y además continuar con un negocio que le permita mejorar el sistema de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and lives in the town of Lolotiquillo, in the Morazán department. He is married and raises corn and beans. He learned how to work the land 20 years ago. His parents started him on this work an now he is raising corn and beans. He is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizer. He hopes to be able to obtain a large enough harvest so that he can use part of it to feed his family and sell the rest to earn an income with which to provide for his family’s basic needs. He hopes to be able to make improvements to his home, continue with his business, and improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Benso 3 Group

texts.fr:
Benso 3 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 42 ans,  3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Maban, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, l’arachide, le pois de terre et le haricot. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ARATOU MAMADOU D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de  main d’œuvre pour entretenir environs 1,5  hectare petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 70.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
Benso 3 is a group of ten married women who average 42 years of age, have three children each and live in polygamous families in Maban, one of the villages in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of better organising their winter activities. They grow pearl millett, peanuts, peas and beans. They are on their third farming loan and the previous loans have been repaid in full. With this new loan, Aratou Mamadou Dembelle is planning on buying intrants and small materials as well as paying the labor costs of maintaining around one and a half hectares of pearl millet and peanuts. The produce is sold after the harvest in the towns of Dioïla and Massiqui to a customer base made up of men and women. She is counting on making a profit of 70.000FCFA at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Intrants, labor and small materials

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 24 years old and is single. Joel owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Joel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mr. S. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help him provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. He has another partner in his wife, who owns farmland that she uses to grow crops. S. has four children who are no longer in school. One of his children is employed and the other three are jobless. S. wants to encourage his unemployed children to have suitable jobs so he is requesting a loan for his children to use as capital to begin a tailoring service from home.

loans.use: To begin a tailoring service.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
A. Yasin is 50 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill in the West Nile region of Uganda.  He is married and has 6 children.  Four of his children are currently in school.  Yasin has a butcher shop, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Yasin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more  meat.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yasin hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Yasin hopes to own a firm.

loans.use: buying meat for resale

loans.name: Koudzo

texts.fr: koudzo est un monsieur qui est célibataire; pour pouvoir se prendre en charge et satisfaire ses besoins. il a ouvert sa petite boutique de vente d'habits qu'il a appelé "EDDLE UNISEXE STORE"; il s'approvisionne à lomé notamment dans le marché de hedzranawoé. il a une expérience de 2 ans dans ce commerce. face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 pantalons, 18 chemises Homme, 2 chemises dames, 12 t-shirts, 10 jupes et 20 robes
texts.en: Koudzo is a young single man; in order to meet his everyday needs, he opened a small clothing shop called 'Eddle Unisexe Store'. He sources his goods from Lomé, particularly from the Hedranaowoé market. He has been involved in this trade for two years. He is facing a drop in his stock levels and so is seeking a loan in order to purchase 10 pairs of trousers, 18 men's shirts, 2 women's blouses, 12 t-shirts, 10 skirts and 20 dresses.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “CORAZON DE JESUS DE CCATCCAPAMPA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ezequiel;   él tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos,  El socio es natural de Ocongate,  Él socio trabajaba como carpintero el tiene un pequeño taller instalado en su casa y desde ahí fabrica muebles, el desea en un futuro poder tener un buen taller en el cual tenga todas las herramientas necesarias para así poder realizar trabajos con acabados de primera y poder hacer variedad de muebles. Por ahora el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar unas pequeñas herramientas como martillos, clavos, un poco de madera.  El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Ezequiel is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazon de Jesus de Ccatccapampa”, which is located in the District of Ocongate in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Ezequiel is a native of Ocongate. He works as a carpenter from a small workshop established in his home where he makes furniture.
