In the future, he wants to have a nice workshop with all the necessary tools so that he can provide first rate work and produce a variety of furniture. At the moment, Ezequiel is requesting a loan to buy a few supplies such as hammers, nails, and some wood.

He appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase hammers, nails, and wood

loans.name: Mujeres Generosas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora María Gladys Núñez es de  Monday_Minga Guazú quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina Mujeres Generosas, están en el Cuarto Ciclo, con 18  integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, realizan actividades para recaudar fondos  y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución. 
Así como la señora Maria todas solicitaron el préstamo para invertir en sus emprendimientos.
La señora  Maria se dedica a la venta de ropas, esta actividad le conviene mucho por que las mercaderías son muy baratas que ella trae de la frontera por lo tanto tiene buena ganancia con la misma.
Ella vende sus mercaderías en su casa, y lo hace al contado y a crédito, dependiendo de los clientes.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, blusas, vestidos, shorts, y otros.
texts.en:
For the formation of this committee, it was María Gladys Núñez, from Monday, Minga Guazú, who contacted her neighbors and friends to create a committee in her area.

The committee is called "Mujeres Generosas" ["Generous Women"], and they are in their fourth loan cycle, with 18 members. It is a group that is noteworthy in their neighborhood for being very united and responsible, with a strong sense of solidarity. The members possess a great entrepreneurial spirit; they are up-tp-date with their payments; they carry out activities to raise funds; and they intend to finish this phase with outstanding fulfillment of their responsibilities to the institution. 
 
Like Maria, all of them are requesting the loan to invest in their enterprises. 

Maria's work is selling clothing. She enjoys this activity very much, since the merchandise she brings from the border is very cheap, and thus she obtains a good profit from it. She sells her merchandise from her home, and she does it both for cash and credit, depending on the customers. 

She is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, blouses, dresses, shorts, and other items.

loans.use: Buying clothing such as dresses, blouses, t-shirts, shorts and others

loans.name: Alaisa

texts.en:
Alaisa N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.    Alaisa has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Alaisa has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alaisa hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Alaisa hopes to own another business.  Alaisa is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by showing her how to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 39 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de llamadas telefónicas la cual trabaja en forma ambulatoria ya hace un par de años atrás ,siendo esta la única actividad que realiza y por este medio la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar sus celulares y para algunos gastos personales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the San Rafael communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Valentina.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a phone use business, which she runs in an ambulatory manner.  She has already been doing this business for two years and it has been the means by which she has moved her family forward.

Ms. Valentina is requesting this loan to pay for cell phone minutes, as well as for some personal expenses.  She is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to pay for cell phone minutes and personal expenses

loans.name: Ciria

texts.es: Ciria, de 57 años, es una valerosa madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos: Luis, de 23 años, en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está luchadora mujer es la venta de ropa importada en las feria que se realiza constantemente en la ciudad, donde los pobladores esperan ansiosa la llegada de Ciria, que trae ropas novedosas y de moda, según afirma viaja una vez al mes para comprar ropa importada que le cuestan un promedio de 700 dólares. Ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a ello, y le va tan bien que ahora viaja a las ciudades de Pichanaki y Villa Rica, pero a pesar de su éxito, ella también tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Ahora Ciria, quiere ampliar su negocio, con la apertura de una tienda de ropas en el centro de la ciudad. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y conocedora del trabajo que se realiza en su banco comunal, se siente segura de poder contar con personas responsables y muy comprometidas. De obtener el crédito, podrá comprar diversas prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, los cuales venderá en está temporada.
texts.en: Ciria, age 57, is a courageous single mother of 3 children, of whom only one lives with her in her own home: Luis, age 23. Her home is in the city of San Ramon (in the central Peruvian tropical forest). This hard-working woman sells imported clothing in the markets that are constantly happening in the city. The villagers eagerly await her, as she brings original and stylish clothing. She says that she travels once a month to purchase imported clothing that costs an average of 700 dollars. She has been doing this for 2 years, and it is going so well that she now travels to the cities if Pichanaki and Villa Rica. However, despite her success, she also has a food store in her home. Ciria wants to expand her business with the opening of a clothing store in the city center. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and as she knows the work that goes on in her community bank, so she is certain that she can count on responsible and dedicated people. When she obtains this loan, she will be able to purchase diverse articles of clothing for women, men and children, which she will sell this season.

loans.use: to purchase various clothing articles for women, men and children.

loans.name: Maximo Antonio

texts.es: Máximo Antonio tiene su negocio que es ofrecer los servicios de albañil y soldador. Hace más de 21 que tiene este negocio, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que su familia necesita pues lo aprendió desde muy joven y con el paso del  tiempo es que ha ido mejorando. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos ya que sabe que han sido muy beneficiosos para su actividad. Máximo es un padre responsable que siempre está pendiente de lo que su familia necesita. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como herramientas, lentes, guantes, entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en:
Máximo Antonio's business is offering building and welding services.  He has owned his own business for more than 21 years and he is always looking out for his family's needs.  He learned his trade when he was very young and, over time, his business has improved.

This is not the first time that Máximo Antonio has taken out a loan and he knows that his previous loans have been very beneficial for his business.  He is a responsible father who is always looking out for his family's needs.  The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy raw materials such as tools, safety goggles, gloves and other necessary items.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en: Hazem from Al Ashrafia, Amman is 29 years old and a father of 1 child. He has his own buisness specialising in car repair and is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to purchase a car jack to help him fix more vehicles. Hazem is looking to licensing and expanding his shop.

loans.use: Purchase a car jack to help him fix more vehicles

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou S. is a 44-year-old woman and the mother of five children, all of whom are still single and work in different jobs. She currently sells a few soft drinks and cooked ingredients in the village. Mostly her clients are neighbors who live near her house. Her husband helps feed the family by working as a requirement worker. The family's living conditions are now suffering due to their house needing repair. To solve the problem, Sou S. would like a loan to repair a part of her broken house.

loans.use: To repair a part of her broken house

loans.name: Salina's Group

texts.en:
Salina D. C. is from the village of District 1. She is 41 years old. Salina is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Salina D. C. group.

Salina is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Salina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Salina has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Salina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Salina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Salina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. Ella cría los animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y así obtener el peso y tamaño ideal en menos tiempo.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, and is single.  She lives with her parents, in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area in the Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For three years she has raised and sold sheep.  She raises the animals in the back section of her home, and when they have developed to the right level, she offers them for sale to buyers who visit the area where she lives.  She has a loyal, established clientele.  She has requested a loan of 1500 new soles, to buy balanced feed for her animals, and thereby to reach the ideal weight and size in less time.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento "CORAZÓN D. MARIA" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro D. L. Institución,  este grupo tiene a 11 integrantes D. los que 1 es hombre,  sus actividades están entre venta D. ropa, comidas, venta D. bisutería, panadería, venta D. salteñas, venta D. empanadas D. pollo y refrescos. Las señoras son D. L. zona del 5to anillo. El grupo se fundo por L. iniciativa D. L. Sra. Mary quien ya ha trabajado antes con créditos en Emprender, elL. se dedica a L. elaboración D. bisutería como aretes y collares para mujeres y L. venta D. L. misma es muy conocida por su buen trabajo,  además D. esto elL. también cuando le solicitan hace adornos con F. para fiestas, con el dinero del crédito comprara material para L. elaboración D. sus adornos como lentejuelas y alambres. L. Sra. Yessica vive por el barrio Los olivos del 5to anillo, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. carteras y zapatos que deja al crédito a sus compañeras D. L. universidad  y otras clientes que tiene en empresas y mercados, elL. compra su mercadería en L. feria D. Barrio Lindo los días miércoles y sábado, elL. es soltera y aun no tiene hijos por lo que los ingresos que genera le sirven para pagar sus estudios y aportar a los gastos D. su casa porque elL. vive en casa D. su familia, con el dinero del crédito comprara ropa por mayor. El grupo se reúne ene las oficinas D. Emprender los días Viernes, todas las socias están agradecidas con L. institución por al apoyo brindado en L. otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The "CORAZÓN D. MARIA" (Heart of Mary) community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with our institution.  This group has eleven members, one of whom is a man.  Their businesses incluD. selling clothes, selling meals, selling costume jewelry, running a bakery, selling 'salteñas' (baked empanadas), and selling chicken empanadas and soft drinks.  They are from the '5th ring district' of Cochabamba (note: this city is split into 12 concentric circles - or rings - that radiate out from the city center. Each 'ring' is 1-2km across and they rise in number the further they are from the center).

This group was formed by Mary who has received previous loans from Emprender.  Her business is making jewelry such as women's earrings and necklaces.  She is very well known for her good work.  In addition, she also makes flower arrangements for parties when her customers request them.  She will use her loan money to buy materials for making her products such as sequins and wire.

Yessica lives in Los Olivos neighborhood in the '5th ring district' of the city.  Her business is selling purses and shoes which she leaves on credit with her fellow University students and other customers that she has in companies and local markets.  Yessica buys her merchandise at Barrio Lindo market on Wednesdays and Saturdays.  Yessica is single and doesn't have any children yet.  She uses her income to pay for her studies and to cover her household expenses.  She lives with her family.  Yessica will use her loan money to buy clothes wholesale.

This group meets in Emprender's offices on Fridays.  All of the members of the group are grateful to the institution for the support they have offered them with the granting of this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for making necklaces and earrings

loans.name: Meluan

texts.en:
Meluan O. K., aged 55, is married and has eight children. He lives in Ntulelr-Narok, Kenya and has been in farming for the last four years.
Meluan is a humble client. He found out about Kiva partner, KADET, through other clients registered in the area in which he lives. This will be his second loan from KADET and he intends to use the loan to prepare the land for farming. He intends to plow back his anticipated profits into the farm and dreams of being a big farmer one day. He can do more if provided with the resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, school fees and electricity bills. 

For the past 20 years, she has operated a second-hand clothes business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Regina faces a major challenge of competition from other second-hand clothes businesses. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of second-hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Arsenal Group

texts.en:
Marie C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Marie was born in Magburaka town, about 33 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 3 children who are attending secondary and primary schools. Marie sells shoes, rubber bowls and medicines. She has been doing this type of business for 15 years now.

With the help of this loan, Marie and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Marie will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy shoes, rubber bowls and medicines, in large quantities, to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, rubber bowls and medicines in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre joven de 23 años de edad. Él tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y vive en el distrito de Olmos- Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña que se encuentra en la zona rural de este.

La actividad que Carlos desarrolla es la compra y venta de animales, actualmente cuenta con ganado porcino. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años en su domicilio y en su distrito. Además, muy a menudo lleva a vender sus cerdos a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Carlos aprendió esta actividad de su  padre y conoce el rubro a la perfección. Él es muy conocido en el caserío donde vive  y cuenta con clientes  ya establecidos en la zona. 

Carlos solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en su negocio (comprar cerdos) y que le generará  ingresos para darle a sus hijos las comodidades necesarias que requieren. Carlos trabaja para poder mantener a su familia, él es una persona responsable y trabajadora que solo quiere el bienestar de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Carlos es un padre joven de 23 años de edad. Él tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y vive en el distrito de Olmos- Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña que se encuentra en la zona rural de este.

La actividad que Carlos desarrolla es la compra y venta de animales, actualmente cuenta con ganado porcino. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años en su domicilio y en su distrito. Además, muy a menudo lleva a vender sus cerdos a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Carlos aprendió esta actividad de su  padre y conoce el rubro a la perfección. Él es muy conocido en el caserío donde vive  y cuenta con clientes  ya establecidos en la zona. 

Carlos solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en su negocio (comprar cerdos) y que le generará  ingresos para darle a sus hijos las comodidades necesarias que requieren. Carlos trabaja para poder mantener a su familia, él es una persona responsable y trabajadora que solo quiere el bienestar de sus pequeños.

loans.use: Comprar cerdos.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She makes a living running a retail store where she sells household goods like maize and wheat flour, salt, sugar and tea leaves, to  neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other retail shops. In the future, Rehema dreams of opening a reliable wholesale business. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that would allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is the mother of two children who are ages six and eight years old. Her husband sells goats, while Francoise owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items which include soap, vaseline, salt, etc. She has been doing this business for eight years and it has brought joy to her life. It has enabled her to meet the needs of her family and she is so proud of that. 

She needs a loan to purchase more items such as cooking oil, maize flour, etc. in order to make more profits. Francoise plans to beautify her house with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es:
Jose Agustin tiene 53 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con dos hijos de 15 y 9 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL PROGRESO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al Cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a laborea de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz por mas de 25 años . Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas de maiz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades.Enfrenta desafios como la sequia y plagas en los cultivo. Su sueño es compra mas terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta estar con la familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José Agustín is 53 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and his two children aged 15 and 9 in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'El Progreso' community bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache, in Mocache canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

José is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for 25 years.  He buys his products in Comercial Peña and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

José is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and corn and rice seeds.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as drought and pests attacking his crops.

José's dream is to buy more land so that he can continue growing his crops.

José enjoys spending time with his family and taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and corn and rice seeds

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años de edad. Es una mujer soltera y muy conocida en la zona por sus buenas referencias personales y laborales. Rosa vive en el distrito de Cayalti, en casa propia.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un pequeño espacio acondicionado en el interior de su hogar. Además, desde hace 10 años cría animales de corral para venderlos.

Rosa es una mujer humilde con deseos de superación y ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un  crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería (arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc.) para su negocio y alimento balanceado para sus animales. Rosa espera mejorar sus ventas y crecer en su actividad, para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35, is single and a very well known woman in the area due to her good personal and work references.  She lives in her own house in Cayaltí District.

Rosa sells groceries in a small space that she equipped to do so in her house.  In addition, she’s been raising small farm animals to sell for the last ten years.

Rosa is a humble woman with a strong wish to improve and has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.) for her store and nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.  Rosa hopes to improve sales and grow in business to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries and nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is married and has two children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Adelaida is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her corn production. Adelaida has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for corn production

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Donald has operated a clothes selling business, selling retail to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. His major dream is to expand the business to sell wholesale in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase bundles of clothes and shoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: L'emprunteur a conduit pendant deux ans une charette de transport de marchandises avant d'arreter cette activité pour embrasser le métier de vulcanisateur qu'il considère plus rentable.Il fait du gonflage, de la réparationet vend aussi des pneus d'occasion.Son travail lui permet d'entretenir son épouse et ses deux enfants.Il sollicite un pret de 200000F auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter un groupe électrogène qui lui permettra de faire face aux multiples coupures d'électricité qui s'évissent dans son pays.Son ambition est d'élargir son magasin.
texts.en:
This borrower drove a delivery cart for two years and then he quit this work to embrace a trade in tires that he considers to be more profitable. He inflates the tires and repairs them, and he also sells used inner tubes. His work enables him to support his wife and two children. 

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs from the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC to buy an electrical generator that will allow him to cope with multiple power outages that the country is subject to. His ambition is to expand his store.

loans.use: to buy an electrical power generator

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Gema has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Gema has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gema hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is 28 years old and married with a 6-year-old child. She started her sari-sari (variety) store business a year ago. Janeth sells items like shampoo, coffee and vinegar to the people in her community. She has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soft drinks. Janeth hopes for her store to grow bigger. She also hopes to be able to sustain her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soft drinks.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a business-minded woman and hardworking mother to her only child. Her husband sells cell phone accessories. Agnes has been operating her phone accessories business for four years. She said that through her small business, she is able to sustain the needs of her family with the help of her husband. 

Agnes would like to buy housing of cell phones and chargers for her retail shop, but she does not have enough funds due to household expenses and allowances of her child. She is strongly determined to maintain and improve her business, so she is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP. With this loan amount, she could satisfy her customers' demand. Agnes hopes to continue expanding her business to provide her family with a good standard of living and a good quality of education.

loans.use: to purchase housing of cell phones and chargers

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel, vive con se esposa y dos hijos, todos trabajan en la familia, él administra una tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, este surgió por iniciativa propia, lo tiene en su propia casa, lo atiende todo el día.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de sodas, jugos,cocos boquitas, galletas, arroz, frijoles, papel higiénico, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar los productos en la tienda y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes para sus necesidades.
La aspiración de Joel es que su negocio sea prospero, que con la ayuda de los prestamos se fortalezca y provea más ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Joel lives with his wife and two children.  Everybody in the family works.  Joel runs a store where he sells basic household products.  This business came about through his own initiative.  The business is located in his own home and he works in it all day.

Joel is requesting a loan to buy soda, juice, coconuts, snacks, cookies, rice, beans and toilet paper.  This purchase will help him to increase the number of products he has in his store so that he can offer his customers what they need.

Joel's aspiration is for his business to thrive.  With the help of his loans he would like to strengthen his business and provide more income for his household.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, snacks, cookies, rice, beans and toilet paper

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. She has been running a tailoring business for the last ten years to support her family. Jane has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She has requested a loan for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a sewing machine and fabric. In the next five years she plans to manage a boutique. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been able to adopt the practice of saving.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan est une femme âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée à un Directeur d’école avec qui elle eut 2 enfants. Massan travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et revend des produits cosmétiques genre laits et lotions corporels, des parfums …à toutes personnes à son domicile ou comme ambulante à Lomé. Elle achète ces produits au grand marché de Lomé.
Massan a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques destinés à la vente. Dans les prochaines années, Massan voudrait agrandir sa marchandise. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Massan is a 45-year old woman, who is married to a headteacher and has two children. She has worked as a retailer since 2007, buying and selling cosmetics such as body milks and lotions, perfumes...to all sorts of people either from home or on a door-to-door basis in Lomé. She buys these products at Lomé's Grand Market. 

Massan has requested a third loan from WAGES so that she can buy cosmetics for resale. In coming years, she would like to build up her stock. She says that she plans to use the profits she makes to contribute to her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Graciela Ester

texts.es:
Graciela Ester, es una señora de 45 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene una hija de 16 años de edad, vive en San Pedro Sula.

Doña Graciela es muy trabajadora, tiene 5 años de tener establecido un negocio de vender mercadería como, ropa interior, de mujer y de hombre, calcetas, calcetines, camisas y blusas.   Ella anteriormente vendía ropa en el mercado y con el sindicato logró establecer  el negocio  en un local fijo.  De este negocio obtiene los ingresos necesarios para el estudio de su hija y los gastos del hogar.
Su meta es ver el negocio más surtido y con sus ganancias cubrir gastos de estudio de su hija hasta que se gradúe y llegar a tener su propia vivienda.
Con este préstamo va comprar más ropa interior, calcetines y camisas, para aprovechar esta temporada de venta.
texts.en:
Graciela Ester is a 45-year-old woman; she’s a single mother of a 16-year-old daughter.  She lives in San Pedro Sula.  Graciela is very hardworking.  She’s had a clothing sales business for five years; she sells merchandise like underwear for women and men, socks, stockings, shirts and blouses.  She used to sell clothes in the market and with the syndicate was able to establish the business in a fixed locale.  From this business she earns income needed for her daughter’s schooling and for household expenses.

Her goal is to see her business better stocked and to use her profits to cover her daughter’s schooling costs until she graduates and to manage to have her own house.  She will use this loan to buy more underwear, socks and shirts to take advantage of this sales season.

loans.use: to buymerchandise like underwear (bras), socks and shirts.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Susana;  la socia tiene 62 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos La socia Susana se dedica a la confección de ropa y también se dedica al cultivo de maíz y hortalizas, ella tiene varias "chacras2, son terrenos de cultivo y están cerca de su casa. Posteriormente vende sus productos una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño en los diferentes mercados de los poblados de Calca, Urubamba, Cusco y a pobladores que la conocen y asi incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo cosas que le hacen falta en su casa. Ella confecciona ropa como mandiles, faldas, vestidos y buzos para sus caseras.   

El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para la compra de maíz, telas, hilos, botones para incrementar su negocio. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Virgen Concebida de Arin". The bank is located in the district of Arin in the province of Calca and department of Cusco. 
The member is Susana. She is 62 years old and has 6 children. Susana works making clothes and also cultivates corn and vegetables. She has a number of "chacras", which are plots of cultivated land, and these are close to her house. Once her produce has reached full size, she sells them in the different markets in the towns of Calca, Urubamba, and Cusco as well as to people she knows, and in this way she has increased her income and obtained things she needed in her home. She makes clothes such as aprons, skirts, dresses, and sweaters for women.
The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy corn, yarn, fabrics, and buttons to grow her business.
The member is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments according to the timetable.

loans.use: to buy corn, yarn, and fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green plantains.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория сама воспитывает сына-подростка. Они живут в Мелитополе. Это небольшой городок, в котором не так много вариантов трудоустройства. Поэтому Виктория использовала возможность, которая предоставилась ей еще в 2002 году и занялась торговлей детской одеждой на центральном рынке города. Ее торговое место известно постоянным покупателям – там всегда можно найти широкий ассортимент товара по приемлемым ценам. На данный момент оборотный капитал Виктории составляет 12 000 гривен.   

Виктория хотела бы использовать кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить детскую одежду зимнего ассортимента. Учитывая то, что Виктория – мать-одиночка, и у нее нет других средств к существованию, этот кредит станет хорошим подспорьем для ее бизнеса и семьи в целом.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Victoria is raising an adolescent son by herself.  They live in Melitopol, which is a small town with limited options for finding work.  This is why Victoria used an opportunity, which presented itself to her in 2002, to get involved in selling children's clothing at the town's central market.  Her retail outlet is known to regular customers because a wide assortment of merchandise at affordable prices can be found there.  Currently, Victoria's working capital is 12 000 hryvnia.  She wants to use a loan in the sum of 10 000 hryvnia to purchase a winter selection of children's clothing.  Considering that Victoria is a single mother and has no other means to make a living, this loan will be a good help for her business and family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase children's winter clothing

loans.name: Roque De Jesus

texts.es: Roque de 59 años es un hombre casado que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 30 y 34 años y genera ingresos para su hogar a partir de un negocio donde vende frutas, verduras y tubérculos, en compañía de su esposa. En su negocio vende diariamente y es una persona organizada que ha logrado formalizarlo y generar ingresos para lograr el  bienestar de todos en casa. Cuenta con clientes fijos que les vede a crédito y le pagan cada 8 y 15 días, En la actualidad  con su deseo de crecer y generar cada vez mas oportunidades de ingresos,  ha logrado recibir 11 créditos durante 10 años de estar vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha financiar su cartera, aumentar su capital de trabajo y generar mas utilidades cada vez mas. Su credikiva es el crédito #  12, con el comprará en un mayor volumen tubérculos, verduras y frutas especialmente uvas que es una de las frutas que mas se venden por volúmenes importantes el las fiestas familiares en las cuales todos reciben su nuevo año.
texts.en:
Roque, 59, is married and has two offspring, 30 and 34, and he and his wife earn money for family expenses with a business of selling fruit, vegetables, and tubers.  The business is open every day and he is an organized person who has managed to establish a stable business and generate income for the welfare of everyone in the home.  He has regular customers to whom he extends credit and they pay him every week and  every two weeks.  

Now he would like to expand and have more opportunities for earning money. He has received 11 loans in the past 10 years from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  They have helped him finance his portfolio,  increase his working capital and generate more profits each time.  His loan with Kiva is #12  and he will buy a larger volume of tubers, vegetables and fruits, particularly grapes, which is one of the fruits that he sells more of for important family festivities around New Years.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume of tubers, vegetables and fruits, especially grapes that is one of the fruits that sells the most in large amounts

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cuyes y tambien se sigue dedicando a transporte,ella alquila un taxi y lo hace trabajar como servicio de taxi y los cuyes lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y tambien poder mejorar el servicio de taxi.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y tambien para comprar llantas para su carro.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Roxana continues selling guinea pigs and also continues working in transportation. She rents out a car that is put to use as a taxi. She sells the guinea pigs in the different markets that take place in the Anta district. Through this business she can help her sons get ahead in life. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her guinea pigs and also be able to improve her taxi service. She is requesting the loan to purchase guinea pigs and tires for the car. 
She is happy to have the loan and she commits to making her loan payments.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs and tires for her car

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia Virginia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA BEATRIZ, el banco esta ubicad en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 41 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a si familia.
La socia solicito el credito para la compra de abono y otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

loans.use: para la compra de abono y otros.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Education, no one can think of a better gift to give to his children to make sure they can benefit from a brighter future.
A 34-year-old father of three, who has been working as a security with a limited monthly salary to provide his family with the necessary living needs.
He is his family's sole breadwinner since his wife doesn't work, instead she takes good care of her beloved family members.
Since Ali's income is designed to cover his family's daily living needs, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children school tuition fees making sure he can provide them with a better education and brighter future.
Ali's dream is to see his children doctors in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his children school tuition fees to make sure he can provide his children with a better education and brighter future

loans.name: Ama Lolonyo

texts.en:
Around 41 years old, Madame D. Ama Lolonyo is the mother of two children. Worried about her children’s education, she placed them in a boarding school in Tsévié, which is very costly. Her income from trading and selling “Wax Hollandais” fabric is not enough to support her family. Not having finance, even though market demand is high, Madame D. is seeking a new loan of $1200 which will serve as capital to stock fabric to meet her clients’ demand. She has already had four loans in her name, successfully repaid thanks to her sound management.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 41 ans environs, Madame D. Ama Lolonyo est mère de deux (02) enfants. Soucieuse de l’éducation de ses enfants, elle les a mis à l’internat de Tsévié, ce qui pèse lourdement sur elle. Les revenus de son commerce de vente de pagnes « Wax Hollandais » sont insuffisants pour subvenir à ses besoins. N’ayant plus de moyens alors que la demande est grande sur le marché, Madame D. sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1200 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour s’approvisionner en pagne en vue de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Elle a à son actif 4 crédits, tous bien remboursés grâce à sa gestion saine.

loans.use: stocking textiles

loans.name: Grime Pastora

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Grime Pastora, I am a merchant and I have a small grocery store in my home. I have several years of experience running my business, which creates enough income to cover family expenses and other obligations. At this moment, I need to stock a little more in order to offer a wider variety of products to my customers as these types of businesses attract more costumers when there is more to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre es Grime Pastora, soy comerciante, tengo una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitacion, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis cliente ya que estos negocios atraen mas la clientela cuanta se ven mas surtidos.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, rice, sugar, butter, sodas, flour, sausages, juices, sweets, whole milk and other items.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mrs. Chen B. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their three young children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She makes and sells Khmer cake and earns $10/day in revenue.  Her husband is a construction foreman and earns $5/day.  This loan will be used to buy land.  In the future, Mrs. Chen B. would like to open a grocery store and send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
I am the proprietor of a carpentry shop. Two months ago a power plane I had broke and I have missed it greatly since it makes my work agile; I urgently need to buy one because without it my sales have dropped considerably. I request $1,000 to buy a power plane.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Yo soy propietario de un taller de carpintería, hace 2 meses se me quebró un cepillo electrónico que tenia y me ha hecho mucha falta ya que agiliza mi trabajo tengo la necesidad urgente de comprarla ya debido a que mis ventas han bajado considerablemente”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar un cepillo electrónico.

loans.use: To buy and power plane - Comprar un cepillo electrónico

loans.name: Negmatullo

texts.en: Negmatullo S. is a 35 year old habitant of the Vakhdat district.  He is highly educated; he is married and has 3 children.  He is entrepreneur and has 8 years of experience in business.  He rents out a club for playing billiards. This is his main source of income.   For a loan of $1000, S. can purchase an additional billiard table so he can serve the high demand of the locals. In their free time, after their schoolwork and chores are finished, you adults spend their time at billiard clubs because there are no discos or movie theatres, or other entertainment in the village. S. was forward thinking enough to open up a billiards club so he could give young adults an activity to do, to socialize. This loan will help young adults spend their time in a safe and enjoyable area away from criminal activity. S. will pay off the loan in 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase a billiard table for his billiard club.

loans.name: Sofía Irene

texts.es:
Irene is a woman who up until now has fought eagerly to obtain potatoes and vegetables from her fertile lands, in order to later sell them commercially in the town of Chanchamayo. With this activity, together with her husband she has been able to educate her nine children and give them the best attentions. Faced with the responsibility of her numerous family, she had to rent more land to cultivate in order to meet their expenses.

Today they need to improve the consumable products which their harvests generate, which they hope to sell commercially in the capital with the aim of obtaining better profits in order to educate their children who long to continue their higher education outsiD. the town of their birth. We hope that you can help this family who need $200 dollars in order to buy the fertilizer and manure which they lack in order to improve their products for a quick harvest. Your help will proviD. them with happiness and well-being.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Irene, es una dama que hasta ahora ha luchado con ahínco para obtener D. sus fértiles tierras papa y verduras; para después comercializarlos en la ciudad D. Chanchamayo. Con esta actividad que desempeña junto a su esposo ha podido educar a sus 9 hijos y darle las mejores atenciones. Frente a la responsabilidad D. su numerosa familia tuvo que arrendar un terreno más D. cultivo para solventar los gastos D. su familia.

Hoy requieren mejorar los productos D. consumo que generan sus cosechas, lo cual espera comercializarlos en la capital a fin D. obtener mayores ganancias para educar a sus hijos que anhelan realizar estudios superiores fuera D. su ciudad natal. Esperamos que usted pueda ayudar a esta familia que requiere D. 200 dólares para comprar los abonos y fertilizantes que hacen falta para el mejoramiento D. sus productos para su pronta cosecha.Vuestro apoyo les brindará felicidad y bienestar.

loans.use: Pruchase fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juanita is married and has two children, one boy and one girl. She runs a convenience store in the Vila Reconciliación district of Managua. He store has been growing thanks to loans, and she needs another one to expand her business by purchasing more products and improve their quality.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juanita es casada y tiene 2 hijos, un varón y una mujer. atiende una pulpería en el barrio Vila Reconciliación de Managua. Su pulpería ha ido creciendo debido a los créditos que Afodenic le ha otorgado, necesita el dinero pra expandir el negocio, planea comprar y aumentar la cantidad de artículos con este dinero

loans.use: Expand business by purchasing more products of improved quality

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tình is young and industrious. She farms the family’s rice paddy, raises a bunch of egg laying hens and also tends a general stand at the village's open market. Incomes from all those activity are steady. Her husband, Mr. Trung, a village police cadre, helps her to tend her business and raises their two young children. She joins the Binh Minh to get into its financial programs for expanding her general stand. She will save and commit to the repayment schedule.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tình là người phụ nữ trẻ tuổi, hay lam hay làm. Chị cấy lúa làm ruộng, nuôi rất nhều gà đẻ trứng, hàng ngày chị còn đi bán hàng tạp hoá tại chợ trung tâm làng, nhờ vậy thu nhập gia đình chị rất ổn định và thường xuyên. Anh Trung, chồng chị, ngoài công tác tại Ban công an xã, vẫn luôn phụ giúp vợ phát triển kinh tế gia đình và chăm sóc hai con nhỏ. Chị tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh minh để bổ sung nguồn vốn đi chợ. Việc bán hàng sẽ giúp chị tiết kiệm để hoàn trả vốn vay một cách dễ dàng.

loans.use: Buy goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Manka's Ujirani Mwema Group

texts.en:
Manka is 25 years old and is single woman. She takes care of two other people, ages 27 and 12 years old. Manka owns a small food shop, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of approximately $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in animal keeping and cloth selling.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old, married and has 2 children. She has a high school diploma, and she is seamstress by profession. Marhabo works in an atelier where she sews traditional clothing. She has 5 years of experience in this area.

Now Marhabo would like to purchase her own sewing machine and cloth in order to start her own business. But she does not have the money to do this. This is why Murhabo came to us for help. She would like to obtain a loan that would help her reach her goals. If she starts her own business she would be able to improve financial situation of her family. Additionally, customers would be able to obtain services of an experienced seamstress at affordable prices. Marhabo plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Сайдалиева Мархабо проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 26 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Образование средне - профессиональное. По профессии портниха. Работает в ателье , где шьет национальную одежду. Опыт в данной сфере она имеет уже 5 лет.

Сейчас она хочет приобрести свою собственную швейную машинку и закупить материал , для того чтобы открыть свое дело. Но для этого у Мархабо нет денег, и поэтому она обратилась к нам за помощью. Она хочет получить кредит , который поможет ей достичь целей. Если она откроет свое дело , то сможет улучшить финансовое положение своей семьи. Кроме того, население сможет пользоваться услугами портнихи со стажем и по доступным ценам. А погасить кредит сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe I. sells traditional women's clothes ( known in English as a wrapper). She is 41 years old and is married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Phoebe has been in this business for the past 6 years. This she learnt for 5 years as an apprentice.

Phoebe is a LAPO client. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more inventory. This will help her to better serve her costumers.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón L. is a homeowner and lives in the Villa Fátima area in La Paz with his wife Angélica Nava and their three children. Simón is a landlord and his wife is a homemaker. Simón also makes signs for businesses, using a computer for his deisgns.

The loan Simón is applying for will be used to purchase a computer and printer. This is Simón’s second loan application. The socio-economic analysis we have conducted qualifies him for a loan.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

El señor Simón L. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Villa Fátima de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Angélica Nava y sus tres hijos. El señor Simón es rentista y su esposa es ama de casa. El señor también se dedica a la elaboración de letreros para los comercios para lo cual necesita una computadora que es su herramienta para diseñar los letreros.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la compra de una computadora y una impresora. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer and printer

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Geoconda lives in the Hialeah neighborhood, is married and has two children ages 19 and 12. Her husband works as a cabinetmaker and helps with the family expenses, although in the winter he earns less because it is more difficult to work with wood. Geoconda supports her husband in the maintenance of the household by working as a maid in a private home, and in her spare time she also sells cosmetics to help him a little with the expenses. Both parents are thinking of their children’s comfort and are requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a small room for their children, so their children can have more independence and at the same time improve their family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Geoconda habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como ebanista y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, aunque en el invierno obtiene menos ingresos ya que es más difícil trabajar cono la madera. Geoconda apoya a su marido en la manutención del hogar trabajando como doméstica en una casa particular, aunque también en sus tiempos libres vende cosméticos para ayudarse con poco con los gastos. Ambos padres están pensando en la comodidad de sus hijos, y solicitan el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y hacerles una pequeña habitación a sus hijos para que estos puedan tener independencia y al mismo tiempo mejore la calidad de vida de la familia.

loans.use: Build a room for her children

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina is 33 years old. She completed technical college culminating in a career as a nurse. She speaks Aymara and Castellano, is married and has four children who are studying in primary school. Her home is located in the Marquiri Sector, in the town of Caritamaya, Acoro district, Puno province. She has worked making yogurt and Paria cheese for three years, products which she sells in the fairs at Llave and Acora, generally taking orders from customers.

She is a member of the Communal Bank, "New Horizons," where she had an inicial credit of $115, which she invested in the purchase of a thermometer and lactometer in order to make her products. With this credit of $75, which will be repaid en 4 months, she will purchase milk in bulk to make yogurt and cheese. Dina says that she was always active and particpating, the loan that you give her will help her to improve her business. Her dream is to have a yogurt and cheese business that can enter the national and international markets; She would like for her children to be entrepreneurs and have their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Dina tiene 33 años de edad, logro estudiar superior técnico culmino la carrera de enfermería, habla el idioma Aymará y Castellano, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando en educación primaria. Su domicilio esta ubicado en el Sector Marquiri, Centro Poblado de Caritamaya, Distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de Yogurt y queso tipo Paria desde hace tres años. Productos que los vende en las ferias de Ilave Y Acora, generalmente le hacen pedidos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Horizonte” donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de termómetro, lactómetro, para elaborar sus productos. Con este crédito de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, que será pagado en cuatro meses comprará leche al por mayor para la elaboración de yogurt y queso. Dina nos cuenta que siempre fue activa, participativa, el crédito que se le dio le ayudo a incrementar su negocio. El gran sueño que tiene es hacer una empresa de quesos y yogurt y poder entrar al mercado Nacional e Internacional; le gustaría que sus hijos sea emprendedores y que tengan su propia empresa.

loans.use: Purchase of milk in bulk

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima M. is married and has two children. She completed her schooling through senior high school. She is a hairdresser who has owned a beauty salon in Kotokoraba since 2000. Her husband is an electrician.

Salima uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. She will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics and hair products to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Salima plans to improve the conditions of the salon to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Ngn

texts.en: Ngn A., 40, is a widow who lives with two of her children. Living in Phnom Penh, she is able to make around US$4 from selling groceries. She has been doing that since 2007 but she is faced with competition from a few other vendors who operate the same type of business. She said that to gain more customers first she needs to diversify her inventory. Currently, she has requested a loan of US$600 to add to her grocery's inventory. In the future, she plans to set up another business selling rice and porridge. She wants all of her children to get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Inca Sevillanos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “INCA SEVILLANOS”, se fundo en septiembre del 2005, actualmente se encuentra en el III ciclo de la segunda etapa, esta conformada por  12 socias, 8 mujeres y 4 hombres del distrito de Accha.nEl distrito de Accha de la provincia de Paruro, Dpto de Cusco, se encuentra aproximadamente a 3 horas  de la ciudad del Cusco.nLas socias son mujeres campesinas dedicadas a labores agrícolas principalmente (cultivos de maíz, papa y habas, crianza de vacunos y ovinos), la mayoría de las socias combinan las actividades agrícolas, con las comerciales (venta de productos agrícolas) realizando las transacciones en la feria local del pueblo, en los centros poblados y comunidades aledañas como comerciantes acopiadoras y vendedoras.nLa oportunidad de acceder a servicios de crédito y ahorro es muy valorada, porque les permite generar ingresos, con el que,  contribuyen al presupuesto familiar. En la misma medida valoran las actividades de capacitación, que  se orientan a mejorar las relaciones familiares, con esposos e hijos.n
texts.en:
The "Inca Sevillanos" community bank was founded in September 2005 and is currently in its third loan cycle. It is made up of 12 members — eight women, four men — from Accha, Peru, about three hours from the city of Cusco. The female members are hard-working country women dedicate primarily to farming (cultivating corn, potatoes and beans) and raising livestock (cattle, sheep). The majority of them combine their agricultural activities with commerce, selling their products at the local market, in population centers and villages. The opportunity to access credit and savings is very valuable for them because it helps them generate income, which they put toward the family budget. They also value the training activities designed to improve familial relations with their husbands and children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell their agricultural products — potatoes, corn, small animals (guinea pigs, pigs, hens) — on a small scale at the different local markets.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Mrs. Cerila T. F., is 60 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a Social Security System pensioner who is still working at the Local Government Unit as a casual municipal driver in order for them to have a sustainable living. 

Cerila's little sari-sari store (a community-based variety store)  started in the early years of their marriage. She also sells gasoline in bottles.
    
For more than a year, Cerila has been member of Paglaum MPC. She is very cooperative and helpful to her co-group members. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative because she likes the programs and services that she receives as a member. She is now requesting a loan of $300.This loan is intended for purchasing additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Cerila's ambitions and dreams for  her children have already been fulfilled as of this moment.  What she wants is to have a comfortable life,  to make her sari-sari store much more convenient and to be able to give good service to her neighbors and customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Jeny

texts.en:
Jeny is a member of the Kusikuy Village Bank.  “Kusikuy” means “Be Happy” in Quechua.  Jeny is 21 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. 

Jeny and her husband have a restaurant in a rented space on a busy street.  They launched the restaurant three months ago and it has been going well so far.  The couple does all of the cooking and table service themselves.  

Jeny needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy an oven to cook chicken.  She dreams of expanding her business and providing her child with a good education.
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Jeny  socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua. 
Jeny es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Jeny junto a su esposo tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida concurrida, actividad que inicio hace 3 meses y le esta yendo bien, ella y su esposo se encargan de la cocina sy atención. 
Jeny necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un horno para hornear pollos. Jeny sueña con ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy an oven to cook chicken

loans.name: Donohol

texts.ru: Кувандикова Донохол проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 39 лет , незамужем и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. Занимается торговлей уже 2 года , стого момента , когда она осталась одна с ребенком на руках. Для того , чтобы прокормить сына она вплотную занялась бизнесом. Для этого она решила получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Получив , дополнительное финансирование она сможета завезти новый товар и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Donohol Q. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 39 years old, not married and has one child. She is in a retail business on the central market. She has been in this business for two years since when she became a single mother alone with her child. She decided to take up business to be able to feed her son. She has decided to get a loan for a 12 months term. With additional financing Donohol will bring new merchandise and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: BETTY ES SOLTERA  TIENE 55 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN CASA PRESTADA, EL NEGOCIO QUEDA UBICADO EN EL BARRIO 24 DE JUNIO, ESPECIFICAMENTE EN EL COLEGIO DE LA LOCALIDAD, NO TIENE COMPETENCIA PORQUE ES EL UNICO KIOSKO ADJUDICADO EN DICHO ESTABLECIMIENTO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIAS (PARA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO) , BETTY TIENE MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO .
texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and she is single. She lives in a house that is lent to her. Her business is in Barrio 24 de Junio. More specifically, it is on the local school grounds. Because her business is the only kiosk located there, she has no competition. The loan is to buy more merchandise to sell. Betty has a very good loan history.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise (Operating Capital)

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Молодой человек 22 лет , не женат,Абдурахим  бизнесмен на рынке "Рохи Абрешим". Абдурахим самостоятельно занимается бизнесом продажи колбасных изделий. Он закупает с колбасных цехов оптом разных сортов колбасы и продаёт их в розницу ,в развес.У него качественный товар , поэтому у него свои постоянные клиенты с районов , которые покупают у него большими партиями.Для увеличения своего оборотного капитала Абдурахим решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Abdurahim is a 22 year old bachelor and an entrepreneur working at the Rohi Abreshim market, where he runs his own business selling sausage. The sausage is bought wholesale from factories and sold at retail price by weight. His high quality meat attracts regular customers from outside the city who buy large quantities. Abdurahim decided to request a loan in order to expand his working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meats

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a married 34 year-old mother of one who sells kerosene and also owns her own hair salon. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase hair extensions to sell in her hair salon.  She would like to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions to sell in her hair salon.

loans.name: Djamilya

texts.en:
D. Djamilya is 42 years old. She is married with three children. Djamilya sells different kinds of salads made of vegetables which she prepares herself. She has been in this kind of business for almost 16 years and has gained rich experiences and many constant customers. Her children help her with the business. She works very hard to give them a good education and to make them happy.

Today Djamilya is planning to expand the business and purchase more vegetables to prepare more kinds of salads for selling. With this purpose she requests 1300 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Djamilya and her faithful children are counting on your help. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her with increasing the business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables for preparing salads to sell

loans.name: I Made Ardana

texts.en:
I Made Ardana (DNR.M-0644) is a 52-year-old man living in the town of Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. He is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, I Made Ardana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. I Made Ardana has been engaged in this business for over 4 years.

In 2008, I Made Ardana joined DINARI, Kiva's partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. I Made Ardana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 400,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to rent land to raise additional crops.

I Made Ardana is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. I Made Ardana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

I Made Ardana - (DNR.M-0644) merupakan 52 tahun pria. Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, I Made Ardana memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen buah & sayuran untuk dijual. I Made Ardana sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.

Dalam 2008, I Made Ardana bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. I Made Ardana meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk menyewa lahan untuk memelihara tanaman tambahan. Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli benih, bibit, & tanaman muda tambahan untuk dipelihara. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. I Made Ardana berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman est composé de 2 veuves, 2 polygames et 2 monogames  vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec un âge moyen de 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Le groupe Sabougnouman fait le commerce de fruits, de pagnes, des jus de fruits de fabrication locale, du savon, des ustensiles de cuisine etc.
Dans le souci d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les femmes décidèrent de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursés les prêts précédents.
Le prêt servira à acheter, 21 pièces de pagnes wax, 1sac de savon contenant 300 morceaux, un chargement de charrette de mangue, 7 colis de calebasses et des louches. Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes wax au grand marché de Bamako, en mangues et savons à la foire de Diamarabougou, en calebasses et louches à la foire de Tona. Les produits sont revendus à crédit ou au comptant en ambulant dans les quartiers de Markala et dans les foires de Diamarabougou et Sibila à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 46 000FCFA qui va servira pour la nourriture et les frais scolaires des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’épargner et de devenir grossistes dans la vente du savon et de l’aliment bétail.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouman is composed of two widows, two who are polygamous, and two who are monogamous. They all live in traditional extended families and average 44 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in the Bamanan Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members do commerce in fruit, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), locally-made fruit juices, soap, kitchen utensils, etc. Concerned about augmenting their working capital, the women decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan, after having repaid the preceding ones. This loan will be used to buy 21 bolts of Wax pagnes, a 300-count sack of soap, a cart-load of mangoes, seven parcels of calabash bowls, and some ladles. The women resupply themselves with Wax pagnes at the grand marketplace of Bamako; with mangoes and soaps at the Diamarabougou fair; and with bowls and ladles at the Tona fair. The goods are resold to a mixed customer base, cash or credit accepted, in the districts of Markala going door-to-door, and at the fairs of Diamarabougou and Sibila. The women hope to realize an average monthly profit of 46,000 francs CFA that will be used for food and for covering the children's schooling costs. Their ambition is to save money and to become wholesalers selling soap and livestock feed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Nhữ Thị Nguyệt

texts.en:
N. Nhữ Thị Nguyệt makes a living primarily from raising pigs to sell. She is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. N. is married and has 3 adult children. She has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,500,000 VND a month.

In 1998, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build a shelter for the her livestock. N. is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her tenth loan from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

No. 139011933.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 37 years old and lives in Badagry, Lagos state. She is married, and has four children.

Patience sells various colors of sarongs and lace. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and lace to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and lace to sell

loans.name: Honimkul

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хонимкул  Холикулов проживает в Зафарабадском районе, и как многие наши клиенты этого региона занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока.  Животноводством он занимается в домашних условиях. В переработке молока ему помогает жена Ойимбиби. Из свежего парного молока она заготавливает кефир, который очень любят ее дети. Иногда молоко и кефир у нее покупают соседи. У Хонимкула с Ойимбиби 3 дочерей.
Хонимкул дополнительно работает в дехканском хозяйстве «Ният».
Для откорма скота и покупки бычка он запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Honimkul H. lives in the Zafarabad district, and as do many of our clients in this district, he is involved in feeding livestock and processing milk. He runs the animal husbandry business out of his home. His wife, Oyimbibi, helps him with milk processing. She makes kefir from fresh milk that her children love very much.
