MatilD.; ella tiene 56 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. verduras y fruta, la socia viaja a  provincia a vender su mercadería como a Urubamba, Calca y Ollantaytambo especialmente en las ferias dominicales, también venD. en el mismo Cusco siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento la socia venD. D. forma ambulatoria, la socia es una persona bien emprendedora que tiene muchas ganas D. seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra  D. más mercadería para su negocio D. venta D. fruta y verdura para sí poder tener más variedad y poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

Las otras socias se dedican al mismo negocio D. venta D. fruta y verduras, crianza D. animales, venta D. madera y venta D. tejidos hechos a mano.
La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en: The members belong to the "Agua Buena" ("Good Water") community bank in the district, province and department of Cusco. One of the members is MatilD.. She is 56 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She travels to other provinces to sell her products, such as to Urubamba, Calca and Ollantaytambo, especially for the Sunday markets. She also sells on the streets of Cusco itself. MatilD. is a very enterprising woman who has a strong desire to make headway. She is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise for her fruits and vegetable business so she can have more variety to offer her customers. Some other members make a living selling fruits and vegetables like MatilD., while others raise livestock, sell wood or sell hand-woven items. The members feel happy about the loan and promise to make the payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, but only  3 are in school.  She also takes care of two grandchildren. 

Rebecca has a  poultry farming business.  She has been in this business for six years, and works six days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop. Rebecca has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more chicken feed and chicks.

The main business challenge for Rebecca is handling customers.  Her goal is to pay for the schooling of all her children. Rebecca lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feeds and chicks

loans.name: Ho

texts.en:
Ho S., 29 years old, is a humble villager living in Baray district, in Kompog Tom province. She is married and blessed with a young school-aged child, while her husband is a bed seller in the village. 

To earn a living, Ho S. sells many kinds of cake in the local school, earning an average of $2 per day. Recently, her husband has run out of raw materials from his stock, and now he would like to buy additional planks in order to make beds for resale. In order help support her husband’s business, Ho S. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To buy additional planks for making beds

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann L. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living Rose Ann owns and operates a general store. The business sells a variety of different products in the local community. Rose Ann has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011 Rose Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rose Ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase dried fish and bagoong (a fish-based condiment) for sale. This loan will be the first taken out by Rose Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and bagoong for sale

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 38 años de edad, él ahora vive en la comunidad de Cotowincho, Urubamba, Cusco. Su actividad económica de Efraín es la carpintería y ebanistería, él desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de la carpintería, su padre y su hermano mayor fueron quienes le enseñaron la carpintería pero ahora él tiene su propio taller donde trabaja de forma independiente. En esta oportunidad Efraín requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo madera y muchas cosas más.
texts.en: Efraín is 38 years old and was born in Cusco.  He now lives in the Cotowincho area of town.  He is a carpenter and cabinetmaker who learned this trade when he was very young.  He learned from his father and older brother, but he now has his own workshop.  Efraín is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies, such as lumber and other items that he needs.

loans.use: to buy lumber and supplies.

loans.name: Wangninan De Dessah 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement WANGNINAN DE DESSAH 1 est composé de 22 membres qui vivent tous dans le même quartier et qui mènent ensemble certaines activités (la transformation de noix de palme et la vente d'huile de palme). La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Gonoussi, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Gonoussi est née en Janvier 1961 à Dokè au Bénin. Gonoussi est une veuve ayant quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois à sa charge. Il y a environs vingt cinq ans que Gonoussi s'est installée à Tchaada / Dessah dans l'Ouémé, où elle vit avec ses enfants.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Gonoussi mène comme activité depuis douze ans environs, la vente de condiments de sauce et d'huile de palme qu'elle transforme ensemble avec ses autres membres. C'est au Nigéria et aussi à Cotonou que Gonoussi s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Gonoussi sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d'avoir dans l'avenir son propre palmeraie et d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
The group WANGNINAN DE DESSAH 1 is composed of 22 members who all live in the same area and who do similar work together (processing coconuts and selling the coconut oil). The president of the group, named Gonoussi, is the one in the photo in front with her hand raised.  With the goal of increasing the level of their work  to be able to meet customer demand better, this group is requesting a loan for the first time through the financial institution ALIDé.
Gonoussi was born in January 1961 in Doké, in Bénin. Gonoussi is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school, and three of whom are in her care.  Gonoussi settled in Tchaada/Dessah, in Ouémé about 25 years ago.  She lives with her children.  In order to meet her needs and those of the family, Gonoussi has been selling sauces and palm oil, which she processes with other members of the group, for about 12 years. Gonoussi gets her supplies in Nigeria and also in Cotonou.  With the goal of strengthening her business and better satisfying her customers, Gonoussi is requesting a loan through ALIDé. Her ambition is to have her own palm operation in the future and to increase her revenue.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en su casa propia.

Vende comida desde hace 3 años en la feria comercial de su zona que son todos los días viernes, sale desde muy temprano ese día con la comida previamente preparada para venderla casi todo el día hasta terminar la cantidad de comida preparada que tiene y regresar con la ganancia que es muy importante para su familia ya que este le permite solventar los gastos urgentes ya que  la actividad agrícola que también desarrolla es para  esperar en varios meses su productividad con sus ganancias, trabaja en el campo los demás días. Su esposo es su principal apoyo en el transporte de su carpa, sus ollas y sus bancas para su negocio  que ha durado en estos años por la buena sazón de sus comidas y que ha ganado la preferencia de sus clientes por lo que desea para mas adelante  tener mejores implementos para su negocio. 

Es su segundo crédito con MFP, agradece por esta confianza una vez mas depositada en su persona para acceder al crédito y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos ya que le dará un buen uso al préstamo.

Con el dinero comprara un triciclo a motor para trasladar todos sus implementos de su negocio que son su carpa, bancas y sus ollas.
texts.en:
Teodora is 42 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in her own home.

For three years, Teodora has been selling food in a street market in her area which takes place every Friday.  She leaves home very early on Fridays with the food that she has prepared in advance.  She sells her food almost all day until she has exhausted her stock and she then returns home with the profits which are very important for her family since they allow her to cover urgent expenses.  The farming that she also does requires her to wait several months before she can make profits.  She works on her land the other days of the week.

Teodora's husband is her main support in transporting her stall, pans and benches for her business.  Her business has lasted because of the good flavor of her meals which has won the loyalty of her customers.  For this reason, in the future, she would like to have better tools for her business.

This is Teodora's second loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the trust that is being placed in her once again by allowing her to access another loan and she pledges to make her repayments punctually since she will use the loan well.  Teodora will use her money to buy a motorized, three-wheeled vehicle to transport all her business tools which are her stall, her benches and her pans.

loans.use: to buy a motorized, three-wheeled vehicle

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 22 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y su hija en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración de fustán aplicando bordados y con diseños típicos de su zona. Su esposo la apoya en esta actividad, es así que ambos trabajan día y noche bordando y cosiendo en su única herramienta de trabajo que es una maquina de coser. Una vez realizado estas prendas, los lleva cada fin de semana a venderlos en las diversas ferias comerciales de las zonas rurales, pues es ahí donde recibe mayor ganancia. La elaboración de su falda considera que son rentables porque  es un producto que tiene mucha demanda  por lo que su deseo es mejorar sus herramientas y aumentar su producción. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP,  es relativamente nueva en su banco comunal y en este corto tiempo ha tenido buenos aprendizajes que le han servido en su vida diaria de la cual esta agradecida  y renueva su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de telas y conos de hilos.
texts.en: Liz is 22 years old and lives with her husband and daughter at her parents’ house.  For the past two years, she has worked making skirts using embroidery and designs typical of her area.  Her husband supports her in this business, so they both work day and night embroidering and sewing using their only work tool – a sewing machine.  Once the items are made, she brings them each weekend to the different rural area markets to sell, as this is where she earns the highest profit.  She considers skirt-making to be profitable because there is a great deal of demand for the product.  As a result, she wants to have better tools and increase her production.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is relatively new in her communal bank and in this short time, she has learned good lessons that have helped her in her daily life.  This is why she is grateful and renews her promise to make her repayments on time.  With the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of fabric and spools of thread.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and spools of thread of different colors.

loans.name: Retamas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RETAMAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde tiene como secretaria a la señora Lourdes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda, venta de verduras, sembradío de verduras, confección de deportivos, venta de café.
 
La señora Lourdes,  indica que hace tres años atrás trabajaba con Pro Mujer por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confitería, que viene trabajando hace cuatro años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de su hermana quien le alentó para que abra su negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de dulces y material para su elaboración), que compra de la calle Palenque (calle comercial de la Cuidad de El Alto) y los venderá de forma ambulante, todos los días de 9:00 a 19:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Retamas" will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the Centro Villa Exaltación branch office. The group is composed of eight members and is managed by an executive board which has Señora Lourdes as its secretary. The group members' businesses are varied and linclude a store, vegetable sales, planting vegetables, making sports clothing, and selling coffee.

Señora Lourdes tells us that she began working with Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend. She now has a confectionary business, which she has been working in for four years, after learning the trade from her sister, who encouraged her to open her business.

The loan that she will take out now will increase her working capital so that she can buy sweets and the ingredients to make them, which she buys on Palenque street (a commercial street in the city of El Alto) and will sell as a walking vendor every day from 9 am to 7 pm. This form of work permits her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she lives in a common law marriage and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the advice and the training sessions.

loans.use: compra de dulces y material para su elaboración

loans.name: Nyabubare Twimukye Group

texts.en: 33 year old Gerald is a down to earth and dignified married father of 4. This hard working and warm hearted food sales business man has only been in this business for 4 years but he says the prospects for even greater success are getting better year in year out. What lies at the root of his optimism is the fact that there is a growing demand for the foods he sells not only in food markets in Bushenyi and other parts of western Uganda, but also in Rwanda. He sells principally cassava, beans, maize, millet, etc. Gerald is aided by the fact that he has a big farm from where he grows and harvests most of the aforementioned crops, which he resells. He reckons this business generates profits totaling 120,000 shillings per week. This loan is for the purchase of high grade manure to apply at his farms.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure.

loans.name: Jael

texts.en: Jael is a 30-year-old single woman with two children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Jael has been in the salon business for ten years. She dreams of having a high class salon and educating her children. As a single mother, she says it is always a difficult task bringing up the children alone. However, through her hard work, Jael feels that she can make it. She intends to use the loan facility to buy cosmetics for her salon business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Rudy Ivonne

texts.es:
Rudy Ivonne tiene 27 años, Es soltera vive con los padres, no tiene hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Rudy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener estabilidad economica.

Le gusta bailar y ser una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Rudy Ivonne is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the Ventanas Canton in los Ríos Province. She has no children.

The community bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES is located in the Los Angeles area, which is part of the Ventanas Canton. The members of this community bank are engaged in work such as growing corn and rice.

Rudy works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She buys supplies at Procan Commercial, and sells her products in the wholesale market of Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The support of the loan will help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to have financial stability.

She likes to dance and to be a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: 29 De Setiembre Group

texts.es:
El comité “29 de Setiembre” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan las actividades de forma conjunta y solidaria, dentro de un ambiente de colaboración y de respeto. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Librada es una de las integrantes del comité, está casada, y tiene 1 hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta de varios comestibles, como ser arroz, azúcar, lácteos y demás. Por medio de estas ventas ella puede generar un poco de ingresos con lo cual puede paliar los gastos que cada día surgen en la casa. Comenta que todo el trabajo que hace es por darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar, lácteos y demás productos para abastecerse y de esa forma poder cumplir con los pedidos de todos sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The group "29 de Setiembre" was formed when some neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso decided to come together. All of the members work together in solidarity in an environment of collaboration and respect. The members form a very unified group and together are capable of activities that strengthen their partnership.

Librada is one of the members of the group. She is married and has one son. She sells groceries like rice, sugar, dairy products and other things. Through these sales she is able to generate a little bit of income which helps to cover the day-to-day costs of her home. She tells us that all of the work that she does is to give her family a better future.

She asks for a loan to buy rice, noodles, sugar, dairy and other products to stock her store and be able to meet the orders of all of her customers. She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, dairy and other products.

loans.name: Yaeun

texts.en:
Yaeun has full-time employment. Her husband, Hong is a horse cart driver and fisherman and farmer. They have three children--one son and two daughters. All of them attend school. The family is living in a village across Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Yaeun is applying for a loan of $200 to help with her husband’s farming business by purchasing fertilizer and paying plowing fees.

Photo: Yaeun and her husband and daughter.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s farming business by purchasing fertilizer and paying plowing fees.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa, a married woman with five children, two boys and three girls, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. School fees constitute her greatest monthly expense.

For the last five years, Mejumaa has operated a firewood and charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuation in the market and dreams of establishing another outlet in the future.

Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Mejumaa wishes to borrow Kshs 40,000 in order to purchase bundles of firewood and sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Tserendulam is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Mongolia. From 1979 to 1991, she worked as a typist for the Price Standard Committee. She studied in secondary school from 1991 to 1995. Her husband works as a driver for a local petroleum company; their son works in Korea on a government labor contract. 
Since 1996, she has been operating a grocery store in her city. She has much business experience, so she has many customers.  She is requesting a 1.200.000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase products to sell in her store. She wants to expand her business and earn more money to make a good living.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her small store.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Anselma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Anselma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anselma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Leonito

texts.en:
Leonito is 33 years old and married. He raises hogs to sell to butchers who come to his village. He has been in this business for almost five years. He usually earns a profit of 3,000 PHP for each hog he sells. According to him, the expensive cost of goods and the needs of his children make him work harder to generate income.

He is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines for hogs in order to ensure good nutrition. This loan will be a great help for him to improve his hog-raising business.

In the future, Leonito would like to send his three children to college so they can pursue their own career someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicines for hogs

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya is 37 years old, has two sons, and lives with her family in a small house located in an outer ger district, lacking basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She is a chieftain of the commission where her family lives. Her work responsibilities are to take care of elderly people and to help the homeless to receive government assistance. She really enjoys her job.  Oyuntuya’s spouse is a first sergeant in a local military force, while their sons attend secondary school and kindergarten. 

The family lives in a very small house, which needs some renovation work, such as covering it with a roof, daubing the walls, and refreshing the paint on the fence's door. In the winter, her house is very cold, her children often get sick, and it is very hard to live in when the outside temperature is far below zero degrees; in summer time, it rains. Therefore, she is planning to do housing renovations this autumn, before winter. Oyuntuya is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks to purchase essential construction materials, such as cement, roofing, paint and wood.  She said, “If Kiva lenders will give me an opportunity to make my family safe and cozy, I’ll really appreciate it."

loans.use: to buy essential construction materials which needs in house - renovation work.

loans.name: Reina Luisa

texts.es: Fuimos a casa de Reina y nos atendió muy sonriente, porque ya había vendido todos sus pescado, queso y bollo (Amasijos de maíz con queso, o anís y otros ingredientes)  bien temprano, para que sus clientes se desayunaran. Su vida siempre se ha movida en el comercio, pues desde hace  15 años, cuando se unió a su cónyuge, este le dio el primer capital para que iniciara  con la fabricación y venta de bollos y con  sus ya conocidos  pasteles y/o hayacas, especialmente preparados en las épocas navideñas entre vecinos y amigos y posteriormente extendida en un mercado mayor. Su cónyuge siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de pescado y por eso ella también adicionó este producto y así mismo, el queso que consiguió con distribuidores a un buen precio. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y por eso trabaja diariamente con mucho esfuerzo, para algún día lograrlo y ofrecerle un futuro mejor a su hijo de 12 años de edad. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer credikiva, también primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen y de contado,  pescado y queso que son los productos de más auge en esta época. Su inversión será exitosa porque la hace sobre pedidos y aprovecha la oportunidad de comprar de contado y ganar descuentos importantes, que le generen un poco más de utilidad.
texts.en:
We went to Reina's house where she attended to us very smilingly, because she already had sold all her fish, cheese, and "bollos" (corn cakes with cheese, anise, or other ingredients) very early, so her customers could eat breakfast.

Her life always has been moved by business.  Fifteen years ago when she married her husband, he gave her her first capital so she could start making and selling bollos along with her already well-known "hallacas" (cornmeal, meat, and vegetables in banana leaves), specially prepared in the Christmas season between neighbors and friends, and later expanded into a larger market.

Her husband has always worked selling fish, so she also added this product as well as the cheese that she got from distributors at a good price. 

Her dream is to have her own house.  This is why she works so hard every day, to one day achieve that and to give her 12-year-old son a better future.

Currently she is requesting her first Kiva loan, which is also the first loan she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will pay in cash for greater quantities of fish and cheese, products that are at their peak season.  Her investment will be successful because she takes orders  and takes advantage of the opportunity to pay cash and earn important discounts, which generate a bit more profit for her.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of fish and cheese with cash.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin, de 28 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Nely, con quien vive desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: David, Juan y Jerson, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Pamuri. Como buen hombre del campo, todas las mañanas él se levanta muy temprano para dar el alimento a sus 8 vacas, las que le brindan la leche que necesita para preparar queso. Según cuenta prepara un promedio de 35 a 40 “bolillos” (quesos pequeños), los cuales vende a la ciudad de Pampas, en la ferias de los días domingos o a clientes que visitan su casa constantemente. Además gusta de las caminatas por los verdes campos. Por ello nunca dejó de sembrar, sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, maíz y alfalfa; que posteriormente vende en el mercado de la ciudad, después de cada cosecha. Ahora desea trabajar cada día más y así tener el capital necesario para pensar en nuevos negocios. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Edwin, de recibir su apoyo; invertirà el dinero solicitado en la compra de 10 kilos de semilla de alfalfa, asimismo en fertilizantes y la preparación de la tierra.
texts.en:
Edwin, age 28, is a hardworking man. He has lived with his wife, Nely, for 5 years. They have three children, David, Juan, and Jerson, whom they care for in their own house, located in the community of Pamuri.

Like a good man of the countryside, every morning Edwin gets up very early in order to feed his 8 cows which give milk that he needs to make cheese. He says he prepares an average of 30-40 “rolls” (small cheeses) which he sells in the city of Pampas at the Sunday markets and to customers who constantly visit his house.

In addition, he likes long walks in the green fields. That’s why he will never stop planting his principal crops consisting of peas, corn, and alfalfa that he sells in the city market after each harvest.

Now, he wants to work more each day and thus have the capital necessary in order to think about new businesses. He belongs to the “Santa Cruz” communal bank and this is his first loan with MFP. He hopes for the support of all of you in order to continue towards his objectives. In addition, he promises to be punctual with the payments of his installments. Upon receiving his loan, Edwin will invest the money applied for in the purchase of 10 kilos of alfalfa seed as well as fertilizer for preparing the soil.

loans.use: to purchase 10 kilos of alfalfa seed and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Skylane Jean

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Skylane Jean operates a hog-raising business to generate income. She is 32 years old and has four school-aged children. Her husband manages their rice farming business. Sometimes the family experiences financial difficulties due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, but with their parents' help, they are able to supplement their needs. 

Skylane Jean aims to improve her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and breeding livestock to raise. She believes that the loan will help her to improve her business if she works hard and strives harder. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and breeding livestock to raise

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel Antonio tiene 31 años vive en la urbanización Mercurio, en la casa de sus padres con la esposa, de la ciudad de el alto de La Paz, cuenta con un negocio de tienda de barrio con 5 años de experiencia en el rubro.
El cliente con el transcurso del tiempo ahorró dinero de donde con ese pequeño ahorro abrió la tienda de barrio.
El destino del crédito esta destinado a capital de inversión, refacción de vivienda, con el dinero solicitado realizará gastos de obra fina.
El cliente no tiene deudas en el sistema financiero, en cuanto a su experiencia quiere ampliar su negocio y su nivel de ingresos, cuenta con un espíritu de emprendimiento en la administración de su negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel Antonio, 31, lives in the Mercurio development, in his parents' home with his wife, from the city of El Alto de La Paz.  He has a neighborhood store business, with five years of experience in the field.

Over time he saved money, and with these small savings he opened his neighborhood store.

The loan will go to investment capital for home refurbishment.  With the money he requested he will pay for finish work.

He has no financial debts.  With regard to his experience, he wants to expand his business and his level of income.  He has an entrepreneurial spirit in managing his business.

loans.use: to pay for construction and improvements to his business activity.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Catalina; la socia tiene 34 años de edad, vive con sus cuatro hijos y su conyugue; La socia Catalina tiene un puesto de venta en el Mercado Modelo de Calca pero el puesto es alquilado. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En su puesto de venta sus vecinos encuentran toda clase de verduras  lechuga, asnapa, papa,  perejil, repollo, hortalizas entre otros, con el pequeño negocio que ha colocado la socia Catalina  trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia mediante los ingresos de sus ventas diarias. Catalina se dedica también a la crianza de animales menores como pollos, cuyes, gallinas de doble pechugas, lo cual le permite a ella en días festivos se dedica a la venta de caldo de pollo y gallina. La socia en esta ocasion desea invertir en la compra de verduras , la socia desea implementar su negocio con la compra de verduras y tambien una parte entrara a comprar pollos 10 pares.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN” community bank which is located in Arin district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.

Catalina is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four children.  She has a sales stall in the Mercado Modelo market in Calca which she rents.  She has been in this business for 10 years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On her sales stall, Catalina's neighbors find all kinds of vegetables: lettuce, wild herbs, potatoes, parsley, cabbage, etc.  With the small business that she has established, Catalina tries to provide her family with a better standard of living through the income she makes from her daily sales.  Catalina also raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and double-breasted hens.  This allows her, on public holidays, to sell chicken and hen soup.

On this occasion, Catalina would like to invest in buying vegetables.  She would like to stock her business by purchasing vegetables.  She will also use part of the money to buy 10 pairs of chickens.

Catalina is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and 10 pairs of chickens

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es: El joven Juan Felipe es un campesino de una vereda del municipio de Fredonia localizado al sur de Antioquia y quien es padre de un bebe de 19 meses de edad y por quien necesita reiniciar con el negocio de cría y venta de pollos puesto que actualmente cuenta solo con un cerdo que su padre le regalo y requiere de ingresos para el sostenimiento y cuidado de su familia, en la casa de su suegro quien le dono un pequeño espacio en un patio, desea construir la vivienda para los pollos y comprar 50 de estos animales y su respectivo cuido para iniciar de nuevo. Con lo anterior, el joven Juan Felipe podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y apoyar a su padre quien es un adulto de avanzada edad.
texts.en:
The young man Juan Felipe is an agricultural worker in a district in the town of Fredonia, located in the south of Antioquia.  He is the father of a 19-month-old baby for whom he needs to begin again, with the business of raising and selling chickens.  Currently he has only one pig that his father gave him, and he needs income for the support and care of his family in the house of his father-in-law, who gave him a small space on the patio.

He wants to build a chicken coop and buy 50 of these animals and feed for them, to start over again.

With this, young Juan Felipe will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family, and support his father who is an adult of advanced age.

loans.use: to buy 50 chickens and build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Vilma, vive con su esposo y dos hijos en casa familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de lotería hace ocho años desempeña este oficio y lo inicio debido a la necesidad y por la falta de empleo todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más series de lotería y de esa forma tener lo suficiente para ofrecerles a sus clientes y aumentar en sus ingresos  solo de esa forma podrá ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
El objetivo de Vilma es tener mejores ingresos económicos y cada día aumentar en clientes y siempre mantener el negocio estable.
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her husband and two children in the family home. She has been selling lottery tickets for eight years. She began this livelihood due to necessity, and the lack of employment, and carries it out every day from Monday to Sunday.

She needs the loan to buy more lottery ticket series, so that she has enough to sell to her customers, and increase her income. Only in that way will she be able to help her family with the household expenses. 

Vilma's objective is to have a better income, increase her clientele every day, and always maintain a stable business.

loans.use: To buy more lottery ticket series to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a atender una pupuseria este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja solo por las tardes, tiene experiencia en el negocio, ya que lleva varios años realizando las pupusas.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz, quesillo, aceite, leña, condimentos, que son los insumos para preparar las pupusas, este préstamo le dará mayor seguridad para la generación de la venta, ya que contara con la seguridad de los materiales que necesita para realizar las pupusas.
El objetivo de Ana es tener un negocio más amplio, que pueda también ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición y mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her three children and her husband.  She runs a ‘pupusa’ [grilled stuffed corn cakes] shop that arose out of her own initiative.  She only works afternoons and has experience in the business since she’s been making pupusas for several years.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy corn, cheese, oil, firewood and condiments which are the main supplies needed to make pupusas.  This loan will give her more security to generate sales since she will have all the necessary materials to make pupusas on hand.

Ana’s objective is to have a larger business that will also offer her family better conditions and more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, oil, firewood and condiments.

loans.name: Mujeres De Guineales Group

texts.en:
GROUP MUJERES DE GUINEALES (WOMEN FROM GUINEALES)
The six women in this group live in the Guineales neighborhood of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá, Guatemala. This is an agricultural area where coffee and many types of bananas are grown.  In fact, Guineales is a local word for bananas. The dominant language in this area is the Mayan language Quiche and many people here speak very little Spanish. The women are starting their second nine-month cycle with Namaste.  They were happy with their first nine-month cycle as they learned important finance and business basics such as keeping records of their sales and expenses. They also had a Business Advisor who helped them write a business plan and visited with each of them every month to provide advice on growing her business.  Now they look forward to nine additional months of more advanced learning, and each of them is eager to continue learning how to better manage her business.
Doña Maria Beatriz embroiders traditional clothing items and sells them on the street in local communities.  Her clients like her work and her embroidery designs. She is 24 years old, married with a six year-old daughter who is in first grade.  She has a sixth grade education.  Currently her husband is in the United States and sends money home to the family every month.  She has a small adobe house with a dirt floor and her dream is to build a house for the family.  She has so far succeeded in buying the land for it.  Her strategy for reaching her goal is to do a good job of managing her income and to continue investing in her business.  With her loan money this cycle she will buy more clothing to embroider.
Her monthly net profit at the beginning of this second cycle is 4,667 Guatemalan Quetzales. By the end of the nine months she is projecting a net profit of Q7,960.

loans.use: Buy more clothing to embroider

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 45 years old and married with four children.  With one child in school, Edith works very hard to provide for them.

Edith has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Edith has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Edith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Vogan, Ms. Philomène S. is a married mother of three children. She comes from a family of 12 people, whom she has not been able to see very often. Having inherited her mother\\\'s rice, cassava flour and tapioca business, she began to undertake this venture when she arrived in Lomé. She is on her third loan, which is being easily repaid thanks to the careful management of her business.

She is requesting a new loan of $750 that will serve as the capital to create a large stock of rice, flour and tapioca in order to earn a consistent profit. This will allow Ms. Philomène S. to increase her income, improve her family\\\'s living conditions and ensure her children\\\'s education.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1957 à Vogan, Madame S. Philomène est une femme mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Issue d’une famille de 12 personnes, elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter. Ayant hérité de sa mère le commerce du riz, farine de manioc et du tapioca, elle a commencé par exercer cette activité dès son arrivée à Lomé. Elle est à son 3ème crédit qui est remboursé sans difficulté grâce à la gestion rigoureuse dont elle fait preuve.

Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce à faire un stock important de riz, farine et tapioca pour en tirer une marge bénéficiaire consistante. Ce qui permettra à Madame S. Philomène d’augmenter sa source de revenu et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To stock cereals, rice and tapioca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret intends to buy high quality seeds.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun C. is 48 years old and a widow.  Her and her four children live in Khampong Cham province, Cambodia. In order to supplement the family's income and the childrens’ education, C. owns a grocery store and has been engaged in this business for several years since her husband passed away.  In this business, she can makes around $22/day in revenue. Therefore, two of her  daughters help in providing for the household by working at the local garment factory.  The other two children attend school. In order to satisfy and facilitate her clients' needs, Noeun C. is asking for $1000 to purchase an electric generator and some grocery products for her inventory. Eventually, she hopes to send her children to university with the help of her sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase an electric generator and some grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food sales business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is an industrious woman. She has been in the business of hair-dressing for over 5 years. Francisca's salon business is a source of income for her family.

Francisca has been an LAPO client for 4 years. She hopes to get a loan of $400 to buy more hair equipment and other items such as hair relaxer, cream and weavon for her salon.

loans.use: To buy more hair dressing equipment  & other items such as hair relaxer, cream and weavon

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is a 38 year old married mother of 3 children. She sells baby clothes, strollers, and toys. She began her business with $100 dollars from a friend. At first, she only sold strollers and toys for babies. Now she sells baby walkers, diaper bags, and a range of baby products. This is a profitable business as very few stores are dedicated to baby products. Marcia saw another opportunity in carrying lotions, shampoo and soaps. She used her first loan to purchase these items in bulk. This benefited her business and helped it grow.

Marcia knows that gifts for babies and children are especially popular during the holiday season. She is requesting a second loan with Mifex and Kiva to invest in these products. Her clients have actually requested them from her so she is confident the profit from these sales will give her family economic security and help her improve her business.

Marcia’s dream is to make improvement to her home so her family lives more comfortably. She is thankful for the ongoing support of Mifex and Kiva.

loans.use: Buy more diverse line of gifts

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
In the cheese plant in the rural community of Macarí Ayaviri, we find Hernán skillfully and diligently making his delicious and incomparable cheeses. He inherited this work from his beloved parents and now performs the job with supreme professionalism and dedication. Thanks to this, his delicious and recognized product is in great demand. The wish of this hard-working and vigorous father of two children is to purchase forage to keep feeding his generous cows that for a long time have been giving him great satisfaction for the large quantity of milk that they provide him daily. In order to realize these plans, he would like to obtain a loan, money that thanks to your generous contribution will be well-invested in the hands of this hard-working father.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

En la planta quesera de la comunidad campesina de Macarí-Ayaviri, encontramos a Hernán realizando muy hábil y empeñosamente sus deliciosos e incomparables quesos, labor que heredó de sus queridos padres y que ahora desempeña con sumo profesionalismo y dedicación, gracias a eso, su delicioso y reconocido producto esta obteniendo muy buena demanda. El deseo de este laborioso y vigoroso padre de dos niños, es adquirir forraje para seguir alimentando a sus generosas vaquitas que desde hace un buen tiempo atrás le vienen dando mucha satisfacción, por la gran cantidad de leche que diariamente le otorgan. Para concretar sus planes desea obtener un préstamo, dinero que gracias a tu generoso aporte será muy bien invertido en las manos de este hacendoso padre.

loans.use: Purchase forage for cows

loans.name: Bwafuna (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Zalia is married with five children. She sells and distributes water to earn a living. She wants to use the extra profits from this loan to start a poultry business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase new plastic water tanks

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina comes from a large and humble family from the village of Arapa, Peru. Out of necessity and hunger she was forced to work at a very young age and for this reason never completed her high school eduction. She currently lives with her husband and children in a rented home in the city of Juliaca. Her husband, Raúl, works in the moving services with his three-wheeler, and she started out selling desserts at an outdoor stand. With the little she was able to save she decided to invest in selling second-hand shoes. She started the business with the help of her sisters-in-law, and now with her hard work and dedication she has seen good results. This hard-working and strong mother of four has been hoping to enlarge her business, which is why she turns to you for support. Rufina is grateful for your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rufina, proviene de una humilde y numerosa familia del pueblito de Arapa, la necesidad y el hambre la obligaron a trabajar desde muy pequeña y es por esa razón no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios. Actualmente vive junto a su esposo e hijos en un domicilio alquilado de la ciudad de Juliaca. Su esposo, Raúl, trabaja brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su triciclo, y ella se inició vendiendo dulces en forma ambulatoria.Ahora con el poco ahorro que contaba decidió incursionar e invertir en el negocio de venta de zapatillas de segundo uso. Emprendió este negocio por iniciativa de sus cuñadas, ahora con su empeño, dedicación y buena voluntad va obteniendo buenos resultados.Esta trabajadora y esforzada madre de cuatro hijos tiene pensado ampliar su negocio, razón por la cual recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda. Rufina agradece de corazón el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Increase her income by offering larger quantities of shoes to her customers / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de zapatos a los pobladores de su ciudad.

loans.name: Lwaba East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Tabitha N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk. Tabitha is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a doctor for work. She has 5 children ranging from age 11 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Tabitha makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and cattle.

Tabitha is joined in her small group by Madina K., Beatrice N., Annet N., and Sarah K.. Madina K. has a business selling fish and wants to increase her working capital. Beatrice N. has a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to re-invest in her business. Annet N. operates a business selling pots and wants to increase inventory. Sarah K. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in large quantities

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a diligent mother of 2 young daughters. Her greatest wish is to provide her beloved offspring with a higher education so that they may carve out an exceptional future for themselves. With this aim in mind, this industrious woman eagerly sells orange juice on one of the most crowded streets in the city of Juliaca. Now that her young ones have started elementary school, she feels the need to look for a way to generate more income in order to support them and pay for their studies. For this reason, she plans on expanding and improving her facilities in order to offer her customers more comfort and security. In order to substantiate those plans, Nancy needs the help of your generous heart, and is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy es una diligente madre de 2 pequeñas niñas, su mayor anhelo es brindarles estudios superiores a sus queridos retoños con el fin de que a través de el puedan forjarse un futuro prodigioso, con ese objetivo en mente ésta diligente mujer se dedica con mucho más ahínco a su negocio de venta de jugo de naranja en forma ambulatoria, en una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca.Ahora que sus pequeños niños iniciaron sus estudios primarios se ve en la necesidad de buscar la manera de generar mayores ingresos para su manutención y educación, es por ello que tiene pensado ampliar y mejorar su pequeña instalación para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad y seguridad.Para concretar sus planes Nancy requiere de la ayuda de tu generoso corazón y te hace la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital for improving her service

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mr. Mariano F. Huanca lives in his own home in the Llojeta area of El Alto city with his wife, Mrs. Juana Mamani and their daughter. Mariano works as a bricklayer on private homes and his wife works with him as his assistant.

With previous loans they built six rooms including the bathroom, but he still has two rooms to finish.

The loan will be used to do finish work in two rooms.

This is the eighth time he has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic evaluation favorably qualifies him and he can access this line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Mariano F. Huanca vive en casa propia, en la zona Llojeta de la Ciudad de El Alto, con su esposa, la señora Juana Mamani y su hija. El señor Mariano trabaja como albañil en construcciones particulares y su esposa trabaja junto a el como ayudante de albañil.

Con anteriores créditos realizaron la construcción de seis habitaciones incluyendo el baño, de los cuales le falta terminar dos ambientes.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de dos habitaciones.

Esta es la octava ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Complete the finish work in two rooms of his home in order to be able to live in them more comfortably.

loans.name: Mafomba Group

texts.en: Alie T., 35 years old and married with four children, is the Mafomba group leader.  A very active group member, he owns two motor bikes that he rents out for daily income.  Alie intends to purchase another motor bike to increase his income.  Sinnah owns a food market and Osman has a general store.  The group is requesting a loan of $1000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike and stock for a general store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina has her own house that has all of the basic amenities and has two children that are 15 and 8 years old, respectively, whom study at a public school. Her grocery store has a wide selection of products and it is located in her house. Due to her five years of experience in this business she now has a steady clientele. There is competition in the grocery store business; nonetheless, the success of her sales is due to the store's location and her relationships with her clients and above all, maintaining her store well stocked with merchandise. Marina buys products via wholesale in order to sell them at retail prices, which allows her to have a good profit margin. Marina has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina cuenta con una casa propia que tiene todos los servicios básicos, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años respectivamente, ambas estudian en una escuela fiscal. Su negocio de abarrotes se encuentra mu bien surtido y se encuentra ubicado en el mismo domicilio, debido a su experiencia en este rubro de más de 5 años cuenta con clientela fija. Existe competencia en el rubro de venta de abarrotes, sin embargo el éxito de sus venta radica en su ubicación y su buen relacionamiento con su clientela y sobre todo al mantener frecuentemente un amplio surtido de mercadería. Marina compra productos al por mayor para revenderlos al raleo, lo que le permite tener un buen margen de ganancia. Marina tiene un excelente antecedente crediticio.

loans.use: Capital to invest in the purchase of groceries for store

loans.name: Nancy Piedad

texts.es:
Mrs. Nancy Piedad is 50 years old, is widowed, and completed her 4th year of secondary school but did not want to continue studying. She has 2 children, one son studies in Senati and her second son works as a driver. She lives in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, in the Province de Pacasmayo, in the Department of La Libertad.

The entrepreneur sells prepared food and snacks, this was her mother’s business but due to illness Nancy inherited and manages the business. A neighbor invited her to participate in the "Libertad” Communal Bank. With the first loan received of S/. 300.00, she bought sweets, rice, oil, vegetable stew, sugar, chicken, meats, etc. She has been working with her partner, Manuela Ramos, for three years.

With the S/.1500.00 loan that she will pay within 6 months she plans to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals, for them she has to work every day with more effort especially as a single mother that receives no support from the father of her children. She also dreams of slowly purchasing some articles such as a TV, DVD player and sound equipment for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nancy Piedad tiene 50 años, es viuda, estudió hasta 4to año de secundaria, no quiso seguir estudiando, tiene 02 hijos, un hijo estudia en Senati y su otro hijo trabaja en una combi (transporte), vive en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria se dedica a la venta de comida y de golosinas, este negocio era de su mamá, pero por motivos de enfermedad se lo dejó para que lo administre. Una vecina la invitó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD”, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró golosinas, arroz, aceite, menestras, azúcar, pollo, carne, etc. La socia viene trabajando tres años con Manuela Ramos. Con el préstamo de S/.1500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses piensa comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, tallarines, etc. Sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales para lo cual tiene que trabajar cada día con mayor esfuerzo porque es madre soltera y no tiene apoyo del papá de los niños. Sueña también con ir comprando poco a poco algunos artefactos como televisor, DVD, equipo de sonido para su casa.

loans.use: Purchase supplies at wholesale.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Cora Del Socorro

texts.es: Cora habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 19 años, a los que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante y les ha dado estudios para que éstos sean personas útiles a la sociedad. Desde hace 25 años Cora trabaja como conserje en una empresa de Managua. Ahora mismo sus planes están enfocados en el mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda, con el crédito solicitado cambiará parte del zinc de su vivienda, ya que éstos son bastantes viejos y se encuentran en muy malas condiciones, el agua de las lluvias se le está filtrando y le causa daños al interior de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cora lives in the Sandino Memorial neighborhood of Managua. She is 48 years old, single and has children age 15 and 19 for whom she has dedicated a lot of effort to make headway and help with their studies so they become productive members of society. For the past 25 years, Cora has worked as a caretaker for a local business in Managua. Currently, her plans are focused on improving the infrastructure of her home, and with the loan she is requesting she will put new zinc sheets on the roof of her home. The current ones are quite old and are in very bad condition; rain water has been getting through, causing damage to the home's interior.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put new zinc sheets on the roof of her home

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem R., 33, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh. She works as a rice farmer and sells the rice in the market, making about US $3.00 each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who makes around US $2.50 each day.

The weather conditions have not been favorable for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices, especially rice, to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chhem R. included. In light of the struggling economy, she sees an opportunity to increase her income and is asking for a loan in the amount of US $1200 to purchase good rice seed, insecticide, and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase good rice seed, insecticide, and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Mrs. Rim Meak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people in the Krang Ta Chan village in the Takeo province are requesting a group loan. Mrs. Rim M. is the village bank president. She is a rice farmer, and owns 0.5-hectare, and also breeds pigs. This business is going well, so she is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. U. Voeurn, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Rim M. is 43 years old and the mother of six children; two children help their mother in the pig-breeding business; three children attend the local school; and the youngest one is 5 years old.

Mrs. K. Sitha's husband is also requesting a loan (pictured here). The other members of this group loan have a variety of businesses for which they are requesting a loan.

loans.use: Buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la  agricultura, siembran de verduras, sobre todo cebolla y también tubérculos, adicionalmente cultivan alfalfa y pastizales que sirven de alimento para su ganado vacuno y ovino, de esta manera, ha podido durante estos años comprarse una casa que le permite dar comodidad a sus hijos. Hasta el momento sigue trabajando, sembrando y luego cosechando para poder vender sus productos. Es la cuarta vez que Ofelia solicita un préstamo en MFP. Con este dinero podrá  invertir en la compra de urea y pesticida para sus tierras, además de algunas ovejas.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She and her husband work in agriculture; they plant vegetables, mainly onions and tubers, as well as alfafa and grassy pastures that serve as food for their cattle and sheep. Doing this over the years they have been able to buy a house that allows them to provide comfort for their children. They continue working, planting and later harvesting to be able to sell their products. This is the fourth time that Ofelia has requested a loan from MFP. With this money she will be able to invest in the purchase of urea and pesticides for her land, as well as several sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of urea and pesticide for her crops

loans.name: Magaly Lucrecia

texts.es:
La Señora Magaly Lucrecia L. tiene la edad de 42 años, su estado civil es casada, Esta Señora tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son de 11 años su hijo mayor y cursa recientemente el 1 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 9 años que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como docente de secundaria, en sus sueños esta el proporcionarle a sus hijos una casa propia para sus hijos para que estos no presenten problemas por el día de mañana, en sus deseos esta poseer un buen estado financiero para sufragar todos sus gastos necesarios, en sus propósitos esta ampliar su negocio para mantenerlo activo ya que hasta los momentos esta es su mayor fuente de ingresos.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es la siguiente donde fue la 4 sección 4 cuadras abajo ½ al sur 10 varas arriba, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 7 años, Doña Magaly inicia este negocio por la necesidad de conseguir un trabajo y su prima inicio el negocio con caramelos y galletas, pero debido a la poca afluencia de clientes que se presentaba en su cuadra decide cambiar de lugar el negocio pasando a manos de su prima Doña Magaly y así decide invertir en este que seria su nuevo negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de mas golosinas, granos básicos y gaseosas ya que la compra de estos la realiza donde se encuentre mas favorable los productos.
texts.en:
Señora Magaly Lucrecia L. is 42 years old and married with two children, who are 11 and 9 years old. Her older son just started his first year of middle school, and her younger son is in 4th grade. Her husband works as a middle-school teacher. One of Señora Magaly's dreams is to give her children a home of their own, so that this will not present a problem for them in days to come. She would also like to gain a steady financial standing in order to pay for all of her necessary expenditures. She wants to expand her business in order to keep it active, since her business is her main source of income at the moment.

For the past seven years, she has been running a general store, located about four blocks south of the old "Section 4." Doña Magaly launched this business when she was looking for a job. Her cousin actually started the business in another location selling caramels and cookies, but there were not very many customers in that area, so she decided to move the business and hand it over to her cousin, Doña Magaly. This is how Doña Magaly came to invest in her new business.

She will use her loan for more sweets, basic grains, and sodas, which she buys from the place she considers to have the best offering of products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, basic grains and sodas

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, living in Shiah-Beirut. Four years ago, Rania started a new innovative business producing souvenirs and patchwork for new born babies. Her business flourished over the years, and her clientele grew. Today, Rania is asking for $1,000 to allow her to introduce new and fresh ideas to her customers.

loans.use: Introduce new and fresh ideas

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Pedro Rivas se dedica a su actividad de ganadería y agricultura desde muy jovencito habiéndose destacado en esta actividad ya que es el sustento con que mantiene su humilde familia compuesto por su esposa e hijos.

Diariamente desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana el señor Pedro se traslada con su Ganado para dar lugar a la crianza y a la vez brinda asistencia a sus cultivos de papas, por las tardes regresa con el Ganado y esta es su tarea de todos los días. Actualmente el crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere para la inversión en los cultivos y en la crianza del ganado y es por esto que ha buscado el apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiado grandemente por medio de la entrega de su crédito que está solicitando.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Pedro Rivas has been dedicated to his job of cattle raising and farming since he was young. He has been prominent in this activity which is the sustenance that supports his humble family comprised of his wife and children. On a daily basis, from the early hours of the morning, Pedro moves his herd to allow for breeding and at the same time, provides assistance to his potato crops. In the evenings, he returns with his herd and this is his work every day. Currently, the loan that he has requested he wants for investing in his crops and in the raising of livestock. For this, he has sought out financial support from Ceprodel, hoping to benefit greatly through the delivery of the loan he's asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural and farming needs.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen C., 61, is a soldier earning $3 a day. His wife and seven children work at home making brooms, and together they average $3 a day. Pen C. would like to take out a loan to buy more grass so that his family can make more brooms to sell at the market.  (Pen C.’s wife is pictured with some of their children.)

loans.use: To purchase grass for making brooms.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is married with two children and has received no formal education. Since 2008 Lydia has been selling food supplies, such as gari (fried cassava), okra and tomatoes, at the Elmina first port. Lydia uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Lydia will use the loan to purchase additional supplies to help her increase her sales of food in order to meet the demand created by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lydia plans to save towards a house which she will share with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies to increase her food sales

loans.name: Bupe A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Bupe M. from Kyela. She is married with five children, between the ages of 9 and 18. Bupe has been running a small shop since 2007. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Bupe currently earns about US $210 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of USD 400 in order to purchase commodities such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap and rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Bupe thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk for retail sale

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youssouf Berthé a 37 ans, marié et père de trois enfants,  il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Berthé  est un mécanicien de formation qu’il a appris auprès de son père garagiste. En plus de la mécanique, il s’est initié aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente d’articles divers pour la quincaillerie. La mécanique fut petit à petit  abandonnée au profit de la quincaillerie. En effet il possède une quincaillerie située au grand marché de Sikasso. Il mène cette activité il y a plus 5 ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui  il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 15 scies de différentes qualités, 4 cartons d’ampoules électriques (économique, néon, etc.), 10 boîte de colle, 15 cartons baquettes, 15 paquets de peinture, 50 mètres de fil,  5 pelles, 5 piques, etc . Les marchandises  sont achetées à Lomé pour être vendues dans sa quincaillerie en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des constructeurs de maison (architectes, entrepreneurs, maçons, etc.).
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssouf Berthé, 37, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and their children in a big traditional extended family in Sanoubougou 1, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Berthé is a trained mechanic, a trade he learned from his garage-owning father. Besides mechanics, he started selling hardware to earn a living. Slowly but surely he abandoned mechanics in favor of selling hardware. Now he has a hardware store situated at the big market in Sikasso. He has been in business for more than 5 years. He is much in demand with his clientele because of the quality of his merchandise.

In order to satisfy his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. With this first loan he intends to buy 15 saws of varying sorts, 4 cases of light bulbs (economical kind, neon, etc.), 10 pots of glue, 15 cases of rods, 15 cases of paint, 50 meters of wire, 5 shovels, 5 pick axes, etc. The merchandise is bought in Lomé to be sold in the hardware store, retail, to a clientele composed mostly of contractors building houses (architects, entrepreneurs, masons, etc.)

He expects to use this loan to make a monthly profit of 300,000 F CFA which will be used to increase his working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware for re-sale

loans.name: Dorin

texts.en:
Dorin T. runs a business growing domestic vegetables. This is the primary source of his family's income. Dorin has been farming vegetables for more than 12 years. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and eggplants. He owns two greenhouses, with a growth surface of 776 square meters.

Business is profitable, and Dorin is focused on reducing his costs of production to increase profits. He requested a loan from Microinvest to purchase transparent film so he can finish construction of two additional greenhouses. He is grateful to Microinvest for the trust and financial support the organization has granted him.

He is the father of three children who are the source of his inspiration and his impulse to strive for the better.

loans.use: To purchase transparent film for the construction of greenhouses

loans.name: Olindo

texts.es: Olindo es un hombre muy activo y trabajador, tiene 41 años, es soltero y vive en una casa alquilada, él tiene muchas ganas de mejorar su vida y salir adelante. Recorrer con su taxi las calles de Juliaca constituye su forma de ganarse la vida, sale todos los días en busca de personas que deseen llegar de manera rápida y segura a su destino. Su taxi por lo general está ocupado, ya que su habilidad o suerte como lo llama él, para encontrar pasajeros han hecho que su trabajo le genere los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar, lleva 13 años en esta actividad, y la experiencia lo ha llevado a  conocer cada jirón, avenida y calle de su ciudad. Para un futuro cercano, espera comprar un auto nuevo y ponerlo a trabajar en la misma empresa de taxi, Olindo considera que lo más difícil es trabajar de madrugada, ya que tiene que soportar el intenso frió, el cual hace las noches más largas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus compañeros. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en reparar algunos desperfectos de su taxi, para así brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olindo is a very active and hardworking man. He is 41 years old, is single, and lives in a rented home. He is very motivated to improve his life and to move forward.

To earn an income, he drives his taxi through the streets of Juliaca. He goes out everyday in search of people who wish to arrive quickly and securely at their destinations. His taxi is usually occupied, such that his ability (or luck as he calls it) to find passengers has made his business able to generate the income necessary to cover his expenses.

What he likes the best about his job is driving. He has 13 years of experience with this activity, and this experience has helped him to get to know each street, avenue, and ally of his city.

For the near future, he hopes to buy a new car and to put it to work as a taxi. Olindo considers the most difficult time to work the very early morning as he has to withstand the intense cold, which makes the nights much longer.

This is his first loan with MFP, and he knows that he needs to pay all of his installments on time and he is ready to do so. In his community bank, he is very responsible, as he doesn't want to cause trouble for the other members. The 1000 Peruvian Soles he seeks he will invest in the repair of some imperfections in his taxi, and therefore be able to offer better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of his taxi

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet sells kerosene, retail and wholesale, to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 7 years. Juliet is 34 years old and married with 3 children. Juliet hopes for the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng R. is 51 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh town where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of two children: one is married and lives away from the family home and the other one is single and works in the garment industry. Leng R. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Recently, Leng R. faced the fact that her house cracks down during heavy rains. To solve this problem, she requested a loan to hire a repairer to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To develop a cushion to pay her employees weekly and to purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia
de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 2 hijos, ella pudo estudiar la educación primaria (solo hasta 3er grado), vive en el Barrio de  Lacaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar ovinos, vacas, los cuales los va a comprar y vender en las ferias regionales. 

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando y obtener mayores ganancias

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de Bancos Comunales.
