loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino y vaca.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris C. owns and manages her general store in front of their house. It has been her main source of income since her children were still young. For her, she’s already contented with her business. She just wanted to be more productive and be able to have more commodities to sell. She aspires to improve her business to be more profitable for the benefits of her children. 

	Maricris is asking for financial support to further expand her business. She would like to obtain an amount of PHP5, 000 to be used in purchasing additional commodities to be displayed in her general store. She believes that by having complete groceries to retail, her business will be more competent because customers usually go to store to look for their needs and she wants to meet it. 

	Maricris is a native of Allinguigan, Ilagan,, Isabela. She is happily married to Apolonio C. and they are blessed with six children whom three are presently studying. Macrisis will do her best to provide the needs of her children. She hopes someday that they will finish their studies to able obtain a good future.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Su espíritu emprendedor siempre caracterizó a Rocío, quien ha trabajado arduamente a lo largo de su vida por el bienestar de su familia. Tiene 10 años de experiencia brindando servicios de costura y desde hace 5 años viene trabajando para una prestigiosa empresa que confecciona carteras para damas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es diseñar y combinar los colores en las carteras, teniendo como base la moda de la temporada. Sin embargo, considera que lo más difícil es vender y distribuir la mercadería en lugares estratégicos de acuerdo a la demanda del mercado. Para el futuro, Rocío espera modificar los ambientes de su domicilio e instalar una tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de contar con ingresos adicionales, puesto que sus hijos pronto cursarán estudios superiores y necesitará de mayores recursos.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está dispuesta a seguir formando parte de su banco comunal, en el cual se inició junto a tres amigas quienes trabajan comprometidamente por el progreso del grupo. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará lo necesario para adecuar un espacio de su casa para la implementación de su tienda de comestibles.

loans.use: Inversión para su nueva bodega

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a retailer of personal and home products from Fuller Life.  Some of her products includes Medicines, House cleaner, disinfectant, powdered soap and other things that needed at home.  She would like to avail a loan of PHP10,000 as additional capital for her business. She believes that through the loan her business will become more profitable by having more products.  She hopes that she will be given the chance to further expand her business with the lenders help.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business to purchase more stocks

loans.name: Margaret Wangui

texts.en: Margaret Wangui M. owns the Magy Boutique shop where she sells skirts, shoes and bags to ladies. She has one employee. The store's location is a busy site in the market. Her business challenges are lack of funds and the need for a bigger space. She is using her loan of 20,000 shillings to buy more clothes and bags to take advantage of the December holiday shopping. She wants to be a wholesaler in the future. Margaret is married with three children and describes herself as patient, friendly and good with customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and bags

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha sells groceries and baby things at the front of her house in Asaba, Delta State. She is married with six children and she is 45 years old. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to lift her family out of poverty. She has been in her business for a long time. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 naira to purchase more groceries and baby things to sell.

Martha says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and baby things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions for her store

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 29 años de edad, se separó hace un año y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Es propietario de una mototaxi y brinda servicios de transporte de carga y pasajeros en Cayaltí y sus caseríos, siendo esta su única fuente de ingreso familiar. El nos cuenta que adquirió este vehículo hace dos años con los ahorros que obtuvo de su trabajo en una textilería de la ciudad de Lima.

El estado bastante accidentado de los caminos de la zona ha hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un joven bastante trabajador y muy entregado a su familia por lo que su más grande anhelo es brindarle una buena educación a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is 29 years old; he has 2 children and has been separated from his wife for a year. He lives in his parents' house in Cayaltí district, located an hour from Chiclayo city. Luis owns a mototaxi and provides transport services for cargo and passengers in Cayaltí and the surrounding villages. This is his only source of income. He acquired the vehicle 2 years ago with money he saved from his work as a textile worker in the city of Lima. The rough condition of the roads in the area have caused mechanical damage to his vehicle, and he urgently needs to make repairs so that the vehicle can remain in good working condition. Thus, he finds it necessary to request his first loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Luis is a hardworking young man and very devoted to his family. His greatest wish is to provide his 2 children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi maintenance and repair costs.

loans.name: Oisha

texts.en:
K. Oisha is 50 years old and is an admirable mother. Together with her husband (pictured), she has shown a great, diligent spirit and enthusiasm for agricultural work. This activity has let them educate their children. Oisha continues to strive towards providing well-being and education for her children and towards being able to cover the expenses that her delicate health requires every day. As a result of this, her work has been very limited, and her profits have decreased notably. Since Oisha now wishes to increase the quality of her products by purchasing fertilizers. Her goal is to obtain a larger income to keep providing her children with education and improve the living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 Somoni, which she will use to make her dreams a reality.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Kamal has operated a business providing garden maintenance and pesticide application. He's a 32-year-old single man.

Today, Kamal is asking to borrow $1,200 to purchase a lawnmower and supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy a lawnmower and supplies for his business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 40 years old and married with one seven-year-old child in school. She rents a one-roomed house which she shares with three other people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets two meals a day. Evelyn is a tailor in Katanga and also sells airtime. She incurs transportation costs to and from Owino market — one of  the busiest markets in Uganda — where she buys the materials she needs to make her clothes. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. During her seven-day work week she sees an average of 10 customers a day, both retail and wholesale. Her biggest monthly expenses are feeding the family and school fees for her child. Her major business challenge is the rainy season since she works in a muddy place where her customers have trouble getting to her. Evelyn has been in this business for four years and with MCDT for six years, servicing her seventh loan, working with the same group. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and worked with poor women. She wants this loan to buy more clothing materials and airtime. She hopes to see her business grow and also to start a tailoring school .

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: E.m.

texts.en:
K. is a 56-year-old married woman living with her husband and their four children in Telijjawila, part of the Matara district. Her husband is a day laborer, working full time.

It is very difficult for them to support their six-member family with only a day-laborer's income, so K. has a sewing machine and provides tailoring services to clients from her home.

K. wants to increase her business to help maintain her family properly and ensure that her children receive at least a minimum level of education.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and other accessories for dressmaking

loans.name: Joaquín Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Joaquín Ramiro R. M., tiene 54 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa trabaja en los quehaceres domésticos, ellos tienen 2 hijos y labora como gestor de cobro en Casa Terán para el departamento de medicina.

Dentro de los principales problemas que poseen como familia esta, la delincuencia que amenaza a los pobladores del vecindario, es por esta razón que la familia tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la construcción de un muro al frente de su casa, esto con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad a la familia y darle un aspecto más presentable a la fachada de la vivienda.
Ellos son una familia unida que dentro de las prioridades tienen la remodelación de su hogar para poder brindarle a su familia un lugar más cómodo pero sobretodo seguro a cada uno de los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Señor Joaquín Ramiro R. M. is 54 years age and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He is married and his wife works doing household chores. They have 2 children and he works as a collection agent in Casa Terán for the department of medicine. The main problems they have as a family is the delinquency that threatens the people of the neighborhood. It is for this reason that the family made the decision to request a loan for the construction of a wall at the front of his house, with the main objective of giving security to the family and giving a more presentable aspect to the facade of the dwelling. They are a united family whose priorities include the restructuring of their home to be able to offer their family a more comfortable place and above all, safety to each one of the members of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a wall in front of their home.

loans.name: Zuhran's Group

texts.en:
Zuhran baji is a widow. Her husband died at the age of 58 from a heart attack. This was a big loss for her. He was a very sensible and educated man. He raised his two sons well and gave them good qualifications. Thus, the elder son completed his education till 14th standard and the younger one got his education up to 12th standard. The elder son works in the police department. The other runs a grocery shop at the market. 

Zuhran herself stays at home and takes care of the animals and does domestic chores. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her son’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

She is the group leader for three other women from her locality. Shazia baji and Hanifan baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Razia baji wants a loan to repair her tractor. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Zuhran baji is seated second from the left, cooking.

loans.use: To diversify the business

loans.name: A. Pétronille

texts.fr: G. A. Pétronille est née le 06 Juin 1975 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à HOUNDJEMON Wilfried, Pétronille est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Gbégamey à Allada, depuis dix ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pétronille n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis dix ans, Pétronille vend divers condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, oignons, piments, etc.), ainsi que des savons et de l'huile au marché de Allada. Pétronille s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pétronille a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Pétronille sollicite un autre prêt, en vue de reconstituer son stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences des clients, et par ricochet se faire plus de revenu.
texts.en:
A. Pétronille G. was born on June 6 1975 in Allada in the Atlantique department of Benin. Married to Wilfried HOUNDJEMON, Pétronille is a mother of four children, a few of whom are educated. The family has been living in the Gbégamey neighborhood in Allada for the past 10 years, and share the family responsibilities. Pétronille only attended primary school. For the past ten years, she has been selling a variety of ingredients used in sauces (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc) as well as soaps and oils in the Allada market. Pétronille gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has already benefitted from two loans from ALIDé, both of which she has reimbursed in due time. She is asking for another loan in order to augment her stock of products and better address the demands of her clients and, through this, increase her revenues.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baskets of tomatoes, peppers and 8 boxes of soaps

loans.name: Hima Agahikaine Group

texts.en:
Fourteen years is the time Mrs. O. Flavia has spent overseeing her retail business in Hima, Kyenjojo. Since her business got in its stride on a firm footing, she has been able to make the best out of it.

In a month, this focused married mother of four children earns 350,000 shillings. With this money Flavia has managed to cater for all her children’s education needs. She has come to grips with some inevitable business challenges, to wit: high rental charges. She has, however, not lost heart.

The high self-esteem Flavia carries around means she is full of optimism that the future of her business is bright. On that basis she has come to terms with the fact that she needs a loan to be able to revamp her retail business with more merchandise. 

Flavia belongs to a group of nine members who hold each other accountable and insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Khoeun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan from Trav village in Prey Veng province consists of 5 members. Mr. Khoeun V. was selected by the other members as the group leader. The members will use the loan for different purposes, hoping to improve their businesses.

Mr. Khoeun V. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare parcel of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family.  His wife, Mrs. Sinal Sek, is a farm laborer. They have four children, three of whom are enrolled in local public school; the other is too small to work or study.  Although they try to work hard, the couple’s income is low. So they want to start a new business, but do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mr. Khoeun V. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Bertha Nadesta

texts.es: LA SEÑORA BERTHA  ES MUY TRABAJADORA SU PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA DE HUEVOS POR MAYOR O MENOR EN UN PEQUEÑO MERCADO PERO A LA VEZ UNA ZONA MUY COMERCIAL, EN EL PUESTO QUE PERTENECE A SU MAMA. PERO ADEMAS ELLA VENDE JUGOS, BATIDOS, ZUMOS DE FRUTA NATURALES EL MISMO LUGAR, ESTO LO HACE EN HORARIOS DE LA MAÑANA, AL MEDIO DIA ELLA CIERRA PARA IR A RECOGER A SUS HIJOS AL COLEGIO Y LUEGO SE VA A LA CASA DONDE COCINA EN EL MOMENTO PARA SUS HIJOS Y APROVECHA LA TARDE PARA ABRIR SU PEQUEÑO PUESTO DE VENTA DE VIVERES EN LA PUERTA DE SU CASA LO QUE LE DA TIEMPO PARA AYUDAR A ESTUDIAR A SUS HIJOS. EL ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHAPISTA (PINTADO DE VEHILCULOS VIEJOS O CHOCADOS) Y CASI SIEMPRE ESTA OCUPADO. ELLA ESTA MUY CONTENTA DE RECIBIR EL CREDITO YA QUE ASÍ AUMENTARA SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha is a hardworking woman. Her main business activity is selling eggs, both retail and wholesale, at a small market in what was once a commercial area. Her vending post belongs to her mother, but she also sells juices, milkshakes, and bottled natural fruit beverages in the same place. Bertha works in the mornings and then closes at noon so that she can pick up her children from school and go home to cook and prepare their meals. In the afternoons, she opens a food stand on the doorstep of her house which gives her time to help her children with their schoolwork. Her husband performs paint and body work on old or damaged vehicles, so he is always busy. Bertha is very happy to receive this loan since it will increase her operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 14,000 eggs

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Benita is the coordinator of her group Unidas Para Triunfar (United to Triumph). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Benita is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothes. She will purchase large packets of used clothing that come from places like the Salvation Army in the United States. She will use the profits to invest in finishing her home. Her dream is to one day be able to travel the world with her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Used clothing sales

loans.name: Sata

texts.en:
Sata M. cooks rice and tomato sauce to sell in Abura. She sometimes uses horse mackerel or red fish for her tomato sauce. She has been cooking this food for quite some time now. 

Sata is a single parent who has three children. She has been through junior high school. Sata uses her earnings to educate her children. She will use this loan to purchase more fresh rice and ingredients to cook for sale. Sata plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy an oven so she can start baking as well.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh rice and ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Amando

texts.es:
El señor Amando V. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para apoyar a su esposa con el negocio que tiene de venta de zapatos y ropa por catalogo, ya que tiene varios pedidos y no tiene el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Planean pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya los gastos familiares se encarga el señor amando V. con el sueldo de su trabajo.   
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria Del Rosario Hernández esposa del Don Amando, ya que se encontraba en su trabajo y quien atiende el negocio es la doña Maria Del Rosario.
texts.en:
Sr. Amando V. has had four previous loans with FVP which were repaid on time. He is requesting another loan to help his wife with her business of selling shoes and clothing through catalogs. She has already received several orders, but she does not have the necessary funds to make this investment. They plan to repay the loan using the earnings from this business. Sr. Amando is in charge of covering the family expenses with the salary he earns from his job.

The person who appears in the photo is Sra. Maria del Rosario Hernández, the wife of Don Amando, since he was already at work. Doña Maria del Rosario is in charge of attending to the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his wife's business

loans.name: Mr. Khoeun Nob Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Trapeang Pring village, Takeo province has eighteen people who has been selected Mr. Khoeun N. is a village bank president who was born in 1952. All they are made up a village bank loan in which they will use portion of their loan for different purposes. He is a vice village chief and he is also a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family while his wife, Mrs. Sok Born, owns a general store in local village where she can sell groceries for large profit. Although they both try to work hard they can earn a little money. So to improve condition his family living, Mr. Khoeun N. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. He is a father of two children, one of whom is a security guard at private company, while the other is attending in local school. All the members are taken in the picture but of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Caroline Akinyi

texts.en:
Caroline O. is a 34 year old lady from Sondu, Western Kenya. She is married to George Muga, a businessman, and they have one child.

Caroline operates a pharmacy shop in Sondu town where she sells various kinds of medicine over the counter. From the business, she is able to make a monthly income of KES 10,000 ($127) with which she is able to meet her family's expenses. She has a wide of experience in the business, having operated the shop for the past five years. She is taking her second loan from Kadet Limited. She plans to purchase different kinds of medicine that are required by her clients.

From the profits she anticipates to make, Caroline plans to become a wholesale pharmacist. Her future plans are to build her own house and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock of medicine.

loans.name: Seav

texts.en:
Mrs. Seav S. owns a shop where she sells coffee to people who are her nearby villagers. By doing this, she is able to make 12 thousands riel (about US$ 3) per day. Seav S. has another financial earner in her husband who is a merchant. He always buys rice or other merchandise in bulk to store for a while before selling at a profit. The family lives together with a young child who is enrolled in school. 

Seav S. sees that the business of her husband is very profitable and she hopes to enlarge it by requesting a loan for her husband use as capital to increase the larger quantity of his inventory to resell.

loans.use: To have a larger quantity of inventory to resell

loans.name: Delegpuntsag

texts.en:
Mr Delegpuntsag is 32 years old, married, and has two children, Barsbayar, 12 and Barsbold, 3, in secondary school and kindergarten respectively. His family used to live in Gobi-Altai aimag (Province) of Mongolia, which is located 1000 kilometers south-west of the capital city of Mongolia. In 2008 they decided to move to Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia, in search of a better life. As soon as they moved there, Delegpuntsag bought a small car and started running a taxi business, which has been quite successful, while his wife works as a salesperson in a local grocery store.

Last year they bought a plot of land with a small wooden house on it. Delegpuntsag, an energetic and enthusiastic person, says, “I would like to be financially able to provide a good education and better life for my children." With the loan that he is requesting, he is planning to replace his car by buying a second hand vehicle in better condition.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand car

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S. is from the village of Siempre Viva Norte. She is 43 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase medication for her pigs. This loan will be her 5th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medication for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying beans and corn for retail sales

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mejía está localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo, su  gente de dedica en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos, se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

La señora Jenny lleva en el Banco comunal  varios años y le gusta por los beneficios que ha recibido y además por que en las reuniones se divierte con sus amigas. Esta casada y de esta relación  tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es agricultor.

Tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo, además en las noches vende bebidas alcohólicas, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 6h30 hasta las 22h00, los domingos solo trabaja hasta el medio día. Sus productos los compra en Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su local,  lleva con su negocio como 12 años y le ha ido más o menos ya que ha tenido algunas crisis que ha sabido sobrellevar. Lo que más vende es cerveza.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para surtir aun más su tienda sobre todo  cervezas que son muy consumidas por los lugareños. 

Su sueño es construir un local mas grande para tener su tienda y un bar pero por separado para darles mas comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mejía is located a few kilometers outside of the city of Portoviejo, a city where most of the residents engage in farming activities such as growing and selling coconuts. The members of the Mejía Communal Bank meet every fifteen days.

Sra. Jenny has been part of her Communal Bank for several years and enjoys the benefits she has received and the opportunity to have fun with her friends during the meetings. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer.

Jenny has a store where she sells consumer products. In addition, she sells alcoholic beverages in the evenings. She works Monday through Saturday between the hours of 6:30am and 10pm. On Sundays, she only works until noon. Jenny purchases her products in Portoviejo, but some items are shipped to her store. She has been in business for twelve years and has faced a few, more or less, crisis situations and knows how to overcome them. The product that she sells most is beer.

This loan will be used to buy products to increase the inventory of her store, especially beer which is frequently consumed by the locals. Her dream is to build a larger store so that she can add a separate bar where her customers can be more comfortable.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es:
Adelayda es socia del Banco Comunal “Luz Andina”  ubicado en la provincia de Lampa y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 03 hijos, llegó a estudiar hasta 3ro de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años,  nos cuenta que su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar  mercaderías y animales caseros especialmente chanchos, pollos.

Su sueño para el futuro es ser productor de Quinua para poderlos exportar.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la facilidad con la que accede a los préstamos.
texts.en:
Adelayda is a member of the “Luz Andina” (Andean Light) Communal Bank.  It is located in the Lampa province in the Puno department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a third grade education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  She tells us that her initial loan was for 300 soles, which she used to increase capital in her grocery business.  She is requesting a new loan for 3,000 soles to buy merchandise.  She will also buy small farm animals like pigs and chickens.

Her dream for the future is to become a quinoa producer in order to be able to export it.

What she likes the most about her communal bank are the meetings, the punctuality, and the ease of accessing the loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (groceries) and small farm animals

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En su querido pueblo de Santa Rosa, Victoria ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida aprendiendo la agricultura, actividad que práctica su familia. Hoy siembra cacao, café y hojas de coca, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más fertilizantes para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her two dependent children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  In her beloved town of Santa Rosa, Victoria has spent most of her life learning how to farm, an activity which her family is engaged in.  Today she grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf which has provided her with the income she needs to support her family.  She sells her harvests in the town of San Francisco which is where she obtains the best prices for her products.

What Victoria most likes about her work is sowing her fields and she does this with great care.  She has been in this business for 30 years and considers that the most difficult thing about it is transporting her products since transport is very scarce in her area.  Over time, she would like to buy new land in order to increase her production.

This is Victoria's second loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her repayments up to now and hopes to continue being so.  She is a very active member of her community bank and is very well liked by the rest of the members.  She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy more fertilizer for her land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a paraffin selling business for the past six months, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells firewood to her neighbours which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, she experiences a low number of customers, while during the hot summer season the demand for firewood is high. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase 20 litres of paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 litres of paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
el sr. Carlos Roberto P. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en Santa Ana de Yusguare y se dedica a la venta de helados, paletas, conos.
esta zona es muy caliente y este tipo de producto se vende muy bien, mas que todo a los niños que les gusta mucho comer helados.
Carlos es padre de 2 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando, junto con su esposa trabajan duro para salir adelante, su meta es darles buenos estudios a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de helados, conos, paletas.
texts.en: Carlos Roberto P. is 36 years old and lives in Santa Ana de Yusguare. He makes a living selling ice cream, popsicles and ice cream cones. This is a very hot area and this type of product sells very well, especially to children, who really enjoy eating ice cream. Carlos has two children who are in school. He and his wife both work hard to keep making headway. His goal is to provide his children with a good eduction so they become professional and productive members of society. He plans to use the loan to purchase ice cream, cones and popsicles.

loans.use: Purchase cones, ice cream, napkins, cups, popsicles

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Mrs. Sony S. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Samath Sao, live in a village along the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers northeast of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of them are in school: two are attending universities. Mr. Samath Sao is a weaver. 

Sony runs a grocery store from home. She also assists in her husband’s weaving business when she is free. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to pay for her children's education fees. She will also use a part of the loan to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: To pay her children's education fees and to purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Homero

texts.es: El Sr. Homero C. M. desea construir un cuarto en el terreno rustico que adquirió ya que por el momento vive en una casa prestada el ve en el crédito la oportunidad de tener un patrimonio para su familia ya que el realizaría la mano de obra pues el se desempeña como albañil por lo cual se encuentra enormemente agradecido por el crédito que recibió pues el tendrá un lugar propio y seguro en donde habite su familia principalmente su esposa e hijos.
texts.en: Mr. Homero C. M. wants to build a room on the rural plot of land that he bought, since he currently lives in a rented home. He sees this loan as his opportunity to provide a heritage for his family, as he will build it by hand. He is a bricklayer, and he is very grateful to have received this loan--he will have his own place, and it will be safe for his family- his wife and children- to live in.

loans.use: the construction of a room

loans.name: Selvy

texts.es: La Sra. Selvy  tiene  29 años,  de estado civil soltera,  tiene ya 3 años dedicándose a la venta de blusas, poleras, edredones, dejando al crédito o al contado en diferentes viviendas porque lo hace de manera ambulante, vive en casa de sus tíos desde hace 9 años. Doña Selvy   se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que posee pues tiene un buen grupo de clientes que le hicieron pedidos de blusas y con el dinero ella comprara ropa para realizar las entregas, su deseo de la Sr. Selvy es el de poder comprarse un lote de terreno y poder hacer construir su casita,  es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Selvy is 29 years old and single.  For three years she has been selling blouses, shirts, and quilts in a mobile business, leaving them in her customers' houses on credit or for cash payments.   She has lived in her uncles' house for the past 9 years.  Doña Selvy saw it necessary to ask for a loan from our institution because she has a lot of demand and a good group of clients that requested more blouses from her.  With the loan she will buy clothing for them.  Her wish is to be able to buy a piece of land and construct a small house.  She is a very hardworking woman and is very thankful to the institution for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, quilts and sheets

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the Nabukalu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, and all her children go to school. Hadjah changed her business from selling donuts, samosas and chapats to selling charcoal. She works seven days a week. Hadjah sells her products at the market. She has been in this business for a few months.

Hadjah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags charcoal. The main business challenge for Hadjah is transportation. Hadjah lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and doesn’t have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Edith Mumbi

texts.en:
Edith Mumbi is 32 years old and married to Dominic Kinga, who contributes to the family's income. They have six children. She is a rice distributor and has been in the business for a period of four years with an income of about $300 a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more bags of rice to sell. She hopes to be a leading distributor of rice in the region and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: 02-Dong Ve Group

texts.en:
Nghi H. T. (7) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Nghi is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Dong Ve (08.01.02-DongVe).

Nghi is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members. Nghi has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2010, Nghi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nghi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which was used to invest in renovating the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan Nghi has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  M. T. Thu (8) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

2.  L. T. Phuong (9) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

3.  L. T. Dao (10) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

4.  N. T. Nhi (11) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her clothing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nghi H. T. (7) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Nghi là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dong Ve (08.01.02-DongVe).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nghi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nghi kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nghi đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nghi đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.253.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.159.600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  M. T. Thu (8) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


2.  L. T. phuong (9) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


3.  L. T. Dao (10) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


4.  N. T. Nhi (11) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.159.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 22 años y nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Gregorio vive en la comunidad de Cotowincho de la provincia de Urubamba y no tiene  hijos por el momento. Su actividad de económica principal de Gregorio es brindar servicio de transporte y cubre la ruta de Urubamba – Ollantaytambo y viceversa. El empieza su jornada laboral a las 5 de la mañana hasta 6 de la noche todos los días. Gregorio en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para comprar animales menores como cuyes.   

Gregorio pertenece al banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varios años. (La comunidad Cotowincho se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba donde cada treinta días se reúnen las socias para realizar sus actividades correspondientes.)
texts.en:
Gregorio, 22, was born in the city of Quillabamba in Cusco departament.  Currently he lives in Cotowincho in Urubamba province and he has no children for now.  Gregorio's main work is transporting people on the Urubamba-Ollantaytambo route and vice versa.  He starts his work at 5 in the morning and finishes around 6 at night every day.  At this time Gregorio will use the loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs.

He belongs to the Kuska Llankasun de Rumichacha communal bank of the Arariwa  Associaton and has worked with the members for some years (Cotowincho is located 10 minutes from Urubamba where the members have meetings every month about their particular businesses).

loans.use: To buy small animals such as guinea pigs

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida Luz Aragón de 72 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en yuca, papas, repollo, tomate, quequisque, ayote, chayote, pipianes, naranjas…etc. 
Ella tiene tres hijos, ya mayores y desea seguir trabajando y superándose.
texts.en: Aida Luz Aragón, 72 years old, is a hard-working and enterprising woman who for eight years has made a living selling fruits and vegetables. She will use the loan to buy cassava, cabbage, tomatoes, taro, multiple types of squash, oranges, etc. She has three children, already grown up, and she wishes to continue working and betting herself.

loans.use: to buy cassava, cabbage, tomatoes, taro, multiple types of squash, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis lucha en la vida por proporcionarles a sus hijos una buena educación, la actividad que tiene es la venta de comida. Gracias a los esfuerzos realizados de cada día en su negocio ha podido salir adelante. Inicio su negocio hace 4 de manera muy humilde obteniendo buenos resultados pues el servicio y la buena calidad de sus platillos son muy agradables para su clientela. A esta razón es que se animo a solicitar un crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo como granos básicos, platos, cubiertos, bolsas, vasos entre otros productos.
texts.en: José Luis fights every day to provide his children with a good education. He makes a living selling food. Thanks to his daily efforts he has been able to make headway with his business. He started his business very humbly four years ago, achieving good results because his service and the high quality of his meals are very appealing to his customers. He is requesting the loan so he can increase his working capital and purchase basic grains, plates, cutlery, sacks, glasses and other products.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, plates, cutlery, sacks, glasses and other products.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: La  señora Olga Lidia E. E. de 32 años de edad es casada tiene una hija de 7 años de edad , ella se dedica a confeccionar  blusas típicas y tiene una venta de ropa  típica. Hace tres años su esposo regreso de los estados unidos  porque se enfermo y no pudo seguir trabajando más , entonces viendo la necesidad de poder trabajar decidieron abrir un negocio y pensaron en una agroquímica ya que en este pueblo la mayoría de familias se dedican al cultivo entonces se dieron cuenta de que este negocio si es rentable , y decidieron utilizar un ahorro que tenían para iniciar pero necesitan otro  poco de capital para que  puedan tener todo lo que sus clientes necesitan   por esa razón decidieron  solicitar este credito para la compra de productos quimicos para la agricultura  su sueño es poder agrandar mas su negocio para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Mrs. Olga Lidia E. E. is 32 years old and married with a seven-year-old daughter. She works creating blouses and selling clothing. Three years ago, Olga's husband returned from the United States because he fell ill and was unable to continue working; seeing the need to work, they decided to open a business, and they decided on selling agrochemicals because in their town, the majority of the families work in agriculture, so the business would be viable. The couple decided to use some savings to begin the business, but they need a little more capital to offer all that their clients need. For this reason, they decided to apply for this loan to buy chemical products for agriculture. Olga's dream is to be able to expand her business to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Zoila Atala

texts.es:
oila de 54 años,  vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es viuda y tiene tres hijas ya todas mayores e independientes. Tiene una tienda.

Cuando enviudo empezó a vender yogurt poco a poco fue haciendo capital hasta hacer su propio negocio. Labora todos los días desde las 07H00 am hasta las 9H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para adecuar su vivienda y hacer otro piso.
texts.en:
Zoila is 54 years old and lives in an urban neighborhood of Guayaquil called Las  Orquídeas (it is called "The Orchids" because in its original state there were many orchid flowers growing there.)  She is a widow who has 3 daughters, all of them adult and independent.  She has a store.

When she lost her husband, she started to sell yogurt, gradually acquiring capital to launch her own business.  She works every day from 7am until 9pm.  With the help of this loan, she wants to buy construction materials to make improvements to her home and add another floor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and cement blocks to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated an open food market business for the past 20 years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation, especially when the price of wheat flour and beans goes high. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and sacks of beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 34 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom attend school.  They live in Paynesville. Her husband is a driver. For the past two years, she been selling fried fish and sausage, which she learned to do from her mother.  Her favorite part of being in this business is the compliments from her customers regarding how she prepares her food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, fish, and sausage. Gloria says in the future she would like to have her own cool storage.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, fish, and sausage.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. 
A su negocio le esta haciendo falta espacio para poder exhibir la mercancía a sus clientes, 
es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material para ampliar el local y desea también empezar la venta de verduras y fruta. 
Espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito y poder invertir en el negocio y tener más ingresos a su familia. Quien atiende el negocio es su esposa la señora Mercedes ya que el trabaja para una maquiladora. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio pagara el crédito, con el sueldo de su trabajo será para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier has been selling groceries for over three years now.  His store lacks sufficient space, however, to be able to display his stock to his customers.  Because of this he’s asking for a loan to buy the necessary materials to expand the locale and he also wants to start selling fruit and vegetables.

He hopes to have your cooperation with this loan and to be able to invest in his business to have more family income.  His wife, Mercedes, is who actually tends to the store because he’s employed at an assembly plant.

He will use profits from the business to pay the loan since his salary from his job will be for family expenses and for his children’s educational costs.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire  17 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market. The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old and married to Edward. They have two children in school. Grace runs a grocery business and is applying for her third loan from Kadet Ltd. She will use the loan to buy more tomatoes, onions, vegetables, and carrots to add to her inventory. 

The anticipated profits will enable her to provide for her family's needs and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to have a big grocery shop and to buy land where she can build a house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onions, vegetables, and carrots to sell in her store

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and transport costs. 

Nicholas operates a hawking business, selling clothes from door-to-door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of high cost of transportation while moving from door to door. He dreams of expanding to open a clothes-selling stall in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.fr:
Joselyne est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite  la localité de Gihamagara au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 8ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Elle est mariée a Pontien et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 sont a l’ecole. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 120,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de bananes a revendre afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWITANGE».
texts.en:
Joselyne is a merchant, 30 years old, who lives in the town of Gihamagara the middle of the country in Gitega Province. She has been doing commerce in bananas for eight years. She is also a farmer. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is married to Pontien and is the mother of five children, of whom two are in school.

The Kiva loan of 120,000 Burundi francs she obtained will enable her to increase her capital to buy a lot of supplies in order to make a large profit.  

Joselyne is a member of the community group “TWITANGE”.

loans.use: to increase capital to buy a lot of bananas to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat.

loans.name: Twikenure 2 Group

texts.fr:
Adidja est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite au quartier Buyenzi de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce d’huile végétale pour la cuisson depuis 9ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 3e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Libère et ont ensemble 4 enfants dont 3 étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 300,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de cartons d’huiles végétales de cuisine à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWIKENURE 2».
texts.en:
Adidja is a 40 year-old shopkeeper who lives in the city hall district named Buyenzi. She sells cooking vegetable oil for 9 years. She studied until the 3rd year of middle school. She is married to Libère and has 4 children, 3 of them are going to school. The Kiva loan of 300 000 francs will allow her to increase her capital and to buy and resell a lot of cooking vegetable oil boxes to make big profits. 
She is a member of the loan group "TWIKENURE 2".

loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy and resell a lot of cooking vegetal oil boxes in order to make big profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nelida tiene 39 años,  es una mujer responsable. Su  vida se centra en el apoyo a sus padres: Epifania y Isidoro, que son ancianos y a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el barrio del Tambo. Su rostro calmado y algo serio son producto de su lucha por salir adelante. Terminó la carrera técnica de Veterinaria, con mucho esfuerzo, pues tenía limitaciones económicas, pero eso no la detuvo, pues trabajó mucho para lograr su objetivo. Ahora cura a todo animal enfermo, hace este servicio a los pobladores de su zona, también a clientes de otros lugares que conocen de la capacidad de Nelida, por lo que obtiene ganancias extras. Pero como ella es una mujer emprendedora, también abrió una tienda de comestibles en su casa, aquí vende productos de primera necesidad, en especial menestras y verduras, que son los alimentos que más vende. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en su negocio y espera ampliar su tienda y convertirla en grande y surtida. Asimismo quiere seguir estudiando, “nunca se deja de aprender”, afirma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San martín de porras” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe durante todo estos años. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Nelida de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda y medicinas para la curación de los animales que atiende.
texts.en:
Nélida, 39, is a responsible woman.  Her life centers around helping her parents, Epifania and Isidoro, who are aged and she cares for in her own house located in the Tambo neighborhood.  Her calm and rather serious expression is the result of her struggle to get ahead.  

She completed a technical veterinary career with much effort because she had economic limitations.  That didn’t stop her, though; she worked hard to attain her goal.  Now, she treats any sick animal, a service she provides to her zone’s residents as well as to customers in other areas who know about Nélida’s skill thereby earning extra income.

However, since she’s an enterprising woman, she also opened a home-based grocery store where she sells basic need items, especially vegetables and foodstuffs, which are the food items she sells the most.  She’s had the store for three years and she hopes to enlarge it and turn it into a large, well-stocked store.  She also wants to continue to study.  “One never stops learning,” she affirms.

She belongs to the “San Martín de Porres” communal bank and this is the 10th MFP loan where she feels very grateful for all the support through the years.  She also promises to be very punctual with her installment payments.  If Nélida were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy basic need items for her store and medicine to heal the animals she treats.

loans.use: to buy basic need items and medicine for the animals she heals.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, cuenta con educación secundaria.

Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales, también se dedica a la elaboración de pan.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles dinero que utilizará para la compra de diez quintales de harina y lanas para sus bordados, la señora vende todos los días pan junto con su esposo, nos cuenta que su esposo es transportista.

La señora desea tener una casa y un negocio de abarrotes que le permita generar más ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las bromas con las socias
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the communal bank “Aymaras Juli II”  of the Juli district, in the province of Chucuito and department of Puno. She is 25 years old, lives with a partner and has 2 children. She has high school education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last 3 years. Her first loan was for the sum of S/. 300,00 nuevos soles (PEN), money she invested in her business of handicraft sales. She also makes bread.
 
She is asking for a new loan of S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles (PEN), money she will use to buy 10 quintals (1000 lbs) of flour and wool for her embroidery. The lady sells bread with her husband every day. She tells us that her husband is a trucker.

She wants a house and a grocery business which will alllow her to generate more income.

What she likes the most about the communal bank is the meetings and the members' jokes.

loans.use: to buy 10 quintals of flour and wool for her embroidery.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is 31 years old, and is married to Jane, who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child. Geoffrey has been offering motorbike transportation for the past two years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the money to service his motorbike. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. He hopes to buy a public service vehicle in the future, which will help him improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Ana Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 33 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene una hija 9 años de edad, la misma que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de los padres.

Es una joven madre que para obtener sus propios recursos para  que a su pequeña hija no le falte nada, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa ya que sus clientes llegan hasta este lugar a comprar sus productos, Trabaja cinco días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a su hija.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, etc. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
The Virgin of the Rosary Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally. In this area, the majority of the people manufacture tagua nut buttons, are craftspeople, or are in general commerce. 

In this place we meet Ana, who is 33 years old and separated from her husband. From that relationship she has a 9 year old daughter who is in school. She lives in her parents' house. 

Ana is a young mother who makes a living selling all kinds of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women) so that she can get her own resources so that her small daughter does not go without anything. She sells door-to-door, and she also sells from her house so her customers can come there to buy their products. She works five days a week, selling on credit and charging every weekend. She has made a living in this business for nine years and thanks to this has been able to give her daughter a good start in life. 

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, children's clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc. This is her third loan with the Communal Bank, and she likes it because of the help they give her so she can get ahead. 

Her dream is to give her small daughter the best in life.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, children's clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Duo Amor De Dios Group

texts.es: Duo Amor D. Dios.Este duo esta integrado por doña Rosenda 26 años D. edad tiene 4 hijos pequeños en edad escolar ellos estan estudiando es una escuela publica ella se dedica a la confeccion en telar y a mano,ella confecciona tejidos como centro D. mesas fajas entre otros, es por eso que ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos,al igual que la siguiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos,
texts.en: One of the members of the "Duo Amor de Dios" group is doña Rosenda who is 26 and has four small school-aged children who study at the public school.  She is a weaver and makes fabric for tablecloths, waistbands, etc.  She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make fabric.  The other member also is requesting the loan to buy raw materials to weave fabric.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 65 años, es una mujer buena y muy amable, es madre de cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores, ella vive a lado de su esposo, con quien comparte todos sus días de trabajo y esfuerzo para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de golosinas, tiene un pequeño puesto en su casa en donde coloca todas las variedades de golosinas existente para ofrecer a sus diferentes clientes, empezó vendiendo solo caramelos, pero poco a poco creció y ahora ofrece mayor variedad. Tiene a su lado a su esposo quien es su fiel compañero y con quien trabajó mucho para brindar educación a sus hijos. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que vende mucho en la época escolar, ella como toda mujer buena y con ganas de superarse tiene muchos proyectos en mente, aún tiene una edad avanzada desea seguir creciendo con su negocio y empezar a vender mayor variedad de cosas. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y personas que se solidarizan entre si. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará golosinas y algunos otros productos para empezar a vender mayor variedad en su pequeño puesto.
texts.en: Rosa, 65 years old, is a good, very kind woman.  She is the mother of four children who are now grown.  She lives at her husband's side, with whom she shares each day of work and struggle in order to be able to provide a better quality of life.  Rosa's work consists of selling snacks.  She has a small place in her home where she places all variety of available snacks to offer to her different customers.  She began selling only caramels, but little by little, [her business] grew and now she offers greater variety.  She has her husband at her side as her faithful companion, and with him, she has worked hard to be able to provide an education for their children.  It is going very well for her since she sells a lot during the school year.  Like all good women with the will to overcome, she has many projects in mind.  Though she is advanced in age, she wishes to continue growing with her business and selling a greater variety of things.  This will be her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since with this she will feel confident to advance with her business.  On the other hand, she promises to complete her monthly payments.  She is very happy to belong to her community bank since all [the members] are very kind and people that have solidarity with each other.  With the amount of 1000 soles requested, she will purchase snacks and some other products in order to start to sell a greater variety in her small place.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and sodas.

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
La socia Julissa se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,venta de zapatillas,la socia trae de lugares como Tacna,ella vende en forma ambulatoria e independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia estener un local donde pueda vender la ropa y zapatillas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ropa como pantalones,faldas,polos y chompas al por mayor y tambien para comprar zapatillas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Julissa sells clothing and shoes, which she buys in cities such as Tacna.  She is an independent street vendor and works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm.  The member hopes this business will help her to get ahead.  Her dream is to set up a location where she can sell her clothing and shoes.  She is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale clothing such as pants, skirts, polo shirts, and sweaters as well as shoes.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale clothing such as pants, skirts, polo shirts, and sweaters as well as shoes.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina, vive con su esposo y cinco hijos de 19, 17, 14, 12, 10 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral, Angelina es ama de casa y a la vez dedica su tiempo para alimentar y darle mantenimiento a la granja, su esposo es agricultor, juntos ha tratado de sobrellevar su hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de concentrado y reparaciones para la granja, también ocupara una parte para cancelar otra deuda pendiente. Este préstamo le ayudara a Angelina para mejorar la condición de la granja y poder estar solvente, su propósito es crecer y cada día tener nuevas oportunidades de superación.
El sueño de ella es ampliar el espacio de la granja, también poder a través de su esfuerzo superar a sus hijos en el estudio, para que tengan mejores oportunidades en el futuro.
texts.en:
Angelina lives with her husband, and five children, ages 19, 17, 14, 12, and 10.  She raises pigs and poultry. Angelina is a housewife, and devotes her time to feeding her animals and taking care of her small farm. Her husband is a farmer, and together they have tried to support their household. 

At this time, she is applying for a loan to buy concentrate and do some maintenance on her farm. She will also use a part of it to pay another outstanding debt. This loan will help Angelina to improve the condition of her farm, and to be solvent. Her aim is grow, and to have opportunities for self-improvement every day.

Her dream is to expand the size of the farm, and also through her efforts to help her children excel in their in their studies, so that they have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To buy concentrate, and do farm repairs.

loans.name: Mahuklo 3 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO 3 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Madeleine(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture. Activité qu'elle exerce depuis six à son domicile. Madeleine mariée à un certain Prospère. Le couple a deux enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Madeleine vit seule avec ses enfants, les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Madeleine et son mari. Pour cette raison, Madeleine vend de la farine de manioc, du sucres et des bombons de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Madeleine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUKLO 3, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de la farine de manioc et du sucre.

loans.name: Mahude Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDE est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Irène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Irène est âgée de 46 ans est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Abel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Aucun des enfants n'est à leur charge. Irène vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Irène supporte ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Irène vend des glacières de façon ambulante. Irène mène cette activité depuis dix ans. Irène achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Irène  désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Irène ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Irène sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDE.

loans.use: Acheter des glacières.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 36 years old and live in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and a mother of one child now at school age. Jocelyn earns a living from charcoal buying and selling business and earning approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month. She's been doing this business for 5 years already. Jocelyn requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of charcoal to resell. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to become a major charcoal supplier in the area.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Derya

texts.en:
Derya is 37 years old and has one child.  She started as a partner in a flower shop, later on as she learned about the business she bought her partner's share and became the owner of the shop.  She is using her third loan.  With the help of the loans she bought bulks of flowers and increased her profit.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Derya Hanım 37 yaşında ve bir çocuk annesi.  Bir çiçekçi dükkanına ortak olarak bu işe başlamış daha sonra işi öğrenince ortağının hakkını satın alarak kendi işletmesinin sahibi olmuş.  Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanan Derya Hanım bu krediler ile toptan çiçek alarak karını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy flowers in bulk

loans.name: Lorena  Yamileth

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Lorena Yamileth, I have a business that sales snacks in my one room house, for several years now. I’m happy working in this activity because thanks to it I’m able to help my husband with the family expenses; in the future I would like to get a location because I have a very good clientele.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Lorena Yamileth, cuento con un negocio de venta de Golosinas en mi casa de habitación, desde hace varios años, me siento contenta con esta actividad ya que gracias a ellas puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos familiares, en el futuro pienso poner una caceta ya que tengo mucha clientela.
