loans.use: To buy poultry, bread, mayonnaise, sugar, fruits, vegetables, flour, cooking fat, meta and other food items.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
A desire to get ahead and an enterprising attitude are what characterize Sonia. They are what inspired her to start her business in sales of natural products seven years ago. She has a daughter to whom she wants to give a better quality of life and a good education. This is her motivation for working very hard everyday. Since she began working, Sonia has gotten on well with her customers, of whom she keeps getting more and more.

In order to satisfy the demands of her customers, Sonia now needs a loan in the amount of $300.00, which she will use to by merchandise to fill her customer’s orders and thereby earn a better income. Sonia and her daughter need your support. It is in your hands to help them to have a better life. Your support will be an enormous blessing for this family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Los deseos de superación y la actitud de mujer emprendedora que caracterizan a Sonia la impulsaron a iniciar su negocio de venta de productos naturales, desde hace siete años. Ella tiene una hija a la que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida, y poder ofrecerle una buena educación, es su motivo para trabajar arduamente día a día. Desde que Sonia empezó ha logrado ponerse en el gusto de sus clientes que cada vez son más.

Para poder satisfacer las demandas de sus consumidores, ahora Sonia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 300 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cumplir con sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos. Sonia y su hija necesitan de tu apoyo, en tus manos está el que ellas puedan tener una mejor vida, tú apoyo será de gran bendición para esta familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat K. worked at a government shop for 20 years and then turned to a private business. She has been in business for 15 years.  To buy goods she goes to China and Uzbekistan. Her husband is a musician, but when Inobat goes to buy goods he helps her. Their eldest son helps at holidays, and studies at university. Inobat also has three daughters, and one of them trades at the same market. From the beginning they purchased trading areas in the same place. She always uses her loans for buying inventory. Now their main plan is to install heating equipment in one of the rooms in their house. They have gas heating but during the winter there is no gas or electricity - it’s the main problem of Tajikistan.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Alma Sonia

texts.es:
Alma is single and has a 7 year old son. She has never had any help with his upbringing so she has had to work very hard. Her son was her motivation for starting her own business offering beauty services and she has gradually improved her techniques and services. Alma wants her son to have a good education and to improve his quality of life and this is why she wants her business to grow.

Alma would now like a loan of $475 which she will use to help advertise her business so that more people know about it so that her client base can grow and she will therefore be able to pay this loan back over a period of 6 months. Be an important part of the growth of this business, help this family. They thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Alma es soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad, nunca ha tenido el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a su hijo por lo que se ha esforzado mucho, su hijo fue el motivo por el cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista, poco a poco ha ido acondicionando mejor su estética y mejorando los servicios que ofrece. Alma desea que su hijo pueda tener una buena educación y mejorar su calidad de vida, es por esto que quiere que su negocio pueda crecer.

En estos momentos, Alma necesita un crédito de $ 475 dólares que empleará en publicidad para su negocio con el objetivo que más personas conozcan su estética, ella espera de esta manera incrementar sus clientes y continuar creciendo y devolverá este préstamo en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de ese negocio, ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Advertising/Publicidad

loans.name: Carmelia Mario

texts.pt:
Carmelia is married and mother of a small daughter. Her husband is unemployed and works on small temp jobs. Carmelia needs to work to help support the family, especially her daughter. She joined the credit program this year. This is her second loan. She needs this loan in order to increase her shoe and tableware inventory. If her business continues to do well, Carmelia plans on saving and improving her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmelia e casada e tem uma filha menor. O marido e desempregado vive a base de pequenos expedientes aqui e acola. Por isso ela precisa de fazer qualquer coisa para apoiar nas despesas da casa e para poder ter com que comprar alimentos para a sua filha principalmente.Ela entrou para o programa de credito no inicio deste ano. Este emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o segundo. Ela quer aumentar as quantidades de louca e calcado para poder satisfazer a demanda dos seus clientes. Se o negocio continuar a correr-lhe bem ela pensa empregar parte dos rendimentos na melhoria da sua residencia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Guigani Mariam is a dynamic woman. She is 36 years old and lives with her partner, Mory and their 4 children. Mory works as a butcher. The family lives in Attecoube, a populated township in North-West Abidjan. Mariam has been selling spices and various aroma products in the Attecoube market for more than ten years.

Mariam has successfully expanded her microbusiness during the last two years with different loans from AE&I. She is a hard worker and helps to pay for the family's household expenses, and has been able to send her 3 elder children to school. Mariam wants to purchase goods in bulk at lower prices and thus improve her retail margin. Mariam is a good performer and will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Guigani Mariam will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela is from the city of Arequipa, but her family is from Juliaca. She comes from a humble family, but her desire to succeed in life superseded her economic condition. At an early age she learned to make new and different articles of clothing. Thanks to her excellent work she won the admiration and loyalty of her clients. With the benefits she obtained she was able to pay for her advanced obstetrician studies, and those of her husband Rómulo. Both are now parents of two charming girls and the wish of this hard-working mother is to build her house on the property that she bought with high hopes. In order to realize her plans for which she works hard, Marisela appeals to your caring heart and requests a loan to buy the materials necessary to continue making her fine articles of clothing. Let’s support this excellent seamstress so she can continue sewing her elegant and distinguished articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Marisela es natural de la ciudad de Arequipa, pero por cuestiones familiares radica en Juliaca, proviene de una familia humilde pero sus ganas de triunfar en la vida pudieron más que su condición económica. Desde muy jovencita aprendió a confeccionar diferentes y novedosas prendas de vestir, gracias a su excelente labor se ganó la admiración y el buen gusto de sus clientes y con los beneficios que obtenía pudo pagar sus estudios superiores de obstetra y los de su esposo Rómulo. Ambos actualmente son padres de dos encantadoras niñas y el deseo de esta luchadora madre es construir su casita en la propiedad que muy ilusionadamente adquirió, para concretar sus planes cada cual se esfuerza en sus oficios, es por eso que doña Marisela recurre tu solidario corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo para comprar los materiales necesarios a fin de seguir confeccionando sus finas prendas de vestir. Apoyemos a esta excelente costurera para que siga confeccionando sus elegantes y distinguidas prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity of raw materials

loans.name: Osagbemwonorue

texts.en: Osa has been a LAPO member for 3 years. She is into the sales of plantains, a kind of banana. She is 36 years old and married with five children She is from Edo State and needs the loan amount of $225 to buy more plantains to sell. She learned the business for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more plantain

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina, is a hardworking woman. Despite her age she continues to work with much enthusiasm, dedication and willingness as she did when she was young. With that same determination and energy, she alone educated her 8 children whom are now older and independent. Alejandrina is from the city of Lampa, but has lived in Juliaca for the last 40 years. Upon arriving to this city she began her business selling American clothing and little by little with her earnings she made changes to her home and opened a small general store. With these 2 businesses she has been able to provide her children a good life. Currently this model woman shares her home with her youngest daughter who is studying at a very recognized university in Juliaca. The desire of Mrs. Alejandrina is to grow and diversify her merchandise. This adorable lady believes these changes will bring about better profits. Your help will permit Alejandrina to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina, es una mujer muy hacendosa, pese a su avanzada edad sigue trabajando con el mismo entusiasmo, empeño y voluntad que cuando era joven, con ese mismo ánimo y predisposición ha educado sola a sus ocho queridos hijos, quienes ahora ya son mayores e independientes.Alejandrina es natural de la ciudad de Lampa, desde hace cuarenta años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, al llegar a dicha ciudad inició su labor comercial vendiendo ropa americana, y poco apoco con sus ganancias en su desempeño ha refaccionado su casita y a aperturado su pequeña bodeguita de abarrotes, con estos dos negocios ha podido mantener sin privaciones a sus queridos hijos.Actualmente esta ejemplar madre comparte su vivienda con su menor hija, quien estudia en una universidad muy destacada de la ciudad de Juliaca; el deseo de Doña Alejandrina es ampliar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería, esta adorable dama considera que con los cambios que realice su bodeguita obtendrá mejores ingresos. Vuestra ayuda permitirá que Alejandrina siga floreciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Improving and remodeling her small store.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 59-year-old Mwajuma K.. She is single with 2 children, aged 29 and 34.

In 2007 Mwajuma established a grocery store business. Mwajuma has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery store

loans.name: Comite Ko´e Pyahu Group

texts.es:
This group from Barrio San Juan Miguel, district of Cambryeta was created from another group in the same neighborhood. The required meeting to put this group together was done and currently it is composed of 16 hard-working women.

These ladies' activities consists of: convenience stores, dressmakers, general merchandise retail, fruits and vegetables sellers, fabric and clothing retailers, photocopiers, street market retailers and others.

Each applicant receives the amount od 530,000 Gs. This money will be applied to expand their businesses, in other words, to purchase more merchandise and goods such as, clothes and shoes, purchase seeds for cultivation, purchase flour, baked pastries, canned goods, rice, noodles, dairy and assorted beverages; purchase fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, elastic, zippers and others.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Este comité del Barrio San Juan San Miguel del distrito de Cambyreta ha surgido por contacto de otro grupo formado en el mismo barrio. Se han realizado las reuniones requeridas para la conformación del Comité y actualmente el mismo esta integrado por 16 mujeres trabajadoras.

Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: despensas, costureras, venta de mercaderías varias, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de telas y ropas, fotocopiadora, puesto de ventas en la feria, y otros.

Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de 530.000 Gs. El destino de estos créditos son para ampliar sus negocios, es decir para la compra de mas mercaderías e insumos como ser: telas, hilos, botones, elásticos, cierres, harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas, prendas de vestir, calzados, semillas para cultivar, etc.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes; purchase seeds for cultivation; purchase flour, baked pastries, canned goods, rice, noodles, dairy and assorted beverages; purchase fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, elastic, zippers and others

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday is 28 years old and a school drop out.  He is married with 2 children.  With his previous loan from SMT and some savings, he purchased a motorbike and provides transport service to the public.  To expand his business, he would like to purchase another motorbike and hire another rider to generate more income.  He has saved money from his profit and he is requesting a loan of $300 to add on to purchase the motorbike.

loans.use: To add on his savings and to purchase a second motorbike.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca U. is originally from the Nagarote district in the city of León. She works hard as owner of a small general store, which she operates out of her home in a neighboring area called La Paz Centro.

Blanca has been running her business for 8 years. With income from her business, Blanca has managed to get ahead and provide for the education of her two school-age children.

Blanca is turning to Ceprodel for a loan, which she will use to purchase merchandise. She has had 8 loans with the organization, all of which were paid on time and according to the terms of the agreement.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Blanca U. es originaria del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León y se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación en una zona aledaña a Nagarote llamada La Paz Centro.

Actualmente ella posee 8 años de dedicarse a esta labor y por medio de este ingreso ha logrado salir adelante proporcionándole los estudios a sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día ella acude a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener un crédito con el cual pueda obtener su mercadería. Actualmente posee un total de ocho créditos con la institución pagados en tiempo y forma correcta según lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores has 4 grown children. She started her business 12 years ago to cover her children's (middle- and high-) school expenses. Back then, while she was going through a financial crisis, a friend invited her to a cosmetics party, and she began selling them. Now she has a large network of customers and sellers.

Dolores is requesting a loan of $600 to be paid back in 6 months, to purchase merchandise to fill pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Dolores tiene 4 hijos ya todos grandes, inicio el negocio para poder solventar los gastos de escuela primaria y secundaria de sus hijos. Inicio su negocio hace 12 años, cuando pasaba por una crisis económica familiar, la invitaron a una demostración de productos cosméticos y de ahí empezó a vender, actualmente tiene una red extensa de vendedoras y una cartera grande de clientas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang T., 55, lives in Phnom Penh with her two daughters, one son-in-law, and her three grandchildren. She purchases and resells recyclable materials, making US$3 per day, while her two daughters work in a local garment factory to help support the family. Hang T. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more recyclable materials for her business, believing that she can increase her profits and expand her business with this investment. She looks forward to the opportunities that this loan will provide for her family and wants to see her family's standard of living improved.

loans.use: Purchase more recyclable materials

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es: Doña Brenda vende ropa y cosmético desde hace ocho años e inició con ahorro propios, su negocio no esta tan surtido debido al poco financiamiento y a veces las ventas son bajas, vende al crédito y al contado. Actualmente  habita en el barrio Los López,  tiene 32 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para comprar mercadería de zapatos, ropa de mujer y surtir la venta para ofertar a sus clientes sus variados productos. A largo plazo es aumentar sus ventas, y captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Brenda has been selling clothes and cosmetics for eight years, having started with her own savings. Her business is not very well stocked because of lack of financing, and sometimes her sales are low. She sells on one or multiple payments. She currently lives in the neighborhood of Los Lopez, she is 32, single, and has no children. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy merchandise, such as shoes, women's clothes, and stock her business to offer a variety of products to her customers. In the long run, she wants to increase her sales and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying women's shoes and clothing.

texts.ru: Зоиров Эмомали житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 44 года ,женат ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Эмомали  занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он покупает  на оптовом рынке товар и реализует его в розницу .На доход  от  торговли  он содержит семью.Так как дети клиента еще учатся в  средней школе. На полученный кредит Эмомали  планирует  закупить товар.Погасит кредит в течении 18 месяцев
texts.en:
Зоиров Эмомали житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 44 года ,женат ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Эмомали занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он покупает на оптовом рынке товар и реализует его в розницу .На доход от торговли он содержит семью.Так как дети клиента еще учатся в средней школе. На полученный кредит Эмомали планирует закупить товар.Погасит кредит в течении 18 месяцев

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: закупка товара

loans.name: Bunny

texts.en:
Mr. Bunny N., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Koy, 30, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1995 and have four children; one son and three daughters. Three of their children study in local school and the youngest one is at home, yet too young to begin school.

Bunny has been a mechanic for almost 20 years, having learned his skill in Phnom Penh, while Chanthy has been a silk weaver for three years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. Currently, the couple lives with Chanthy’s parents; Bunny is requesting a loan of $900 to add to their own money in order to buy a house for the family.

loans.use: To add to his own money to buy a house.

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr:
Madame A. P. Olga est née le 15 juillet en 1980 à Teheriba, une ville au Togo. Cette jeune fille est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfants.  Elle a pour activité, la vente de graviers dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2006, quand elle avait vingt-six ans.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 14 camions de graviers afin de mieux servir les clients.
texts.en:
Ms. P. Olga A. was born on July 15, 1980 in Teheriba, a city in Togo. This young woman is unmarried and has no children. She works selling gravel in the Agoè district north of Lomé. She started this business in 2006 when she was 26 years old. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 14 truck-loads of gravel to serve her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gravel

loans.name: Francisca Salome

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Salome P. Ángeles tiene 42 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el primer año de secundaria y ya no continuó estudiando porque se embarazó a los 15 años. Es madre soltera de un hijo que ya le ha dado 2 nietos. Vivió un tiempo en Argentina, pero la crisis de ese país la hizo regresar, en el tiempo que regresó Argentina tenía una economía mucho más baja que la nuestra.
Francisca vende productos de belleza de diferentes líneas en su casa, en instituciones, para amistades y familiares.
Con el primer crédito que fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió en la compra de productos para tener stock.
Con este crédito de S/. 500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, nuevamente invertirá en stock.
Francisca sueña con tener una casa muy linda.
texts.en:
Ms. Francisca Salome P. A. is 42 years old. She is a member of the United Communal Bank for a Better Future II and lives in the Florencia de Mora district of the Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Peru.

She went to school through her first year of high school, then discontinued her studies because she became pregnant at the age of 15. She is a single mother of one son, who has already given her two grandchildren. She lived for a time in Argentina, but crisis in that country forced her to return. At the time of her return, Argentina had an economy much lower than ours (meaning Peru).

Francisca sells different lines of beauty products out of her home, through other institutions, to her friends and to her family. With the first loan of 300 soles (~$100), which was paid back in four installments, she invested in the purchase of products for her stock. With this loan of 500 soles (~$175), which will be paid back in four installments, she will invest once again in her stock of products.

Francisca dreams of having a beautiful house.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: Lucie A. est âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Elle tient un salon de coiffure et revendeuse de mèches à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour redonner de ‘élan à son activité, elle espère avec ce crédit acheter un séchoir, des mèches et des produits de beauté destinés à la revente. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Lucie A. is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children who both attend school. She owns a hair salon and sells hair extensions in Lomé, the Togolese capital. To reinvigorate her business, she will use this loan to buy a hair dryer, hair extensions and beauty products for retail. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and hair extensions to retail.

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es:
Jovana es una joven de veintidós años. Siendo muy joven tuvo una hija quien ahora tiene cinco años. Ella es su principal motor para trabajar y planear un futuro mejor.

Hace algunos años, gracias a un programa llamado PROJOVEN que brindaba el Ministerio de trabajo de su país, estudió cursos de confección de tejidos. Dentro del mundo del negocio ella empezó vendiendo ropa por pedidos. Compraba ropa al por mayor y luego re vendía las prendas a un mayor precio visitando  a amigos y familiares. 

A este trabajo estuvo dedicándose alrededor de un año. No hace mucho consiguió un trabajo junto a una señora. Desde hace tres meses Yovana se encarga de hacer control de calidad  en la empresa de la señora.

Más adelante ella piensa abrir un taller de confección propio.
texts.en:
Jovana is a young woman of 22. When she was very young she had a daughter who is now five years old who is her motivation for working and planning a better future. A few years ago, thanks to a programme called PROJOVEN offered by the Ministry of Labour in her country, she studied weaving. She ventured into the world of commerce, starting with selling clothes on order. She purchased clothing wholesale and later retailed the items at a better price, visiting friends and family. She was in this line of business for roughly one year. Not long ago she found work with a woman. For the past three months Yovana has been responsible for quality control in this woman's business. In the future, she is thinking of opening her own dressmaking shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov H. is 53 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She sells fermented fish at the market to earn a living and is able to make around US$ 20 in revenue each day. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables and makes US$ 5 a day. This couple has three children, two of whom are in school and one who is a farmer. Nov H. would like to take out a loan to purchase more fermented fish to re-sell.

loans.use: purchase fish to re-sell

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab M. is a 57-year-old married woman with two children. For the past four years she has rented a store in the local market where she sells different kinds of food. She began her business to keep herself busy and active when her husband could not find a job. Her salary as a nurse was not enough to provide for even the basic needs of her children, and so now her small business is the main source of family income. 

Zeynab works from 8am until 10pm, and her friendly and polite approach has earned her a large clientele. Now she would like to purchase more goods so that she can increase the range of products on offer. In this way she will be able to provide for her children's needs and pay their school fees. Zeynab promises to repay her loan within 15 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for her store

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou S. est mariée et a une coépouse, mère de 3 enfants (1garçon et 2 filles) elle est née le 20 Novembre 1965 à Bougouni une  préfecture de la 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Elle vit dans la maison de leur mari avec son coépouse et leurs enfants à Kadiolo quartier Noumousso.
Elle fait le commerce de pagnes wax,de  tissus et de tasses depuis 3ans et possède un atelier de couture où elle coud et vend des habits et fait également des prestations de couture. Elle se fait aider par un tailleur qu’elle paye en fin du mois. Kadiatou  enseigne aussi à l’école primaire de Kadiolo ( Noumousso) . Elle mène ses différentes activités en harmonie. 
Elle est à son premier prêt  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de ses clients. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 10 complets de tissus homme, 1pièce de  bazin, 2 pièces de pagnes wax et autres articles. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako(capitale du Mali) et au Burkina faso. Elle vend au comptant ou à crédit (sur commande et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie fera l’objet d’épargne car elle  aimera construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. Kadiatou is married and the mother of three children, one boy and two girls. She was born on November 20, 1965 in Bougouni, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali. She lives in her husband's house, together with his co-spouse and their children, in the Noumousso neighborhood in Kadiolo. She sells wax pagnes (colorful African cloth), fabrics, and bazins (highly prized cloth). For three years, she's been owning a sewing workshop where she sews and sells clothing. She also offers sewing services. She's getting help from a tailor, who she pays at the end of the month. Kadiatou is also a teacher at Kadiolo's elementary school. She manages to do all these activities harmoniously.

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. She intends to use it to buy 10 full sets of men's fabric, 1 piece of bazin, 2 pieces of wax pagnes, and other items. She gets her supplies in Bamako, the capital of Mali, and in Burkina Faso. She sells for cash or on credit (retail and on order) to a clientele comprising both women and men. She foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 80'000 (ca US$ 165), to be used in part to bolster her working capital. The other part will be put aside, because she would like to build a home to live in the city of Sikasso.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, pagnes and bazin (African cloth), and other items

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn V. is a rice grower. She is 51 years old and has 6 children. Her life is totally spent growing plants. Her parents taught her everything about farming. While her harvest is intended for family consumption, she sells some to her neighbor to augment the family's income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will help a lot, especially her family by increasing their harvest.

CEVI helps her sustain and grow her business even more. She receives not just loans, but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy farming fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Fambaye

texts.fr: FAMBAYE D. EST PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES.ELLE  A PLUS DE CINQ ANS D'EXPERIENCE DANS LE PETIT COMMERCE.SON OBJECTIF EST DE DIVERSIFIER SON COMMERCE AFIN DE SATISFAIRE SA CLIENTELE.
texts.en:
Fambaye D. has been a recipient parent for several years. She has over five years of experience in small-scale commerce. Her objective is to diversify her business in order to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena R. R.  tiene 26 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria incompleta,  tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Elena  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la venta de comida, este negocio se inicio hace un años,  su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes.
El crédito de 700 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una cocina, ollas, sillas y mesas para implementar su restaurante y productos de belleza.
Elena  tiene como sueño tener su propio restaurante  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Elena R. R. is 26 years old. She lives in the La Esperanza district in the Trujillo area of La Liberta, Peru.

She completed high school and she has a son that is still dependent on her.

She sells beauty products and also runs a catering business. She started this business years ago, running the business from her home.

With the first loan of 300 soles received from the Bellavista II community bank (Kiva Field Partner), she made an investment in the pruchase of beauty products such as skin lotions and perfumes.

With this loan of 700 soles she will make an investment in remodelling her kitchen, including the purchase of pots and pans, tables and chairs with the goal of establishing a restaurant and a place to sell beauty products.

Elena's dream is to have her own restaurant and to grow as a small business owner.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen articles such as pots and pans, tables and chairs to set up a restaurant and a place to sell beauty products.

loans.name: Namutebi Hadjah's Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is the leader of a five-member group. She is 43 years old and married with five children aged between 6 and 26 years old. Three of her children are in school. Hadjah lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a three-roomed house, with electricity but no piped water, where she lives with four other people. Her family get three meals a day, and she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business, and food for her family.

For the last seven years Hadjah has sold milk and bread in Kawempe. She sells to an average of 30 customers a day, seven days a week. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys the produce at her place of work. Hadjah has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more milk and bread. Hadjah aspires to see her business grow bigger and hopes to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more milk and bread

loans.name: Rafiu

texts.en: Rafiu lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods in her house, and has been in this business for twenty-five years. She is very happy with the growth of her business, especially after she started borrowing from LAPO, a Kiva field partner, three years ago. Rafiu is fifty years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Edivinah's Group

texts.en:
U. Edivinah is a hard working lady with a strong drive to succeed. She is divorced but has managed to take care of her 3 children, all still in school and between the ages of 18 to 3, while she cares for 2 orphans. Edivinah has had a grocery business where she sells vegetables, beans, ground nuts and bananas for 15 years now. She is now able to make weekly profits of 100,000 Ugandan shillings (about $47 US) yet she started with capital of 50,000 shillings.

She has a dream of transforming from retail to wholesale so that she can be able to make greater profits from her sales. She needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale since having a bigger quantity of stock works so well for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 65 años, comparte su vida junto a sus 6 hijos, a quienes siempre trató de brindar lo necesario para su desarrollo, ya que al quedar viuda tuvo que asumir nuevas responsabilidades y roles dentro de su casa. Trabajar en diversas actividades le dio la posibilidad de adquirir y construir otras casas en su localidad, por lo que se inició en el alquiler de viviendas, pues es uno de los negocios más rentables en su localidad, debido a la gran demanda que hay en su distrito. Es así que desde hace 5 años se dedica a realizar las cobranzas mensuales a sus inquilinos, quienes son muy puntuales y por ello trata de brindarles las condiciones necesarias y cómodas. Para ello, desea instalar algunos servicios adicionales y mejorar la fachada de las habitaciones y construir algunos  cuartos adicionales para alquilarlos a personas solteras. Por tal motivo, Felicita trata de ampliar su casa, para que en el futuro implemente una casa de hospedaje, la cual le produzca mayores ingresos económicos que posibiliten la mantención de su tan numerosa familia. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir formando parte de la gran cantidad de socias que hay en la institución, tratando de mostrar siempre responsabilidad y compromiso. Los 3000 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán invertir en la ambientación y construcción de nuevas habitaciones para alquilar.
texts.en:
Felicita is 65 years old. She has always given of herself for her 6 children and has tried to provide what is best for them. As a widow, she has learned to assume new responsibilities and roles within her home. Working in different businesses gave her the opportunity to acquire and construct other homes in her area. She began renting out apartments, which is one of the most profitable businesses in her area due to the high demand for housing in her district. For the past 5 years, she has handled the monthly billing to her tenants, who are very punctual. She seeks to provide them with the necessary conditions to make them comfortable.

Felicita would like to install additional bathrooms, improve the exterior façade, and build additional units that can be rented out to single tenants. Therefore, she wants to enlarge her building so that she can convert it into a lodging house in the future. This will not only provide her with great financial returns, but it will also help numerous families secure housing. Felicita is taking out her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and hopes to remain part of a larger group of members involved with the Institution who demonstrate responsibility and commitment. Her loan of 3000 soles will be used to remodel existing rooms and construct new rooms for rent.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of new rental rooms & remodeling of existing ones

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastasia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil conviviente es madre de 08 hijos (6 a su cargo) y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (2do grado), vive en la Ilave Jr. San Martín S/n..

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de diversos tipos de cereales. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de cereales como quinua, cebada, trigo, etc. El mismo que lo vende en la feria semanal de Ilave.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas
texts.en:
Mrs. Anastasia belongs to the Communal Bank “Manuela de Hoy II”, which is located in the community of Camicachi in the Llave district, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 47 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of eight children (six depend on her). She has some elementary school education (2nd grade) and lives in the town of Llave Jr., San Martín. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (micro-finance institution) for almost two years. Her first loan of 500 nuevos soles was used as capital to purchase different types of cereals. She is now requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase cereals, such as quinoa, barley, wheat, etc. She will sell them at the weekly fair in Llave. Her greatest wish is to continue to work to help her children. She enjoys the savings and the loan workshops.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase quinoa, barley, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Akongo

texts.en: Akongo M. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a backery.  Akongo is 46 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant . She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a backery

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is managing a store in the village of Angoluan Echague. She is married to Alfredo and they have three children: Albert-20 years old college graduate; Gener-18 years old and Alexander-14 years old who is a high school student. Melinda wishes that her children will all finish their studies.  This is thre reason why they keep on working hard for them to provide their educational needs.  

“Through sacrifices and patience you can achieve success” said Melinda. Her family have cooperation to each other. Melinda would like to buy additional merchandise to be further minimize her fare in going to and from the market. But her capital is insufficient that’s the reason why she is asking additional financial support to the KIVA lenders to be able to generate bigger income for her family needs. She is requesting a loan amounting PHP5000 for her business expansion and improvement.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Soumaïla

texts.fr: A. Soumaïla est né en 1954 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Soumaïla vit depuis vingt cinq ans à Zounkpa à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Soumaïla est marié à GANHOUINGNON Agnès, une revendeuse d’engrais. Le couple a huit enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. En plus de ces enfants, Soumaïla a également un enfant à charge. Soumaïla et Agnès supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Soumaïla exerce depuis une vingtaine d’année le métier de jardinier. En plus de cela, Soumaïla vend des produits phytosanitaires à son domicile.  Soumaïla s’approvisionne à Akouèto au Bénin. Soumaïla est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé. Pour étendre son activité, afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients et de sa famille, Soumaïla sollicite ce deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Soumaïla A. was born in 1954 in Ouidah, a historic city in Benin. He has been living for 25 years in Zounkpa in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. He is married to Agnès Ganhouingnon, a merchant of fertilizer. The parents have eight children who all attend school. In addition, Soumaïla cares for another child. Soumaïla and Agnès provide together for their family.

Soumaïla has been a gardener for 20 years. He also sells plant-care products from his home. He gets his supplies in Akouèto in Benin. This is Soumaïla’s second loan with Alidé. His first loan was repaid on schedule. To boost his business, better meet the demand of his customers and provide for his family, Soumaïla came to Alidé and applied for his second loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a powered pump

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de quatre femmes qui vivent dans des ménages polygames traditionnels. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans, 6 enfants et habitent  dans quartier Bamanan Kin (Diamarabougou) de Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier. Cette association, fut encadrée par l’ONG ROCAM II dans le cadre de ses formations en teinture, alphabétisation, assainissement etc. 
Ces femmes du groupe Danaya font comme activités  le commerce d’articles divers et ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. 
Après quatre prêt solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 5ème  prêt de groupe qu’elles comptent utiliser pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax, 10 pièces de tissus, six  tenues brodées,  2 sacs de sucre, 20 kg de gingembre, 1panier de citron, 1panier de tamarin, 1 colis  de poudre de pain de singe, 1paquet de poudre de jus de fruits, 1paquet d’essences aromatisées, 68 chargements de charrettes en bois. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  en pagnes wax et en tissus une fois par mois à Bamako  et  quelques rares fois  au grand marché de Ségou, en sucre et ingrédients pour la préparation de jus locaux sur place à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou Markala, hebdomadairement en bois de chauffe à Sarkala. La vente se fait sur place à domicile ou en ambulant, au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 71.000 FCFA qui servira à satisfaire certaines charges de la famille, aux petits besoins personnels, au remboursement des intérêts du prêt et  à participer aux évènements sociaux.
Leurs ambitions sont : avoir un moyen de transport du bois de chauffe, épargner petit à petit afin d’avoir  une maison à usage  d’habitation propre à eux et à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of four women that live in traditional polygamous households. On average, they are 48 years of age and have 6 children. They live in the Bamanan Kin (Diamarabougou) neighborhood of Markala (4th administrative Region of the republic of Mali). They know each other through bonds of neighborhood and of membership to the same traditional association of women of the neighborhood. This association was formed by the NGO ROCAM II as part of their efforts to train in the dyeing of cloth, literacy, sanitation, etc. These women of the Danaya group work selling various items and approached Soro Yiriwaso in the interest of satisfying the needs of their clientele. After four successfully repaid loans, they are on their 5th group loan, which they plan to use to buy 10 pieces of wax for making batik cloth, 10 pieces of fabrics, six skeins of embroidery thread, 2 bags of sugar, 20 kg of ginger, 1 crate of lemons, 1 crate of tamarinds, 1 package of powdered baobab fruit, 1 package of powdered fruit juice, 1 package of flavored sodas and 68 loads of firewood. They supply themselves in wax and in fabrics once a month in Bamako and occasionally in the big market of Ségou. They buy sugar and ingredients for the preparation of local juices at the weekly market in Diamarabougou Markala and they buy firewood weekly at the market in Sarkala. Their sales are made door-to-door or on foot, for cash and for credit to a clientele composed of women and men. They hope to realize a monthly average profit of 71,000 FCFA that will serve to satisfy certain family expenses, cover their small personal needs, repay the loan and permit them to participate in social events. Their ambitions are to have a means of transportation for the firewood and to save little by little in order to have a house of their own for themselves and their children.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wax, fabrics, firewood, fruits, sugar, etc for resale

loans.name: Nouratou

texts.fr: B. Nouratou est née le 24 Mars 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Nouratou est mariée à ADEKAMBI Sunday, un revendeur. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Nouratou vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, depuis sept ans. Nouratou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la maison. Nouratou a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Après cela, Nouratou a appris la coiffure et l'exerce depuis neuf ans de cela. Nouratou vend également des mèches et des produits pour cheveux dans son salon de coiffure situé à Adogléta à Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Nouratou s'approvisionne. Nouratou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'agrandir son commerce, Nouratou sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Nouratou was born on March 24, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ADEKAMBI Sunday, a retailer.  The couple has three children who are all in school.  For seven years, she has lived with her children and husband in the Ayélawadjè district in Cotonou.  She helps her husband to meet household expenses.  Nouratou attended school through the secondary level.  Afterwards, she learned about hairstyling and has been working at it for nine years since then.  She also sells hair extensions and hair products in her salon located in Adogléta in Cotonou.  She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  To increase her working capital and to expand her commerce, she's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and products for hairstyling

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
la sra. Maribel A. A. se dedica a la compra de cerdos para venderlos por pedasos, este negocio es muy bueno ya que muchas personas comen carne de cerdo todos los dias por barato y sabroso.
tambien se dedica a vender chicharrones, con la lonja que le queda del destazo de los cerdos la pone a cocinar y hace los chicharrones, estos los vende por libras.
estando ahi nos dio a probar un chicharron de los que Maribel hace y sabe super sabroso.
ahora necesita un credito para comprar mas cerdos ya que esta temporada de navidad las personas compran los cerdos enteros y se esta quedando sin carne para vender.
texts.en:
Señora Maribel A. A. buys pigs and butchers them to sell the different pieces of meat. This business is very good because many people eat pork products everyday as its cheap and tasty. She also sells pork rinds, with the part of the pigs that is left over. She cooks these and makes pork rinds which she then sells by the pound. While there, she let us try some pork rinds or “chicharon” that she made and they were super tasty. Right now, she needs a loan to buy more pigs as it is the Christmas season and people are buying whole pigs and so she is out of pork to sell.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and butcher them into pieces to sell

loans.name: Grace Nyambura

texts.en:
Grace has been running the Pegra Auto Spares hardware and selling spare parts to mechanics over the last few years. She has one employee. Her business challenge is lack of funds and strong competition. She is using this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more spare parts. In the future, she wants to be a supplier of containers of auto spare parts.

Grace is married and has seven children. She describes herself as a person of good morals and dedicated to her work.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts

loans.name: Faithful Traders Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Faithful Traders' group from Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to improve their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, these entrepreneurs will be able to attract many more customers, make more sales, and earn more profit. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aruna Banra who is second from right. The 31-year-old is the father of one primary school going child. Aruna is a carpenter by profession, working for 3 years now, and his wife is a businesswoman. Aruna has applied for this loan in order to buy working materials like lumber, nails, polish, glue and so on.

loans.use: Buy working materials like lumber, nails, polish, glue, and so on

loans.name: Musana Kwebisaho Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: R. Jackson is 56 years old and the leader of his lending group in Ntungamo. He is a hard working and cooperative man, married with six children aged 5 - 28.  He also takes care of his other relatives. For the past 15 years, he has been involved in farming and agriculture, selling farm produce and having a butchery business in Kyangara Trading Centre. He is able to make, on average, a weekly profit of 120,000 UGX because of his good products and services. He hopes to expand his businesses and increase supplies, educate his children and acquire more wealth. Jackson needs a loan to help buy more cows for resale and for meat in his butchery.

loans.use: to buy more cows for meat and for resale

loans.name: Erkinoy Abduhalilova's Group

texts.en: A. Erkinoy is a native of Aravan - she was born there. She is 50 years old and is married with three children: her son is in Russia at present; her first daughter is married and lives with her husband; while her youngest daughter just finished school and helps in the business. Her husband is a pensioner from the police force. Erkinoy works in a rural authorities office as a leading specialist in social security. Additional to this income, they have a family business fattening cattle. This loan will be used to buy a calf. Erkinoy is saving money to build a good sheep-yard. Banihan, 53, is the mother of two grown sons and also has two charming grandchildren. She started her own business after her divorce ten years ago. Since then she has achieved excellent results. At the present time she has five bulls, one cow in calf and one calf. Also she has land where she cultivate crops: rice, cotton and potatoes. This loan will be used to buy seeds for the spring sowing. Adinahon is 47 years old. She is involved in a livestock business and in farming, usually growing cotton. Her husband and son help her in this. Also they have a couple of cattle. This loan will be used to buy cotton seed and fertilizer because at the present time they are cheaper than in early spring. Parhatjon is the only male in this group. He is 46 years old and married with two children: a son and a daughter. He is involved in cattle raising and, at the same time, he is the personal driver of the local rural governor. Parhatjon started his livestock business in 2000 with just one cow. Now he is fattening eight bulls. With your support he will be able to buy 1 tonne of animal fodder (oil cake). ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Julia Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Julia S. tiene la edad de 34 años, es comerciante desde hace 4 años, antes de obtener el negocio era estudiante de cocina y a la vez vendía comida ambulante, hoy en día se dedica al comercio y tiene una pulpería en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa de donde ella es originaria, vende todo lo que es granos, enlatados, leche, salsas, etc. Este negocio lo obtuvo porque anteriormente era de su mamá, esta acompañada y tiene 2 hijos que están en la edad escolar.
Doña Julia trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 5 años y todos sus créditos han sido para invertir en su negocio, ya que esto le ha permitido mantener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Julia S., 34, has been a merchant for the past 4 years. Prior to getting her business she was studying cooking and peddled prepared food. Today, she is in commerce and has a grocery store in Chinandega's municipal market, which is where she's from. She sells all kinds of grains, canned goods, milk, sauces, etc. She got this business because it used to be her mother's. She has a partner and two, school-age children. Julia has collaborated with Ceprodel for 5 years now; she has used all her loans to invest in her business because this has helped her have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods.

loans.name: Carot Group

texts.en:
Isabela I., age 25, is married with one daughter of three years. She has operated a salon business since 2003. She works from 8.30 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $114.

This will be Isabela’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more salon equipment and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to improve further on her salon stock.

Isabela will share this loan with her loan group, Carot, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the photo, Isabela is second from left, second row, standing in a colored dress.

loans.use: To buy salon requirements

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man living with his family. He has been in phone sales for four years and in January 2010, he opened a small phone-sales shop. He sells mobile phones and he also repairs all type of phones. Ali is very glad because he finally started his own business to build his career. 

In order to reinforce his new business, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to increase his inventory and buy new phone models to attract more clients and be always able to fulfill their requests.

loans.use: Increase his inventory and buy new phone models

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
La Señora Raimunda V. tiene 56 años D. edad, es viuda desD. hace 4 años, ella vive en Cochabamba sola con un hijo, Raimunda vive en inmediaciones D. Maica Central, en la periferia D. la ciudad, en una zona agrícola del departamento D. Cochabamba. 

Raimunda es una señora que dedica a la producción D. leche cruda y venta D. quesillos, en el mercado D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, ella desD. que falleció su esposo se encargo D. todos los gastos del su casa, el cuidado D. su ganado vacuno, la producción D. leche la elaboración D. sus quesillos y con ayuda D. su hijo D. 13 años comercializa los quesillo en el mercado local. La señora Raimunda trabaja todos los días incluso domingos desD. muy temprano y hasta que se acueste el sol, sin descanso. La Señora Raimunda sabe que es esfuerzo es por el bienestar D. su hijo, para que cuando termine el colegio pueda estudiar una carrera, y pueda sostenerse solo luego pues, la señora Raimunda no podrá sostenerlo por mucho tiempo por su avanzada edad.  

La señora Raimunda se apersono a las oficinas en busca D. un crédito para la compra D. alimento balanceado para aumentar la producción D. leche y la elaboración D. quesillo, D. este modo podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos y poder ahorrar para luego poder costear los estudios D. su hijo.
texts.en:
Raimunda V. is 56 years old. She has been a widow for four years. She lives in Cochabamba with her only child. Raimunda lives in the Maica Central neighborhood on the outskirts of the city. It is an agricultural zone in the Cochabamba department. Raimunda devotes herself to raw milk production and selling cheese in the market in the city of Cochabamba. Since her husband died, she has been in charge of all of the household expenses, the care of the dairy cows, milk production, and making cheese. Her 13 year old son helps her sell the cheese at the local market. Raimunda works everyday, including Sunday. She starts work very early, and she works without rest until the sun goes down. Raimunda knows that this effort is for her son’s well-being. It is so that he can study a career when he finishes school. That way he will later be able to support himself. Raimunda will not be able to support him for a long time due to her advanced age. Raimunda came to the offices looking for a loan. She wants to buy balanced food to increase milk production and making cheese. That way she will be able to increase her sales and her income. She will be able to save in order to be able to pay her son’s educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for the dairy cows

loans.name: Kalil Turdakunova`s Group

texts.ru:
Калил 49 лет. Она замужем, ее супруг крестьянин. у них есть собственный земельный надел, где они выращивают риса, овощей. Кредит запрашивается для закупа семян и удобрений. У нее 7 деетй. Кроме младшей дочери, все взрослые. Большинство проживает отдельно своими семьями. 

Чолпоной,25, замужем. Ее супруг занимается земледелием. У нее трое детей: все трое мальчики. Она занимается торговлей товарами народного потребления. На полученную прибыль они купли корову, теленка и несколько овец. Кредит запрашивается для расширения товарооборота магазина. 

Жылдыз 47 лет. Она мать 5 детей. Ее супруг работает водителем, ежемесячный доход составляет около 110 долларов. Клиент вместе со старшими детьми занимается выращиванием сельхоз продукции. Этим бизнесом она занимается 10 лет. НА полученную прибыль они смогли построить дом. Кредит нужен для закупа семян и удобрений. 

АЙгул 33 года. Она разведенная мать с одной дочерью Дочь учится на 9 классе. Клиент в основном выращивает рис, т.к. земля Узгена очень пригодна именно для этой культуры. Кредит нужен для закупа семян и удобрений. Сезонный доход от земледелия равени около 600 долларов. 

Алтына, 48, замужем. У не 5 детей: две дочери и два сына. Старшие двое детей работают в РФ, остальные дома. клиент вместе с супругом выращивают овощи на своем земельном наделе. Кредит нужен для закупа семян и удобрений. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kalil is 49 years old. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They own a plot of land, where they grow rice and vegetables. They are requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. Kalil has 7 children. All of the children, except the youngest daughter, are grown, and the majority of them live separately with their own families. Cholponoy is 25 years old, married. Her husband is involved in farming. She has three children, all of whom are boys. She is involved in sales of consumer goods. Cholponoy used her business profits to purchase a cow, calf and several sheep. She is requesting the loan in order to expand the goods turnover at the store. Jyldyz is 47 years old. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband works as a driver, and his monthly income is about 110 dollars. The client and her older children are involved in growing agricultural crops. She has been in this business for 10 years. They were able to use business profits to build a house. The loan is need for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. Aygul is 33 years old. She is a divorced mother of one daughter. Her daughter is now in 9th grade. The client primarily grows rice because the soil in Uzgen is especially suitable for this crop. The loan is needed for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. The seasonal income from farming equals to about 600 dollars. Altyna is 48 years old, married. She has 5 children: two daughters and two sons. The oldest two children work in the Russian Federation, and the rest are at home. The client and her husband grow vegetables on their plot of land. The loan is needed for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 28 años , convive con su pareja y tienen una pequeña hija. Juntos residen en la selva ayacuchana, en una pequeña  localidad donde tienen su casa que es propia.Frente a los diferentes obstáculos que se le presentaron  en la vida , decidió empezar en la  producción y comercialización de cacao, y cada día esta mejorando sus ventas. Ella es consciente que debe aumentar su producción , como también la calidad de sus productos, es por esta razón que siempre cuida sus plantaciones. Por lo general trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde , y casi siempre recibe la ayuda de su esposo, pero durante la época de siembra o cosecha contrata la ayuda de  peones para lograr  extraer sus productos de manera eficiente. Su plan a futuro es adquirir mayor cantidad de terrenos, con la finalidad de producir en grandes volúmenes, porque sabe muy bien que el café es un producto bien cotizado a nivel nacional e internacional.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a seguir cumpliendo puntualmente con sus pagos, además dice que se siente satisfecha  porque  su grupo comunal trabaja con responsabilidad.El dinero lo invertirá en brindarle mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café, para ello comprará  abono e insumos con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Edith, age 28, lives with her life partner and their small daughter. They live together in the Ayacuchan jungle in a small place where they have their own house. Facing the different obstacles that present themselves in life, she decided to start producing and selling cacao. Every day she is improving her sales. She is aware that she needs to increase her production and the quality of her products. That is why she always takes care of her crops. She generally works from seven in the morning until six in the evening. She almost always receives help from her husband. But, during planting or harvesting season she hires laborers to help extract her products in an efficient manner. Her plan for the future is to get a greater quantity of fields in order to produce in large volumes. She knows very well that coffee is a product that is sought after on a national and international level. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she pledges to keep making her payments punctually. Also, she says that she feels satisfied because her communal bank works with responsibility. She will use the money to provide adequate maintenance to her coffee crop. She will buy fertilizer and supplies to improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers to take care of her crops

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima tiene 42 años. Su actividad es muy rentable y disfruta mucho de realizarla ya que tiene que dedicarles a sus hijos las oportunidades necesarias con sus estudios. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica al destace de cerdo pues gracias a su Madre que le enseño este rubro mejor notablemente así fue como ella logro independizarse y tener un medio de vida. El financiamiento es para la compra de  materia prima para la compra de cerdos. Sueña con seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is 42. Her job is very profitable and she benefits greatly from it, since she has to offer her children educational opportunities. For more than 8 years she has been a pork butcher, thanks to her mother who taught her this work. Notably, this is how she achieved independence and a better livelihood. The loan is for the purchase of raw materials to buy pigs. She hopes to continue working to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Salifu

texts.en: Salifu H. is into the sale of plastic containers, sauce pans and other things in Abura. She goes from one house to the other in her locality. She is married to a mason and has received senior high education. Salifu uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. Salifu will use this loan to purchase extra shoes, plastics and sauce pans to sell. Salifu plans to reinvest the new profits into her business.

loans.use: To purchase extra shoes, plastics and sauce pans to sell

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El socio Sixto, tiene 25 años, es soltero y pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca”. Las reuniones del banco comunal se hacen en la casa del socio paulino en la comunidad de Rumichaca. Sixto es obrero y su trabajo es eventual. El socio es una persona carismática y responsables y puntual y por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal, el requiere el préstamo para gasto personal como para su alimentación, pasajes, etc.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sixto is 25 years old, single, and belongs to the “New Vision of Rumichaca” cooperative bank. Meetings are held at member Paulino’s home, located in the Rumichaca community. Sixto is a construction worker, and his jobs can be temporary. He is very charismatic, responsible, and punctual, which is why he was invited to join the cooperative bank. He needs a loan for personal expenses, such as food, transportation, etc. This member is very grateful for the opportunities provided via this medium, and likewise commits to payment his installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses such as food, transportation, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Lao Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has sixteen people who live in Krang Thum village in Takeo province. All the members will use portion of their loan for different purposes in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Lao C. is a village bank president who is 1953, selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family moreover she is also a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Loeng Chhe, is a commune consultant who gets low salary to support his family. Now she has some problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Lao C. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she buys pig food. She is a mother of two children whom are attending school and they are helping their parents.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lemomo Ole

texts.en:
Lemomo Ole S. is a 30 year old farmer who supports four members of his family. His spouse is Melina S. who is also a farmer. They do the farming together on their own piece of land. Lemomo has been farming wheat for the last six years. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fertilizer and seeds, and 10,000 KES is to be used on planting his five-acre wheat farm.

He is anticipating buying some farm machinery with the profit from the expanded farming activity.

His hope and dream for his business and family is that he will become a large-scale farmer and be financially stable, so that he can educate his children and build a nice house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and plant his five acre wheat farm

loans.name: Tiessiri 3 Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri 3 est constitué de  huit femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  49 ans, 4 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Madoudiarrabougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, l’arachide, le sésame, le pois de terre et le haricot. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les  deux prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  AFOU D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre  pour entretenir environ 1, 3 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs. 
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri 3 comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
Tiessiri 3 is made up of eight married women. On average they are 49 years old and have four children. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Madoudiarrabougou, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, in the region of Koulikoro, the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance organization, Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their winter agricultural activities. The crops cultivated are peanuts, sesame, earth peas, and green beans. They are on their third farming loan and both of their other previous loans were properly repaid. With this new loan, Afou D. will buy seeds and small tools, and pay the laborer costs of maintaining approximately 1.3 hectares of peanuts. She sells her products after the harvest at the city level in Diolila to a client base essentially composed of commodity dealers. The women of the Tiessiri 3 group expect an average profit of 45.000 FCFA after paying back the farming loan.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for seeds, labor and tools

loans.name: Munhzaya

texts.en:
Munhzaya B. is 36 years old and lives with her two children in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a rented yard. Her oldest son attends a university while her younger daughter attends a local high school. 

Munhzaya supports the entire family by operating a clothes making business. She organizes her business very accurately. She has been operating her business since 2000 at a rented workplace. She owns a sewing machine and designs and sews the clothing according to her own tastes. Her daily average income is around 10,000-18,000 MNT and her monthly average income is approximately 400,000-500,000 MNT. She plans to have her own yard in the near future. She likes to sew clothes and it has become her hobby, as well as her profession. Munhzaya is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a fabrics and materials to make various kind of uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase a fabrics, materials.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena M. is a married woman who lives in Calumpang, Poblacion, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two businesses: a general store and fish vending businesses. Her husband Melbert M., who is 41 years old, manages his own business to earn his living. They have two children who are 10 and 13 years old. Lorena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 21,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to stock more things to sell in her general store. She wants to continue to save up for the future security of her family, for her children's education and family needs. Lorena M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Expanding store inventory

loans.name: Agustina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Agustina De La Concepción tiene 63 años, su actividad económica es bar y comedor. Hace más de 26 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy importante. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos para mejorar su actividad. Ella elabora en su negocio las diferentes comidas que sus clientes le solicitan en su negocio, pues la ubicación es en las peñitas, en donde llegan a disfrutar del ambiente familiar. Agustina solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos básicos, jugos, agua, utensilios de cocina y otras cosas. agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido. Por lo que sus hijos le ayudan en la atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Agustina De La Concepción, 63, has had a restaurant for over 26 years; it has been very important.

She has had previous loans to improve her business.

She prepares a variety of dishes that her customers request.  Her business is located in Las Peñitas, a place where people come to enjoy a family oriented ambience.

Agustina is asking for funds to buy basic grains, juices, water, kitchen utensils and other items.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted through this means and at the same time commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Her children help her tend to customers.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Leifa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mejía está localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo, su  gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos, se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Leifa,  ella tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, ninguno de sus hijos vive con ella, en la actualidad esta criando a un nieto de 5 años que es como si fuera su hijo menor. Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura.

Es una ama de casa que para ayudar en los gastos del hogar ha tenido que dedicarse a la cría  de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja, cada dos meses compra los pollos, cuando están pequeños los tiene por dos o tres meses y una vez que tengan un peso adecuado los vende ya sea en pie  o por libras, entrega a comerciantes  y también vende por su casa a vecinos del lugar, compra los pollos en una incubadora en Portoviejo.
