Este crédito es para comprar mas pollos ya que se viene la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo y en estos días se vende bastante y a buen precio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 años y le gusta porque la institución siempre cumple con las socias.

Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Mejía is located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo. The people there mostly work in agriculture and selling coconuts. The Mejía communal bank meets every 15 days.

Leifa is 47 years old. She is married and has 4 children, all grown. None of her children live with her, though she is currently raising a 5 year-old grandson as if her were her youngest child. Her husband works in agriculture. 

She is a housewife who, in order to help with the household expenses, has had to raise chickens. She has a small farm. Every two months she buys the baby chickens. She keeps them for two or three months, and once they are right size she sells them, either alive or by the pound. She sells them to vendors and she also sells them from her house to neighbors. She buys the baby chicks in an incubator in Portoviejo. 

This loan is to buy more baby chickens, since the Christmas and New Year’s season is coming up, and this is when she sells a lot, and at a good price. She has been in the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because the institution always comes through for the members.

Her dream is to have to larger business.

loans.use: To buy baby chickens.

loans.name: Awah Peter

texts.en: Awah F. Peter was born in 1956. He is married to Anna Manjui Felicitas and they are blessed with three children all below the age of 15 years old. He lives in a small house of three rooms with his family in the Bali Parka quarter of Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. F. Peter has faced some challenges in life, amongst which are the inability to meet the basic needs of his family like clothing, feeding, transportation and educating himself and his children. He has faced difficulties in raising capital to start up a small business that will sustain him and his family. He plans to invest this loan in a gardening business and will be buying seedlings and farm products. He believes the business will succeed because the previous loan he took was repaid by the income raised from an old farm of his so, therefore,he concludes that he is sure the business will succeed. He is certain that this business will succeed because the products he produces are highly demanded in the market. The loan will help his community because they will be able to afford all food ingredients at low or no cost. F. Peter will plough back his profit into his business and use part to care for his family. He also will use the proceeds to pay his children’s school fees and cater to the family. He prefers GHAPE because of the training he frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets and feed

loans.name: Josue Adan

texts.es: EL Sr Josué, Vive en casa en alquiler junto con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar el es dueño de un microbús y de un derecho de línea, el esta trabajando con esmero para poder darles una casa propia a su familia ya que el dice que son la razón de su existir. El dinero que solicita es para pagar la mano de obra de la  Chapería de su micro para poderlo trabajar tranquilamente, es una persona trabajadora, tranquilo, responsable y dedicado a su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Josué lives in a rental property with his wife and two school age children. He owns a minibus and the rights to a travel route. Josué has been working carefully to provide a home for his family, who are the reason for his existence.

The money he is requesting will be used to pay for body work to his minibus so that it can operate quietly. Josué is a hardworking, peaceful, and responsible person who is dedicated to his family. He is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Pay for body work to his minibus

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards and add more cash to his business

loans.name: Lucia Ramona

texts.es: Lucia Ramona tiene 71 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este medio de vida con pocos productos la mayoría de sus clientes que son personas que viven cerca siempre llegan a buscar lo que ella ofrece es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora demuestra que puede salir adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes, pan, grano básicos y gaseosas pues se acerca una buena temporada navideña y quiere comprar suficiente productos.
texts.en: Lucia Ramona is 71 years old.  She has been selling general merchandise for more than 12 years.  She began this way of life with few products.  The majority of her clients live nearby; they always come to see what she is selling.  She is very enterprising with a fighting spirit and demonstrates that she knows how to thrive.  The loan is for buying candy, soft drinks, detergents, breads, grains and soda so that she will have sufficient merchandise on hand for the lucrative holiday season.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna M. and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Khiev, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1993 and have three children – one son and two daughters. 

Mrs. Vanna M. is a flowers farmer.  She grows jasmine flowers and also buys other flowers from fellow villagers to resell in Phnom Penh market.   Her husband has been a construction worker for eighteen years, working in the village.

Vanna had previously asked for a Kiva loan to purchase jasmine flowers on contract. She needed to pay money to the farmers before the harvest season. Unfortunately, her mother died and she had to use a part of her loan for the funeral.

She now wants to expand her business by purchasing fruits (longans and bananas) for resale. Hence she is asking for another loan of $1,200 for this  purpose.

loans.use: To purchase fruits (longan and banana) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Cecilia del Carmen G. M. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa Ministerio de Salud desempeñándose como Inspectora control de Vectores tiene  Veinte y dos  años  de trabajar para esta institución, es acompañada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Cecilia del Carmen Garcia M. is an active employee of the Ministry of Health, and she works as a vector control inspector. she has twenty-two years working for this organization. She is married and she has a school-aged son. She has had four past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and she used each one to purchase construction materials, including sand, cement, rocks, gravel, construction blocks, etc., in order to expand and improve their home. The loans granted through Ceprodel have been a great help and she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is a married lady. Her husband is an electrician, and they have six children aged between 24 years old and 2 years old. 

She runs a food cafe and sells such snacks as chips, sausage, samosas, eggs and chicken to the local people. Her business is located in a residential area known as Huruma in Nairobi. She has been in this business for 15 years now and has managed to provide employment to four people. 

She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is power outages. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to open another food cafe in an area called Chokaa.

 In the future, she hopes to venture into the real estate business. She describes herself as hard-working, determined, generous and God-fearing.

loans.use: Open a food cafe

loans.name: Mathemo

texts.en:
Mathemo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past nine years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mathemo faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit and the seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina L. M. lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture. She has been living in the area of Shanti Nagar for the past 10 years in a two-room brick house with her family. She is married to L. M. who is involved in the animal food selling business. He supplies animal food to his customers and earns income for the family. They have four sons who are unable to attend school due to financial constraints. 

Samina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal food in bulk quantity to fulfill his customers' demand and earn extra profits. He has been in this business for the past five years and Samina is very confident that an investment will earn increased profits and she will be able to send her children to school. She is a regular loan user of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit by paying her installments on time and attending all recovery meetings.

loans.use: To purchase animal food to sell

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Lorenzo Renteria le está haciendo falta el techo en el cuarto que esta construyendo en la parte alta de su vivienda. 
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para comprar el material que necesita para poder terminar la recamara que será para sus hijos. Planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de soldador. 
Espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito, ya que con el anterior pudo colocar las paredes a cuarto.
texts.en:
The room being built on the second floor of Mr. Lorenzo Renteria's house is in need of a roof.  He is requesting a new loan to buy roofing material to be able to finish the bedroom for his children.  He plans to pay it back with the income he receives from his welding job.

He hopes you can help him with this loan since he used the previous one to build the walls of the room.

loans.use: To buy roofing material

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea, de 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Wilder de 38 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Al restaurante de Andrea lo que menos le faltan son clientes, puesto que esta ubicado en una zona céntrica de su barrio. Sus principales comensales son sus vecinos, quienes luego de una larga mañana de trabajo, no dudan en degustar los deliciosos platos que ella prepara. Los precios que ofrece a sus clientes son muy accesibles y este es el principal gancho de su restaurante, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y ver como las personas alaban su buena sazón, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes y mantenerlos satisfechos, espera que en el futuro su restaurante se convierta en uno de los más conocidos del distrito de ventanilla, sabe que para alcanzar sus metas tiene que trabajar muy duro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más sillas y mesas para mejorar la atención en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Andrea is 46 years old and is a kind and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband Wilder, who is 38 years old, and their three children, who they want to give a better quality of life.  

At Andrea's restaurant there is no shortage of customers, since it is located in a central area in her neighborhood.  Its main diners are her neighbors, who enjoy the delicious dishes she prepares after a long morning of work.  The prices she charges are very accessible, and this is the main draw of her restaurant.  The thing she likes best about her work is cooking and seeing how people praise the good flavors.  She has had the restaurant for one year.  She considers taking care of all the customers and keeping them satisfied the most difficult part.  She hopes that in the future, her restaurant will be one of the most well-known in the Ventanilla district.  She knows that to achieve her goals, she has to work very hard and she is ready to do so.  

This is her fourth loan with MFP and just like with the others, she is ready to make all of her payments on time.  In her community bank, she is a well liked and respected member because of the responsibility she shows.  With the 2000 neuvos soles she is requesting, she will purchase more seats and tables to improve the attention at her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lorenzo Romulo

texts.es: Lorenzo es un padre de familia de 54 años que vive junto a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura, desde hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Lorenzo desea terminar de construir su vivienda, para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a un crédito con cual comprara hierro, guantes, cables, varias, hierro entre otros. El es una persona que brinda todo su esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, de modo que pueda sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en: Lorenzo is a 54-year-old father who lives with his wife and three children.  He has worked providing welding services for more than 20 years.  Lorenzo wants to finish building his house and in order to do so, it is necessary for him to request a loan to buy iron, gloves, cables, and other various items.  He is a person who puts all of his effort into his work so that he can get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy iron, gloves, cables, and other various items.

loans.name: Milagros Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Milagros es socia del banco comunal El Arenal del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali.  Tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una niña.
Lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y tiene que realizar trabajos fuertes muchas veces porque necesita el dinero para poder criar a su hija y también pagar las cuotas de su préstamo que tiene con Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 vaquitas reproductoras.
Tiene que ir reemplazando las vacas para poder seguir aprovechando la leche que producen, para poder vender y mantener a los demás animales que tiene.
Gracias a su negocio puede mantener a su niña y no hacerle pasar necesidades.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos otorgados.
texts.en:
Sra. Milagros is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal” which is in the District of Calleria, Deparatment of Ucayali. She is 25 years old and a single mother with one daughter.

Milagros has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for two years. She has had to work hard on many occasions because she needed the money to support her daughter and repay her loans from Manuela Ramos.

With her new loan of 1200 PEN, she will buy two cows that are of reproductive age. She wants to introduce new cows so that she can take advantage of their milk production. Milagros will sell the milk and maintain the cows she already has.

Thanks to her business, she is able to support her daughter and provide for all of her needs. Milagros is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing her with these loans.

loans.use: to purchase two milk-producing cows.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena  es socia del Banco Comunal “Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  María Elena estudió la secundaria.
La señora se dedica a la compra y  venta de animales  caseros, hace tres ciclos trabaja  con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su primer préstamo  fue   S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará dos vacas para su respectivo engorde (por dos meses), también trabaja con la chacra.
En el negocio la ayuda su esposo quien es músico y viaja a diferentes lugares de la ciudad con su arte.
Su sueño es mejorar el ganado y así obtener más ganancias.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
María Elena is a member of the “Trenzas de Oro” (Golden Braids) communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province and Puno Department.  She is 24 years old, has a spouse and a son.  María Elena went to secondary school.

She buys and sells domestic animals.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her business.

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy two cows to fatten up (for two months).  She also farms.  Her husband, who is also a musician who travels to various places with his art, helps her with the business.  Her dream is to improve her cattle to obtain more profits.

What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings and the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil comes from the Samtredia District of the Imereti Region. This district is known in the country for high quality maize and nuts. Avtandil is 41 years old. He lives with his wife Fatima, two daughters aged 24 and 18, and his mother. His younger daughter goes to school and plans to enter a high school this year. His older daughter works as a cashier in a local credit institution. Avtandil's mother is retired. 

Avtandil and his mother are intensively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they run a small dairy farm with four cows and calves. Fatima produces and sells 70-80 kg of cheese on local open market. Also the family has two hectares of land where five tons of maize are grown. It is used for feeding the livestock. Also they have 800 nut trees and sell one ton of nuts to the local wholesalers. 

Avtandil will use 60% of the loan to purchase fuel to till the land with a tractor and the remaining 40% will be used for purchasing fertilizers. 

After fertilizing he will get eight tons of maize; five tons will be used on the farm and three will be sold at the local market.

The increase in income will be used to pay for the education of Avtandil's younger daughter–Avtandil and Fatima want to send her to a high school in Germany, which will give her a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel for a tractor (for tilling the land)

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 40 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area; she is single with three children 13 to 22 and has a fiancee, they both  have been together for the past ten years and they are planing to get married very soon. All  of her children live at home and attend school. For the past 15 years, Mama has been involved in the sale of red oil. Her main challenges are the rise in prices and the low quantity of oil  on the market during the rainy season. She started this business with the help of her fiancee who gave her money to sell and she learned this from her mother.  

Mama says what she likes about this business is that during the dry season she gets more money and what makes her proud is that the business enables her to send her children to school. She has requested this loan to purchase more oil. Mama hopes in future to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, vive con sus tres hijas de 10, 8 y 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, aprendió este oficio hace 12 años con sus padres, trabaja con mas personas en la elaboración de hamacas, también sus hijas mayores le colaboran en ocasiones, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilo para elaborar hamacas, esta inversión le permitirá continuar en la confección de las hamacas, cubriendo la demanda de una mejor manera y generando mejores ingresos.
Los sueños de don Santos es que sus hijas crezcan, aprendan el oficio y puedan estudiar, ya que así podrán defenderse en el futuro.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his three daughters who are 10, 8 and 4 years of age.  He makes hammocks.  He learned this occupation 12 years ago with his parents.  He works with other people making hammocks.  His older daughters sometimes help out too.  His work schedule is 8am to 4pm.

He is asking for a loan to buy string to make hammocks.  This investment will allow him to continue making hammocks better meeting demand and generating better income.

Santos’ dreams are that his daughters grow up, that they learn an occupation and be able to go to school so that they will be able to fend for themselves in the future.

loans.use: to buy string to weave hammocks.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 22 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market. The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Lowrenmie

texts.en:
Lowrenmie is 27 years old. She is married with one small child. She works for a living in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been a "hypo" retailer for three years. "Hypo" is a liquid substance used in laundry to get rid of dirt/stains and is a very good stain remover. Retailing this substance gives Lowrenmie a monthly income of 1,000 PHP.
Earlier this year, Lowrenmie joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to have easy access to financial services. This is her first loan application for a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. The money is intended to acquire enough supply of "hypo" to sell. She hopes that increasing demand for the product will give her a high return on her investment.

loans.use: to acquire enough supply of "hypo" (a stain remover) to sell.

loans.name: Bocar Salamata Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 juin 2008. Il est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama, est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 33ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle détient un petit restaurant où elle vend du petit déjeuner, déjeuner et diner. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was founded on June 12, 2008. The group consists of fifteen women who all live in the same district. They are mainly involved in small business activities.

The leader of the group is Madame Mariama, who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised. She is 33 years old. She is married and has one child. She also looks after two other children entrusted to her care by relatives.

She runs a small restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has been working in this field for many years and has a good deal of experience in this sector. 

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and expand her business.

The profits will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Nelcy

texts.es: Nelcy de 32 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en la ciudad de Cartagena, e inició su negocio de venta de mercancías variadas como ropa, calzado, cosméticos, y gradualmente con sus ingresos que se fueron incrementándose, agregó la oferta de servicios de alquiler de lavadoras;  La iniciativa de emprender su aventura empresarial la tuvo pues necesitaba apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, pero con su éxito ahora su negocio es su proyecto de vida. La mayor parte de sus mercancías las vende a crédito y por eso sus cuentas por cobrar son altas y es un gran desafío responderle a sus clientes oportunamente, pues debe reunir el dinero que recupera para hacerlo. Su razón por la cual acude a su credikiva es para financiar su cartera y lograr incrementar sus clientes y oxigenar su negocio, así mismo aumentar la oferta de servicios de alquiler de lavadora, pues en la actualidad se queda corta su respuesta a su creciente clientela. Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará 1 lavadora y mercancía variada, que planea vender a propósito del mes del amor y amistad, periodo en el que tradicionalmente hay un gran incremento en  sus ventas y Nelcy no piensa dejar de aprovechar esta coyuntura. Más adelante sus planes de crecimiento se centran en agregar otros negocios, como el de telecomunicaciones e internet, para generar crecimiento por nuevas fuentes de trabajo que incrementen sus ingresos y respondan a un mayor bienestar para su hogar.
texts.en:
Nelcy is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the city of Cartagena. She started her business by selling various types of merchandise such as clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. As her income gradually increased, she began renting out washing machines. This venture was started because she needed to contribute to the household expenses. Now that her business is successful, it has become her project for life. Most of her sales are made on credit, so her rate of billing collections is high. Her greatest challenge is getting her customers to respond in a timely manner because she needs to collect the money in order to recoup her investment.

Her reason for applying for a Kiva loan is so that she can finance her bills, increase her customer base, and pump new life into her business. Nelcy also wants to expand her washing machine rental service because she cannot respond quickly enough to her growing clientele. This is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use the money to buy one washing machine and a variety of merchandise in time to sell during the month of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day). This period is when she traditionally sees a large spike in her sales and Nelcy does not plan to forego this opportunity. Going forward she plans to grow by adding other businesses, such as telecommunications or an Internet café, so that she can create new sources of work to increase her income and provide for the greater well-being of her household.

loans.use: to acquire an additional washing machine for rental and to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асатулло честный, целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 12 лет. Он выбрал данный бизнес для того, чтобы обеспечить свою жену и четверо детей и содержать их в хороших условиях жизни. Он выращивает картошку и морковь для продажи, а также часть урожая использует на нужды своего дома, который позволяет ему, уменьшит расходы на покупки овощей. Кроме этого он занимается откормом скота, и он содержит их за счет кормом произведенных самим. Асатулло хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить большой прибыль. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки коров и овца. Прибыль, который он планирует от данного бизнеса, он хочет использовать на стройки своего дома. Он заранее благодарен всем  кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Asatullo is an honest, goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 12 years.  He chose this business in order to support his wife and four children and provide a good quality of life for them.  He grows potatoes and carrots for sale and also uses part of his harvest for his household needs, which allows him to reduce expenses of purchasing vegetables.  Besides this business, Asatullo is involved in fattening up livestock and keeps the livestock with the feed that he grows himself.  Asatullo wants to expand his business and make a large profit.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of cows and sheep.  He plans to use the profit from this business to build his house.  He thanks everyone who supports him in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 43 years old and married. She has four children.

Annie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish and fattening pigs. 

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Annie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Annie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married and blessed with one child who is still in school.  For the last three years, she has been selling clothes and giving small loans to earn a living. Previously, she was doing farming. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a boutique. 

Juliana is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shilling to buy clothes to sell. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plants to grow and sell.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery, de 23 años es una hija ejemplar. Vive en compañía de su mamá Rosalía, su papá Urbano y sus 3 menores hermanos, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Chamisería. Desde joven apoyó a su familia en los gastos del hogar, pues ella su deseo siempre fue: la tranquilidad de su familia. Quien se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de papa, habas y olluco. Los cuales cuidad con dedicación, ya que sabe que es la única fuente de ingreso que tienen. Pero como es una joven ingeniosa; comenzó con la crianza de animales menores como ovejas y vacas. Cuenta que, con la leche que le brinda su ganado, realiza queso, los que vende a un precio cómodo. Asimismo las ovejas que posee, los enseba y luego los comercializa en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde viaja constantemente. Ahora ella desea incrementar sus animales, ya que aprovechará la demanda que tiene en el mercado. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “santa clara de Asís” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Rosmery, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 20 cabezas de oveja para su negocio.
texts.en: 23-year-old Rosmery is an exemplary daughter. She lives together with her mom Rosalía, her dad Urbano, and her three younger siblings, who she cares for in their own home which is located in the small village of Chamisería. Rosmery has been supporting her family with their household expenses since she was a young girl. Her wish has always been for her family to be content. Rosmery works in farming, growing potatoes, beans and olluco (a native tuber). She cares for her crops with commitment as she knows that this is the only source of income that she has. However, as she is an ingenious young woman, she also started raising animals such as sheep and cows. She tells us that she uses the milk that her herd provide to make cheese which she sells at an affordable price. She also fattens her sheep and then sells them in the city of Huancayo which she travels to all the time. Now Rosmery would like to increase her number of animals as she will take advantage of market demand. Rosmery belongs to the 'Santa Clara de Asis' community bank and this is her fifth loan from MFP. She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue reaching her goals. For her part, she pledges once again to make her loan repayments on time. She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. With your support, Rosmery will invest the money she has requested in buying 20 sheep for her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Norla

texts.es: Norla, de 43 años de edad, habita en Telica, municipio de León, es madre de  5 hijos, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y vender tortillas, lleva 4 años con este negocio. Empezó con la comprar de un cerdo después fue comprando otros dos para aumentar la producción, también se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas es con estas actividades que ella y sus hijos sobreviven día a día. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cerdos, con el objetivo de criar y reproducir cerdos de calidad y buen peso. Ya que ella quiere criar cerdos de raza para reproducir y vender cerdos de raza.
texts.en: Norla, 43 years old, lives in Telica, in Leon county, and is the mother of five children. She is a businesswoman; she raises pigs and sells tortillas, and she has been in this business for four years. She began with the purchase of one pig, and then she purchased two more to increase production. Her business also includes making and selling tortillas. It is through these activities that she and her children survive from day to day. She needs this loan to purchase pigs, with the goal of raising and breeding quality pigs that reach a good weight, since she wants to raise, breed, and sell purebred pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gloria Luz;  La socia tiene 24 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa para damas, la socia viaja a las diferentes ciudades a las fabricas a traer todo tipo de ropa para damas, la socia compra pantalones, casacas, polos, chompas para damas, ella viaja a la ciudad de Lima cada dos meses o como le haya ido sus ventas, la socia vende en la ciudad de Cusco y Quillabamba. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor para vender.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: The member belongs to the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” communal bank, located in the Arin district, Calca province, Cusco department.  Glora Luz is  24 years old and lives with her partner.  She buys and sells women’s clothing.  She travels to the factories in various cities and brings back all types of women’s clothing.  She buys women’s pants, frock coats, and sweaters.  She travels to Lima every two months or depending on how sales have gone.  She sells her merchandise in Cusco and Quillabamba.  She is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale clothing for resale.  Gloria Luz is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments in accordance with the re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing for resale.  .

loans.name: Fanny Nancy

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Fanny, tiene 47 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Lleva  4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a pesar de que no tiene el respaldo de un esposo.

Ella ha tenido que luchar muy duro para salir adelante sola con sus dos hijos, ya que ella fue padre y madre a la vez, le ha tocado trabajar realizando quehaceres domésticos en una casa en Manta, pero también con unos pocos recursos que tenía hace varios años empezó un negocio de venta de ropa, el mismo que lo hacía puerta a puerta, luego su hijo empezó a ayudarle con sus ventas y ahora  tiene un local en Manta en el cual junto a su hijo venden ropa de todo tipo. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio local ya que el que tienen  es arrendado.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. The area is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year-round by national and international tourists, and the majority of the local inhabitants either fish or make their living from the sea.

Here we meet Fanny, who is 47 years old, a single mother with two grown children, one of which still lives with her. She has already received four loans through the Communal Bank, and she is happy for the help which it has given her despite the fact that she does not have the backing of a husband.

She has had to struggle very hard to get ahead by herself with her two children, especially since she was both mother and father for them. She has worked doing domestic housework in a house in Manta, but with the few resources she had several years ago, she started a business selling clothes, which she does door-to-door. Later, her son began to help her with her sales, and now she has a shop in Manta, where, together with her son, she sells all kinds of clothing.

She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing.

Her dream is to have her own store, since she leases the one she has now.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia nació en la ciudad de Calca y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 55 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan. Ya son 30 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Delia es madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a sus hijos. Delia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, harina, manteca y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Delia es construir  su casa.   

Delia es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Delia was born in the city of Calca and lives in the same city where she was born.  She is 55 years old and is married; she has three children from this marriage.  She combines her household activities with her small business, where she works baking and selling bread.  She has been working in this business for 30 years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the efforts that she puts into her work.

Delia is a hard-working and enterprising mother who is moving her children ahead in life.  On this occasion, Delia is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients such as sugar, flour, butter and other additional things.  Delia's dream is to build a home.

Delia is a member of the “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” group, which is made of up 15 members who live in the city of Calca which is in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco, in Peru.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, for example sugar, flour, butter, and other additional things.

loans.name: Cruz Elena

texts.es: La señora Cruz Elena tiene 50 años, de los cuales lleva 8 años dedicada al servicio de la confección a terceros. Con su esposo, han luchado para darle a sus 3 hijos todo lo que necesitan y poderles ofrecer la mejor educación posible. Cruz Elena sueña con brindarle a sus hijos una estabilidad económica en un futuro, y busca lograrlo a través del crecimiento de su empresa y consolidarla como un gran taller de confección; es por esto que necesita la compra de insumos para su negocio de modo que pueda realizar mas trabajos de confección a terceros y así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de sus hijos como de su esposo.
texts.en:
Cruz Elena is 50 years old and has spent 8 of them making clothes for third parties.  With her husband they’ve struggled to provide their three children everything they need and to be able to offer them the best possible education.

Cruz Elena dreams with providing her children with economic stability in the future and seeks to attain it through the growth of her firm consolidating it into a large clothing manufacturing workshop.  Because of this, she needs to buy supplies for the business so that she can make more clothes for third parties and thus increase her income and improve the quality of life of her children and her husband.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her workshop.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 27 años, es un joven alegre y trabajador; viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Manitea Alta. Él es un hombre trabajador, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y hasta el momento ha cultivado café, que con mucho esfuerzo consiguió tornarlas muy productivas. Tiene más de 15 años trabajando es ésta actividad, lo cual lo ha convertido en un gran conocedor en el mundo del agro. En tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza contrata peones quienes se encargan de acelerar con las faenas más pesadas; sus plantas le generan buenos ingresos, por lo cual las empresas acopiadoras de cuyos productos le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras ya que no cuenta con espacios para seguir sembrando. Este es el crédito número 05 con MFP, se compromete en seguir aportando sus cuotas puntualmente como en los anteriores créditos, agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por elegirle como presidente de la junta directiva. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de cacao en edad de crecimiento por que desea cultivarlos de manera tecnificada.
texts.en: Edwin, 27, is a happy and hardworking youth who lives in his own house in the community of Manitea Alta.  He is a hardworking man who puts a lot of care into the work that he does.  He is a farmer who works the land, and up until now he has cultivated coffee.  He puts in a lot of effort in order to make his lands very productive.  He has been farming for more than 15 years, and has become very knowledgeable about the world of agriculture.  At harvest time and when he needs to weed his crops, he hires workers who help him get the most difficult tasks done more quickly.  His crops generate good earnings for him, as the wholesale companies who buy his products pay him well for each kilogram.  The main problem with his work is that he cannot fight off the insects that damage the fruits of his plants.  But now, his main priority is to buy new lands, because he does not have enough space for further planting. This is his 5th loan with MFP, and he is committed to continuing to make his payments on time, as he has done with the previous loans.  He thanks the members of his communal bank for electing him as president of the board.  With the 1,500 Peruvian soles he requests, he will buy cocoa seedlings that are ready to grow, because he wants to cultivate them in a way that makes use of modern technology.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Doña Sonia es casada, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijas, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería, ella es una persona muy amable, servicial y alegre, y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Hace algunos años comenzó vendiendo golosinas pero hace tres años inicio el negocio de la pulpería vendiendo productos como ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, frijoles y otros productos de uso domestico, luego fue surtiendo su negocio con otros productos que los mismos clientes le recomendaban vender. 
Inicio a trabajar por cuenta propia y en el transcurso del tiempo aprendió a manejar su negocio, su horario de atención inicia a partir de las 5:30 a.m y culmina a las 9:00 p.m. Sonia solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, sal, frijoles, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su negocio y seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para poder apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es poner una bodega en la Ciudad de Juticalpa. Doña Sonia tiene 5 ciclos de recibir el apoyo de FAMA mediante los préstamos obtenidos y ha mantenido un  buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Sonia is married, 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband makes a living in livestock farming. She is a kind, helpful, and cheerful person. She has a small grocery store in her home. Several years ago, she began selling candy but three years ago she started the grocery store business, selling products such as sugar, rice, lard, beans and other domestic use products. Then she began stocking her business with other products that her customers recommended she sell.

She began working a self-employed businesswoman and in time she learned to manage her business, with her working hours from 5:30am to 9:00pm. Sonia is requesting this loan in order to invest in buying products such as rice, sugar, lard, salt, and beans among others. 

With the help of this loan, she will be able to stock her business and continue to have a source of income to help her husband with family expenses.Her goal is to have a small grocery store in the city of Juticalpa. Sonia is in her fifth loan cycle of receiving support from FAMA through the loans she has obtained. She has maintained a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, lard, soap and other items

loans.name: Voern's Group

texts.en:
Voern, 51, is married living with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has six children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last 11 years, Voern and her husband have been farming as main source of family’s income to make a living. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about 52,000KHR per day from the current business. 
Voern’s group consists of three members and she is the seventh cycled client. The past loans which she successfully repaid have helped her support her family with sufficient foods. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Voern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better and keep her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mahulome6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHULOME 6 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Hélène (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Hélène est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Nassirou. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et aucun a leur charge. Hélène vit seule avec  ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Hélène vend du mais, du riz, du mil et du liqueurs depuis quinze ans. Hélène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Hélène ensemble avec les membres de son groupe MAHULOME 6 sollicite pour la septième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du riz, du mil et des liqueurs.

loans.name: Hale

texts.en:
Hale is married and has one child.  After she got married she started making sausages at home with her husband as a side business and selling them to their neighbours.  As the reputation of the sausages increased the requests increased and she had to buy bulks of ingredients but she had no capital for it so she used loans from Maya.  With the help of the four loans from Maya she bought bulks of meat and spices thus she increased her productions and her sales and developed her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hale Hanım evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Evlendikten sonra eşiyle birlikte ek iş olarak evde sucuk yapıp yakın çevresine satmaya başladı.  Sucuk yapıp sattığını bütün çevresine duyurdu.  Talepler artınca toptan sucuk malzemesi alması gerekti fakat sermayesi kısıtlıydı.  Sermayesini artırmak ve toptan sucuk malzemesi almak için Maya mikro kredi kullandı. Kullandığı dört krediyle de kıyma ve baharat aldı, böylece üretimini ve satışlarını artırdı, işini geliştirdi.

loans.use: to buy sausage ingredients

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio Canche Hernandez, a married man and father of three children, lives in Progreso, Yucatan. For many years he worked with a carpenter where he learned the trade. Six years ago he went thorugh a difficult economic crisis and the salary that he earned was hardly enough to cover the household costs. It was then that he decided to start his own business, one that he felt he could manage given all the experience he earned throughout the years. With the help of loans he has been able to keep up the business. Eugenio\'s perseverence and personal strength made it possible for them to overcome the difficult financial situation and more so, he has been able to give his family a better quality of life.

Eugenio realizes that he needs a large order of wood to increase his sales, and to cover the costs of this he needs a loan of $650, a loan that will be repaid within 6 months. Please make Eugenio\'s project possible; he and his family need the support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Eugenio Canché H., es casado, padre de 3 hijos y vive en la localidad de Progreso, Yucatán. Durante muchos años trabajo en una carpintería donde aprendió el oficio, hace seis años enfrentó una difícil crisis económica, pues con el salario que recibía difícilmente le alcanzaba cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar. Por todo ello decidió independizarse, pues con toda su experiencia ya había aprendido muy bien el oficio. Con la ayuda de préstamos y la colaboración activa ha logrado mantener su propio negocio. La entereza y fortaleza de Eugenio hicieron posible que enfrentara aquella difícil situación y que actualmente pueda brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Eugenio ha realizado el pedido de un flete de madera para incrementar sus ventas, para poder cubrir éste gasto él requiere de un préstamo de $650.00 dólares, mismo que cubrirá en un plazo de 6 meses. Haz posible la continuación del proyecto de Eugenio, él y su familia te necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani lives in the Kigogo area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. She runs a food vending business near her residence.

Shani thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. With the loan she was able to buy some hygienic food supply materials, cleaning materials and food packaging materials. She is now requesting a second loan with Kiva. With this loan she plans to add a stock of some food items like rice, beans and maize flour. She also needs to add chairs and tables to accommodate more customers, especially during peak hours. She needs USD 550 to implement her plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has a business selling clothes to people in their homes. She travels door-to-door offering her products to acquaintances and friends. She is in need of investment capital so she may purchase more products at wholesale prices. The effect on her business will be immediate, as she will be able to dramatically increase her profits and gain popularity in the sector. She is 43 years old and has three children. They live in a home made out of wood, which she hopes to improve with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to increase her product line

loans.name: Catalina Amparo

texts.en:
Catalina is a 41 year old, single mother of two. She has two sons: one has just started his college career at La Universidad Andina and the younger is attending high school at La Escuela Militar. A few years ago, Catalina was married and had a business with her husband. The business failed and they went bankrupt. Catalina’s husband left her and her two sons for a younger woman. Before coming to PRISMA, she would have described herself as depressed and anxious. She is now much more relaxed and happy. She currently has three jobs and is also attending school.

She has been working with Unique, a cosmetics and jewelry mail order company, for seven years now. Unique incentivizes sales by offering gifts for every goal the seller achieves. Catalina is such a good saleswoman that she is now receiving doubles of gifts. She largely purchases according to her orders, but will occasionally buy in bulk when there are special offers. She averages around 400 orders a month. Catalina has also been working with Herbalife selling protein shakes and other products. She has been with them for four months now and prefers their incentives which are often cash bonuses. She has also been working part-time at a local NGO as a secretary. Catalina hopes that with the $650 loan she will be able to purchase more goods at a lower cost and be able to sell in much larger quantities. By dealing in bulk Catalina has a chance to reach up to 75% commission as opposed to the current 25%.

loans.use: Purchase products in larger quantities to receive greater commission.

loans.name: Quiteria Luciano

texts.pt:
Quiteria just joined the credit program. This is her first loan, that is why the amount is small. She is a single mother of 5 children. She works selling clothes to support her children who are all in school. She has been in this business for a long time, but she wants to increase her inventory and try to increase her income.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Quiteria acaba de entrar para o programa de credito. esteb sera o primeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar. Por isso o valor ainda e relativamente baixo. Ela e mae solteira e tem 5 filhos. Ela se dedica a venda de artigos de vestuario., para poder sustentar os seus filhos pois que todos estao em idade escolar. Seu marido lhe abandonou faz tempo. Por isso ela e chefe do agregado familiar.Ela ja se dedicava a este negocio deste ha muito. Mas agora ela quer reforcalo. Dai o ter recorrido ao emprestimo.

loans.use: Quiteria needs this loan to increase her inventory and keep up with demand from her customers

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena likes to make progress based on her own effort. As evidence of this, she has been selling shoes by catalog for two years. Little by little and thanks to her good interpersonal skills, she has won the preference of her clients. In addition, the income she receives alleviate the financial burden on her husband, as María helps with the household expenses.

Nontheless, María wants to keep growing and, for that reason, she is requesting a $200 loan, that she is committed to repay in three months. With this amount, María will be able to buy more winter season shoes and offer them to her clients, who are often on the outlook for presents for their relatives. The picture portrays María next to boxes of the shoes she sells and a catalog of the shoes she offers. With your help María’s business will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante por su propio esfuerzo, y muestra de ello es el trabajo que está realizando actualmente, venta de zapatos por catálogo, que empezó hace 2 años. Poco a poco y con la habilidad que tiene para tratar a las personas, los clientes la prefieren a ella. Y aunado a esto, las ganancias que recibe han hecho que los gastos que tiene su esposo constantemente se sientan menos, puesto que María ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Sin embargo María desea seguir creciendo y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200, que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 3 meses. Con este dinero María podrá comprar más zapatos de temporada de invierno, para poder tener qué ofrecerles a sus clientas, que en muchas ocasiones andan buscando qué regalarle a sus familiares. En la foto de la historia sale María al lado de unas cajas de zapatos, que son los que vende, y un catálogo mostrando una foto de zapatos que ofrece. Con tu ayuda María podrá salir adelante con este negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Bebun P

texts.id:
Bebun J. is a Recycler. His activities includes looking around daily to find used items. Using his modified motorcycle, with a box at the back for carrying used items, Bebun goes to areas where he felt there were many used items in shopping & housing areas. Bebun also has his own customers, so that at certain locations, he could pick up the already saved items, and he only needs to do the transactions with his clients. Income obtained by Bebun from Recycling is used to pay for rent, capital and daily living expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Bebun J. adalah seorang pemulung. Aktifitasnya adalah berkeliling setiaphari untuk mencari barang-barang bekas. Dengan menggunakan sepeda motornya yang dibuatkan kotak dibagian belakang motornya sebagai tempat barang bekas, Bebun menyusuri daerah-daerah yang menurutnya banyak terdapat barang bekas yaitu dilokasi pertokoan dan juga perumahan. Bebun juga sudah mempunyai langganan sendiri sehingga ditempat-tempat tertentu dia tinggal mengambil barang yang sudah terkumpul dan dia tinggal melakukan transaksi dengan langganannya. Hasil yang Bebun peroleh dari mengumpulkan barang bekas digunakannya untuk membayar kontrakan, modal usaha dan biaya hidup setiapharinya.

loans.use:
For Capital to buy used items

Untuk modal membeli barang-barang bekas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona sells fresh meat and operates a small cafeteria in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. Ramona is forty-two years old and she has two daughters, ages sixteen and twenty years old. The girls attend school. Ramona is recently separated from her husband, and now she has to provide food and look after her daughters on her own.

This entrepreneur defines herself as a persistent and courageous woman, and she says she will persevere until she achieves her main goal, which is to buy a house where her family can live comfortably. Ramona wants to keep supporting her daughters’ university studies until they graduate and can sustain themselves.

Ramona will use her loan to buy raw materials to keep producing food for her customers.

loans.use: To buy food for her cafe

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
For the past six years, Joyce A., has been running a small general store, selling milo, milk, and other provisions. Married with three children, she hopes to expand and increase her business in order to improve her family's situation. She is requesting $525 to buy additional goods to stock her shelves.

Joyce is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Niboa Group” that consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to stock her shelves.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is twenty-five years old and a mother of one child. She sells both fresh and fried yams in her village, and has done so for the past five years. She travels to Takyiman, in the northern part of Ghana, to buy the fresh yams and then resells them to people who needs them. She also fries some for children to buy.

Diana has run out of stock, so she wants to use her new loan to buy more tubers of fresh yams from Takyiman to avoid price hikes and for the lean season.

She is member of the group called Humility. Group members use peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Diana standing in front of her store.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of fresh yams.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica belongs to the “Mujeres Talentosas” (Talented Women) community bank, located in Santa Rosa of the Calleria district, in Ucayali. She is 20 years old and single. With the first S/. 300 loan received from Manuela Ramos she decided to use it to buy and sell clothing.

Her clothing store is one of the most visited in our area, because of the latest trends that can be found and exclusive designs that only Jessica's good taste can select. During the day she goes to the store with the help of her mom, and in the evening she studies to keep preparing as a professional and successful woman.

With this S/. 2,000 loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she plans to purchase clothing such as pants, skirts, tops, dresses, jewelry, hair accessories, bracelets, all from exclusive designs.

Jessica is very happy to belong to the community bank, because thanks to the loans she gets she is expanding her business and works without worries.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Jessica pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en la galería Santa Rosa, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 20 años, es soltera, es así que Jessica con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de ropas.

En la actualidad su puesto de venta que es uno de los mas visitados de nuestra región, por lo ultimo de la moda que se puede encontrar y modelos exclusivos que solo el buen gusto de Jessica puede tener. En las mañanas atiende su puesto con la ayuda de su mamá y en las noches se va estudiar para seguir creciendo como profesional y mujer exitosa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropas como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, vestidos, alhaja, accesorios para el cabello, pulseras, todo de modelos exclusivos.

Jessica esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que por medio de los préstamos que recibe esta haciendo crecer su negocio y trabaja con tranquilidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for clothing store

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmilla is very content to continue succeeding with her family business that she recently opened. It is a restaurant near her house and everyday in the afternoon she offers her distinguished guests chicken breast, her desire is to better this business and move it soon to a more central zone in the city so that she can continue strengthening her clientele and because of this she is requesting the loan. Help luzmila to succeedwith this new business that will surely bring her conmfort.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Luzmila, está muy contenta de seguir adelante con el negocio familiar que recientemente aperturó. Es un restaurante cerca de su casa y todos los días en las tardes ofrece a su distinguida clientela pollos a la braza, su deseo es mejorar este negocio y trasladarlo pronto a una zona más céntrica de la ciudad para lo cual seguirá esforzándose para ofrecerle lo mejor a su clientela y es por ello que solicita un préstamo. Apoya a Luzmila a seguir adelante con este nuevo negocio que está segura le traerá mucho bienestar.

loans.use: capital to better her restaurant

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. P., 45 years old, has been a member of TYM since 1998. Before, even though her husband was highly skilled in carpeting, because they were low in capital, their income wasn’t very high. After joining TYM, she used her loans to buy woods and new equipment for her husband’s business. With his experience and skill, most of his products are well liked and sold out quickly. Aside from helping her husband, she also plant vegetable and raise duck for extra income. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10 million VND to invest in breeding pigs and ducks. Her family income is about 3 million VND monthly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phương năm nay 45 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Trước đây chồng chị làm nghề mộc, tuy có tay nghề cao nhưng vì không có vốn nên chồng chị chỉ đi làm thuê cho thu nhập không cao. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu mua gỗ cho chồng chị làm nghề mộc. Nhờ có kinh nghiệm và khéo tay nên đồ gỗ nhà chị được nhân dân trong vùng rất ưa chuộng vì thế thu nhập của gia đình đã ngày càng được tăng lên, cuộc sống ngày càng được cải thiện. Ngoài thời gian phụ giúp chồng làm mộc để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình, tận dụng ruộng vườn rộng chị Phương đã mua thêm vịt về nuôi. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Hout

texts.en: Hout C., 25, is a young farmer who lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their two young children. Her husband is an electrician who operates out of Kampong Cham making US$3.50 per day, while her own farm can only generate US$0.50 per day. The electrician business is struggling with expansion, however, because they lack the capital necessary to purchase the proper tools and materials that the business needs. Hout C. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase these tools and materials to facilitate her husband's business and increase the family's income.

loans.use: Purchase electrical tools and materials

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: Wendy tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y habita en Las América III de la iglesia católica 1 c arriba, trabaja como enfermera en un centro de salud de Managua desde hace 2 años, sacó un curso de auxiliar de enfermería y ya pronto espera terminar sus estudios universitarios y luego poder sacar una maestría. Wendy vive en la casa de sus padres, la cual es muy pequeña, es por eso que Wendy decidió invertir en la construcción de una habitación para ella, que le pueda dar mayor comodidad tanto a ella como a su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy is 22 years old. She is single and lives in the Las America III neighborhood, one block from the Catholic church. She has been working as a nurse in a health clinic in Managua for the past two years. She took a course in assistant nursing and will soon finish her university studies, after which she will be able to get a masters degree. Wendy lives in her parent’s house, which is very small. That is why Wendy decided to invest in constructing a room for herself, which will make things more comfortable for both herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iniciar construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty L. is 25 years old. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, toffees, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, toffees, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her child in school.

Gifty L. belongs to the Trust group called "Biako Ye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to for the loan and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken when she was visited at her shop.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuits, toffees etc.

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en: Mrs. Saroem K. is a villager in Samroung village in Takeo Province. She is a 44 year old widow and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the other two children attend the local school. She owns a small piece of land for cultivating land. Even with these jobs, they still do not earn enough money to survive. Thus, Mrs. Saroem K. requests a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo A. tiene la edad de 48 años habita en San José los Ríos ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa Y hijos, la esposa de este señor trabaja como comerciante en el mercado Oriental, para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, al igual sus hijos le apoyan a la mamá y a él para no pagar personal que le ayuden a la agricultura. Don Juan trabaja como agricultor desde hace 25 años, sus planes para un futuro es llegar a comprar mas terreno para establecer mas cultivos y darle a cada uno de sus hijos la herencia. La mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 9,000.00 córdobas para comprar fertilizantes y venenos para aplicárselo al cultivo para que de buenos frutos y a si tener una buena cosecha, como una buena venta de sus frutos.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Pablo A. is 48 years old and lives in San José los Rios, which is in the municipality of Ticuantepe, with his wife and children. His wife works as a merchant in the Oriental market to help with the household expenses. Also, the children support their mother and help with the agriculture. Mr. Juan has been a farmer for 25 years. His plans for the future are to buy more land to plant more crops and to give each of his children an inheritance. His biggest problem is a lack of financing. He is requesting a loan of C$ 9,000.00 córdobas to buy fertilizers and poisons to apply to his crops so that he will have a good yield and, thus, have a good harvest, like a good sale of fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poisons and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Rosa Felisa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Felisa tiene 69 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Bendecidas II y vive en el distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio solamente el primer año de primaria, pero no continúo más debido a la falta de apoyo económico de parte de sus padres. Se casó a los 22 años y tuvo  2 hijas y 3 hijos, todos ya son casados.
Rosa Felisa vende condimentos molidos, tamales, fruta, verdura y vende animales cuando hay oportunidad.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 que fue cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró su cocina para poder trabajar.
Con este crédito de S/. 400, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, desea terminar de implementar para poder poner una bodega de golosinas.
Rosa sueña con tener una bodega para no ser ambulante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Felisa is 69, she is a member of the community bank Mujeres Bendecidas II (‘Blessed Women’) and lives in the El Porvenir district of the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Perú. She went to school only until the 1st grade because her family couldn’t afford her schooling. She married at 22 and has 2 daughters and 3 sons, all of whom are married. Rosa Felisa sells ground seasonings, tamales, fruit and vegetables, and animals when she has the chance. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which was repaid in 4 payments, she bought a stove for her work. With this loan of 400 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she hopes to finish installing a store to sell sweets. Rosa dreams of selling her products from a store instead of her hand cart.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up store to sell food products

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi A. est une jeune femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de produits cosmétiques à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et diversifier ses produits, Essi désire réapprovisionner sa boutique avec ce crédit. Elle compte sur cette opportunité afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Essi A. is a young woman of 39, married and the mother of two children. She owns a cosmetics boutique in Lomé, the Togolese capital. To meet the needs of her clients and diversify her products, Essi wants to restock her shop with this loan. She is counting on this opportunity to better provide for her children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products for retail.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra., Trinidad tiene 37 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación en la capital de Managua, con dos hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad que cursan la secundaria, su esposo es albañil, doña Trinidad trabaja de conserje en una Terminal de buses el Mayoreo que son los buses que viajan al norte del país, es un trabajo agotador pues desde la mañana hay que estar limpiado para dar un buen servicio de higiene  a los clientes. Con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda, y poder gozar de una casa digna para su familia que gracias a Afodenic esta logrando cumplir sus objetivos. Sus metas como madre es ver a sus hijos unos profesionales para que puedan tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. R. M. is 37 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliación in the capital of Managua. Her children are 15 and 18 years old; they live with her and attend high school. Her husband is a builder. She works as a caretaker in a large bus terminal, from which buses travel to the northern part of the country. Her work is exhausting because from the morning the terminal must be clean to give good service to the customers. With this loan she will purchase construction materials to improve her house and will be able to enjoy a decent house with her family. Thanks to Afodenic she is achieving her objectives. Her aim as a mother is to see her children become professionals, so they can have a higher standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to remodel her house

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach S. is 51 years old and resides in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with two of her children. She is a professional tailor and works from her home. She is able to make about US$11 every day. One of her children is a taxi driver and makes US$3 per day. Lach S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a sewing machine to expand her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine.

loans.name: Navi

texts.en:
Navi A. sells used clothing at Elmina and has been doing so since 2004.

She is married with six children and has received no formal education. Her husband works as a trader. She is responsible for helping to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used to buy additional stock to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand from her costumers.

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the purpose of expanding her trade.

loans.use: Buy additional used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé  de six femmes mariées. Elles vivent majoritairement  dans des familles monogamiques et  sont âgées en moyenne de 36 ans avec  4 enfants, vivant toutes dans le quartier Bamanankin du village de Togo (4ème région administrative du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  septième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé les six premiers.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter : 2 tonnes de graines de néré au grand marché de Ségou. Ces graines sont transformées en sounbala condiment très prisé et utilisé dans les sauces africaines. Les graines  de néré (obtenues à partir d’un grand arbre fruitier, protégé par la loi forestière du Mali) qui sont décortiquées, lavées et longuement cuites, sont ensuite pilées, lavées plusieurs fois  pour  être débarrassées de leurs épluches  et de tout corps étranger; cuites de nouveau et fermées hermétiquement dans un vase sans rouille pendant deux jours  puis  broyées, mises en boules, passées à la vapeur et séchées. Le sounbala ainsi fait est prêt pour la consommation. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes, à domicile, en ambulant au village et au grand marché de la ville de Ségou au bord du fleuve Niger à côté des vendeuses de calebasses. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour  le remboursement du prêt et la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales (savon, pétrole et habillements).
Elles ont pour ambitions  la construction d’une maison en tôle à usage  d’habitation.
texts.en:
This Benkadi group is composed of six married women. They live for the most part in monogamous families and have an average age of 36 with 4 children. All live in the Bamanankin district of the village of Togo (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other because of ties of marriage and neighborhood. With the intention of satisfying the needs of their clientele, the group decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their seventh solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first six. They intend to use this loan to buy 2 tons of néré seeds in the big open-air market of Ségou. These seeds are transformed into "sounbala", a condiment much esteemed and used in African sauces. The néré seeds (obtained from a tall fruit tree which is protected by the laws of the forest in Mali) are hulled, washed and cooked for a long time, then pounded and washed several times to get rid of their peels and any foreign matter. Then they are cooked again and hermetically sealed in a rust-free container for two days, then stirred, shaped into balls, steamed and dried. The resulting sounbala is ready for consumption. They sell for cash and credit to a clientele composed mainly of women, out of their homes, walking around the village, and in the big open-air market of the town of Ségou, and on the banks of the Niger River beside the women who sell gourds. They hope to make a monthly average profit of 17,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and cover certain family expenses (soap, gasoline, and clothing). Their ambition is to be able to build a house made of corrugated iron to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing néré seeds
